loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rosa; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía, ella  hace y también compra artesanía, la socia elabora a mano y también ya le traen sus proveedores diferentes tipos de arte local y andinos, son trabajos realizados en arcilla con motivos andinos que representar las vivencias de cada pueblo y el paisaje con sus típicos aves, nevados, cerros, animales y casas típicas. La socia también pinta según los diseños ella tiene su stand en el centro artesanal Inti Pakareq; La socia desea el crédito para poder hacer de el un capital de trabajo para implementar su stand y comprar adornos de cerámica y también materia prima para elaborar ella misma junto a su familia diversos trabajos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos trabajos de arcilla y también comprar materia prima.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "INTI QUILLA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Rosa is 45 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  Her business is buying and selling handicrafts.  She makes and also buys handicrafts.  She makes her items by hand and also receives different types of local and Andean art from her suppliers.  These are objects made with clay, bearing Andean motifs which represent the experiences of each village and the landscape with its typical birds, clouds, hills, animals and traditional houses.  Rosa also paints.  She has a stand in the Inti Pakareq craft center.

Rosa would like this loan so that she can use it as working capital to keep her stand running, buying ceramic ornaments and raw materials for making different crafts together with her family.

Rosa is happy to be receiving this loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy some ceramic ornaments and also to buy raw materials

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es: El Sr. Angel D. L. C., es una excelente persona y cliente distinguido D. esta institucion, ya es su segundo credito y se ha distinguido por el buen comportamiento en sus pagos, el tiene una carpinteria en el patio D. su casa, y necesita el credito porque le estan solicitando muchos trabajos y eso le favorece a el y a su familia, ya que es el sustento D. toda su familia y le hecha muchas ganas al trabajo, ya que asi es como ha incrementado a su clienteL.  y lo buscan ya que hace muy bonitos trabajos con L. madera, como cocinetas, closets, armarios, libreros, marcos D. puertas, es un excelente carpintero. y un excelente cliente.
texts.en: Señor Ángel D. L. C. is an excellent person and a distinguished client of our microfinance institution. This is already his second loan and he has a good repayment record. He has a carpenter workshop in his backyard. He needs this loan because he has attracted lots of orders, which is profitable for him and his family, because the high income from his work enables him to proviD. for his whole family. He was eager to expand his customer base, and his customers are in demand of his excellent work with wood, such as kitchens, closets, cabinets, bookcases and door frames. Ángel D. L. C. is an excellent carpenter and an excellent client.

loans.use: To buy materials for his carpenter workshop

loans.name: Julia Rita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Julia; La socia tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía y muñequería, también bisutería, la socia elabora a mano las muñecas de trapo con traje típicos, la socia trabaja junto a sus parientes ella gusta mucho de realizar estas muñecas con detalles muy distintivos, pero hay muchas ocasiones en las que la socia no se abastece y pide a sus proveedores que le vendan al por mayor diferentes trabajos hechos por gente local en sus pueblos de origen, la socia ahora desea el préstamo para poder comprar materiales para realizar sus muñecas y una de sus hijas hace los aretes a mano y también le dará parte del crédito para sus materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar sus trabajo de artesanía (muñecas de trapo y aretes).

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "INTI QUILLA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Julia is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Her business is buying and selling handicrafts, dolls and jewelry.  She makes rag dolls wearing traditional dress by hand.  She works together with her relatives and really enjoys making these dolls with very distinctive details.  However, there are many occasions when she can't make enough of them and then she asks her suppliers to sell her different work done by local people in their native villages wholesale.

Julia would like this loan so that she can buy material for making her dolls.  One of her daughters makes earrings by hand and she will give some of the loan money to her daughter so that she can buy materials.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making her handicrafts (rag dolls and earrings).

Julia is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in buying materials for making her handicrafts (rag dolls and earrings)

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Julio Cesar M. es una persona que desde chico aprendió el oficio de hacer unos ricos chicharrones y barbacoa para su venta al publico, desde entonces ha seguido el ramo de este negocio ahora al lado de su esposa e hijos, ya que les ha resultado muy productivo y de esta manera pueden estar juntos como familia mas tiempo, ahora, se quieren expander un poco mas ya que les ha ido aumentando la clientela  solicitando su producto hecho en casa, es por esta razón que el Sr. julio solicita su crédito ya que los anteriores los ha estado liquidando en excelente comportamiento. Y ahora se le presento una oportunidad de comprar más producto para vender y no quiere desaprovecharla.
texts.en:
As a young boy, Mr. Julio Cesar M. learned to make great tasting pork cracklings and barbecue meat. He has been in the business since then and now works with his wife and children.  The business has provided a good income and allowed the family to spend more time together.  

Julio is requesting a loan to increase production since there is much demand for his home-made product.  He has always paid back earlier loans in a timely fashion.  He plans to take advantage of an opportunity he is being given to buy more products so he can increase his customer base.

loans.use: To buy meat for pork cracklings and barbecue

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Mery; La socia tiene 42 años de edad, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la administración de su tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tiendita en su casa en el primer nivel, y junto a sus hijos ella puede atender la tienda y cumplir con sus labores domesticas, ella cocina atiende su hogar y también no descuida la tienda ella puso un timbre para que cuando alguien entre ella pueda salir de prisa para atenderlos, la socia solicita el crédito para implementar su tienda ella comprara, arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros para implementa r su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para implementar la tienda.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "INTI QUILLA" communal bank which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Mery is 42 years old and married with two children.  She owns and operates a small grocery store out of the first storey of her 
home.  With the help of her children she can run the store and take care of her household chores.  She has installed a buzzer so she can hurry and attend  to a customer as soon as he or she comes into the store.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, noodles and other products for her business.  She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy goods for retail sales

loans.name: Nora Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Nora Alicia es una persona muy seria y responsable ella tiene un niño chiquito, está casada y el motivo principal por el cual ella pidió el préstamo es para darle mayor seguridad a su propiedad ya que no tiene barda en la parte de enfrente de su casa, ella necesita hacerle una barda ya que donde ella vive pasan carros muy rápidos y tiene miedo que le vaya a pasar algo a su hijo.
texts.en: Señora Nora Alicia is a very serious and responsible person. She has a young son and is married. The main reason why she applies for this loan is to make her property more secure, because there is no fence in front of the house. She needs a fence because she lives on a road with fast-going traffic and she is afraid that something might happen to her son.

loans.use: To build a fence

loans.name: Minjin

texts.en: Minjin D. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in the Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house and enclosure. Her older son is a college student and her younger son attends a secondary school. Her husband helps with her shoemaking business, which Minjin operates from her home. She has been engaged in this business since 1992 and has gained a lot of experience as a shoemaker. After many years of hard work and a loyal customer base, she has built a stable operation with many permanent customers at the local market. Minjin is requesting a 2,750,000 MNT loan in order to purchase materials and supplies to make a variety of traditional boots.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Yang M., age 37, is a good mother to four children, and she always spends most of her time managing daily activities. Her daily duties include cooking meals, cleaning house, caring for her children, and controlling other property in and around her house. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction industry. She has one daughter who often generates income for Yang M. by working as a mobile hairdresser. Yang M.’s daughter wants to open a small shop to provide hairdressing services. Yang M. really wants to help her daughter but she doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, Yang M. is applying for a loan from Kiva to help her daughter open a small beauty salon.

loans.use: to help her daughter open a small shop

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a beauty salon. Her husband, Luvimin, who is 46 years old, works as a driver to earn a living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children, 18 and 21 years old.

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use to buy materials and supplies for her salon in order to continue to save up for her children's future education. Teresita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 3 businesses: an Internet cafe, cosmetic sales and tricycle. Her husband, Alfredo, who is 57 years old, works as a laborer to earn a living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 16 and 35 years old.

Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Elma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 27,000, which she intends to use to buy computer supplies in order to continue to save up for her children's future education. Elma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg J. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent (called a ger) in the Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her three children all attend school and her husband operates a glass trading business to supplement his family's income.

Altantsatseg currently operates a clothing retail business out of a stall at the Uguuj trade center. She started her business in 2005 and has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. For the future, she hopes to expand her business further. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items to sell for the upcoming New Year's holiday.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing items to sell

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fruit stand business.  

Her husband Reynaldo, who is 54 years old, works as a farmer and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 13 to 28 years old.

Bebelyn joined Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Bebelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, and lifted the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to buy a stock of fruits so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Bebelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org in order to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa F. is a married woman who lives in Yulo street, Brgy. 8, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a pig fattening business.

Her husband Hermilo, who is 36 years-old, works as a vendor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 6 to 16 years old. 

Elsa joined Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elsa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.

Her previous loan of PHP 27,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, lifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000, which she intends to use to buy piglets, chickens and a goat to raise so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and education of her children.

Elsa F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org in order to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her pig and livestock business.

loans.name: Oyunsaihan

texts.en:
Oyunsaihan T. is a 40 year-old single mother who lives with her two sons in Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

She and her family live together in a house with a fence. Her oldest son is a university student and the youngest son attends high school.

Oyunsaihan works as a sales manager in the Mongol Keramik company. Her company is a construction company which is dependent on the seasons and during her free months she operates a clothing trading business to supplement her earnings. With this loan, she plans to import clothing items from Erlian, a border city of China, in order to sell her products for upcoming holidays and celebrations. She has significant experience in her trade. 

In the future, she hopes to open her own store. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes from China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Legjiimaa

texts.en:
Legjiimaa B. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Selenge province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own apartment. All four children attend a local school. Legjiimaa and her husband operate a grocery sales business in their town, selling a variety of food products out of an outdoor stall at the local market. The stall is located in a popular spot that attracts many customers.

Legjiimaa started her business in 1992 and has since built a stable operation. Over many years, she has gained much experience in her trade and her earnings have enabled her to greatly improve her family's standard of living. Legjiimaa is a responsible and hardworking person and says, "Since I started to obtain loans from Xac Bank, my family's standard of living has improved; therefore, I really thank Xac Bank for supporting my business." She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of groceries (baked goods) to sell for upcoming big holidays and celebrations.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of groceries

loans.name: Otgontuya

texts.en: Otgontuya B., age 26, lives with her parents in the SonginoHairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, on a small plot of land which they own. Since 2002,  Otgontuya has been operating a clothing repair business in her home and now her mother helps her with the business. After many years of operation, she has gained significant experience as a tailor. For the future, she plans to expand her business and improve her equipment and tools. Otgontuya is a hardworking, modest and generous woman. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and supplies for her sewing and clothing repair business.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Set

texts.en:
Set S. is 39-year-old married woman. She lives with other family members in her own small home in Kompong Cham province. Set S. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as rice and morning glories, and she gets good results from her planting in both rainy and dry seasons. Her husband also helps her in the farming business.

The couple is married and has five children; four are single and one is married. They have two children employed in a garment factory who receive a regular salary every month and share their profit to support the whole family. However, they have no motorbike to get to work and hire a motor taxi driver every day. To reduce this travel expense, Set S. is requesting a loan for her children to purchase a used motorcycle to drive to work. Set S. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for driving to work

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita Q. is from the village of Ambalatungan Santiago City. She is 40 years old. Teresita is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Teresita is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a sales business, selling balot, or chicken embryo, a native Filipino food. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en: Sandagsuren R. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a house and enclosure. Her oldest son works as a teacher, her younger two children both attend university and her husband is a herder. Sandagsuren operates a meat trading business in her town. She sells a variety of meats to her customers in a rented stall at the local market. Tsevelmaa started her business in 2002 and has since gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. Her business currently operates at a stable level and her earnings have enabled her to not only pay her children's tuition fees but also to provide for her family. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve more meat in order to increase her sales so that she can continue to afford paying her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase and preserve more meat

loans.name: Tsegmed

texts.en: Tsegmed S. is 57 years old and lives with her son in the Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent and enclosure. Her son, age 36, works for the water cleaning company while Tsegmed owns and operates a clothing production business in her home. She has been working as a seamstress for 20 years and started her own business in 2004 based on her many years of experience. For the future, she plans to expand her production so that she can buy a shoemaking machine which will enable her to start another business. She is requesting an 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more fabrics and materials in order to make a variety of evening dresses for the upcoming New Year's holiday.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and materials

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Moeurn O., age 41, is married to Sem Lin, age 44, and both of them appear in the photo. Moeurn O. has four children, all single, and one of her children works in a garment factory, earning a fixed salary about $50 US per month. The other children attend school. 

Moeurn O.'s husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm tree climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in a commune. Presently, Moeurn O.’s husband is doing well. He wants to buy more ladders to climb the trees and more containers for the palm juice, which is why Moeurn O. is seeking a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more ladders and containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for retail sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and canned juices to sell and corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: Gloria Matilde

texts.es: Gloria Matilde F. M. de 65 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive junto a su hermana y una sobrina menor de edad.  Gloria es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, de no tener una familia propia, ha trabajado muy duro por salir adelante. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo, y también comercializa verduras a las afueras de su casa. Gloria solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y verduras, de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad ya que de esta forma podrá contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en: Gloria Matilde F. M. is 65 years old and lives in Ilopango, in the San Salvador department of El Salvador. She lives with her sister and young niece. Gloria is a very responsible and hardworking person. Without having a family of her own, she has worked very hard to get ahead. She owns a store selling foods such as bread and sweets, as well as toiletries such as soap and shampoo. She also sells vegetables outside her house. Gloria is requesting a loan for two uses: half will go towards stocking her store, and the other half for buying more corn and vegetables so she will be able to server her clients better. In this way, she will be able to improve her sales, which is her priority since this will enable her to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy products products for her general store.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S. is a 49-year-old married woman who currently lives with her family in the province of Kompong Cham. Yem S. earns an average daily profit of $1.50 per day by planting rice crops on her farmland which she inherited from her grandparent. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and he also earns an income of approximately $1.50 per day. They have five children; four are single and one is married. Three are employed in various jobs. Currently, Yem S. has a son who works as a construction worker and he has a problem because he doesn't have his own vehicle to travel to work. Yem S. wishes to encourage her son so she is applying for a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle, which will allow him to drive to his work location. Yem S. and her young son are in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her son to drive to work

loans.name: María Sonia

texts.es: María Sonia B. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Mejicanos en el departamento D. San Salvador, mismo lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, tres hijos menores D. edad, su hermana y dos sobrinos. María es una persona muy trabajadora quien posee su propio taller D. costura, así mismo se dedica a la venta y reparación D. máquinas D. coser, actividad la cual realiza junto a su esposo, quien venD. las máquinas D. cocer en el centro D. San Salvador. Así mismo María al elaborar ropa D. niños y ropa D. cama, sale a venderla en el centro D. San Salvador, en donD. la comercializa D. forma ambulante. María solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. contar con mayor materia prima para elaborar las prendas D. vestir, así mismo para comprar más maquinas D. coser y algunos repuestos, así D. esta manera tanto María como su esposo esperan mejorar su negocio, el cual es la única fuente D. ingresos que poseen.
texts.en: María Sonia B. D. M. is 34 years old and lives in Mejicanos, in the San Salvador department of El Salvador. She lives with her husband, three young children, sister, and two nephews. María is a very hardworking person who owns her own sewing shop. She also repairs and sells sewing machines with her husband who sells them in downtown San Salvador. Additionally, María makes children's clothing and bedding. She sells these items on the streets in downtown San Salvador. María is requesting a loan with the enormous wish of obtaining more materials to make garments with and to buy more sewing machines and some spare parts. In this way, María and her husband hope to improve their business which is the only source of income they have.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to make clothing with, and to buy sewing machines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for breakfast and lunch sales

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es: Rosa Angélica M., reside en el municipio de Soyapango, en donde vive junto a dos nietos de 16 y 12 años de edad, quienes se encuentran al cuidado de ella. Rosa muy trabajadora, se esfuerza día con día para contar con el sustento diario para ella y sus nietos. Rosa posee un negocio en el cual comercializa electrodomésticos tales como: ventiladores, licuadoras, batidoras y otras más, las cuales comercializa de forma ambulante en diferentes departamentos del país como Chalatenango, Cojutepeque y San Martín, lo cual hace de esta manera ya que así puede obtener más ganancias. Rosa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual compre mayor cantidad de electrodomésticos, lo que le permita hacer crecer la única fuente de ingresos que posee.
texts.en:
Rosa Angélica M. lives in the town of Soyapango and takes care of her two grandchildren, ages 16 and 12, who live with her.  Rosa is a hard worker and is the sole provider for herself and her grandchildren.

She owns and operates a small retail business and sells household appliances such as electric fans, juicers, mixers and other items.  She deals in door-to-door sales throughout the different departments of Chalatenango, Cojutepeque and San Martin.  She is requesting a loan to buy more appliances to increase the only means of income she has.

loans.use: To buy home appliances for retail sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fresh produce for retail sales

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela S. D. I. D. 29 años D. edad, es una joven madre muy responsable y calificada por excelente persona por parte D. sus vecinos. Ella vive junto a dos hijos D. 8 y 5 años D. edad, y así mismo vive junto a su esposo quien posee una farmacia, en la cual Blanca le ayuda en sus tiempos libres. Blanca se dedica a la venta D. ropa para hombres mujeres y niños, la cual venD. D. forma ambulante por diferentes pueblos y cantones D. Ahuachapán, mismo departamento en el que resiD., ha pesar que este es un trabajo muy riesgoso ella lo realiza con la mejor voluntad D. salir adelante y darle una vida mejor a sus hijos. Blanca solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar ropa por mayor, D. manera que pueda contar con más tallas, estilos y colores y así contar con más clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela S. D. I. is a hard-working 29-year-old mother who is considered to be an excellent person by her neighbors. She lives with her children, ages 8 and 5, and her husband, who owns a pharmacy where Blanca helps out in her free time.

Blanca sells mens', womens' and childrens' clothing throughout the different towns and cantons in Ahuachapán Province.  Even though it is a risky business she is willing to do what is necessary in order to proviD. a better lifestyle for her children.  Blanca plans to use the loan she requested through Integral to buy clothing on a wholesale basis, and offer more variety in terms of size, style and color so she can increase her customer base.

loans.use: To buy clothing for retail sales

loans.name: Sandra Maritza

texts.es: Sandra Maritza B. Z. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán donde vive junto a sus tres hijos todos menores de edad, por quienes trabaja muy duro para sacarlos adelante y darles una vida estable. Sandra posee una venta de zapatos para hombres y mujeres, la cual comercializa en el centro de Ahuachapán, en donde posee muchos clientes fijos, quienes compran constantemente sus productos. Sandra es madre soltera muy responsable y trabajadora quien cuenta con el enorme deseo darle lo mejor a sus hijos, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más zapatos, obteniendo estilos de moda, lo cual le haga más fácil su venta. De esta forma ella espera contar con más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Maritza B. Z. is 34 years old and lives with her three minor aged children in the department of Ahuachapán.  She works hard to provide an income for them and to give them a stable lifestyle.  Sandra sells men's and women's shoes out of her retail business in downtown Ahuachapán, where she has many fixed customers who buy many of her products.

Sandra is a very hard-working, responsible mother who wants to provide the best for her children.  She plans to use the loan to buy more fashionable styles to increase sales.  Her aim is to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy shoes for retail sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and skincare products for retail sales

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim P. has been working in the farming business for many years. She and her husband always spent most of their lives working on their own farmland. They can earn an income about 3.50 per day in order to support the entire family. They are blessed with five kids, all of whom are unmarried. Three of the children are working at different occupations, and they often use their cash to help with the monthly expenses. Sim P. will be using her loan, in addition to her personal savings, to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loan will provide her with an additional new asset. Sim P. and her lovely daughter are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde B. L. de 71 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. El señor Matilde, se dedica a la venta ambulante de cinchos de cuero, los cuales comercializa en Jiquilisco y en el mercado regional de Usulután. Él vende los cinchos de lunes a domingo, aprovechando los fines de semana en que los parques y mercado cuentan con más afluencia de personas. Matilde es un señor muy trabajador el cual desea mucho contar con una vida estable junto a su esposa, por lo que solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda invertir en la compra de más cinchos. Matilde tiene grandes esperanzas de mejorar su negocio y poder vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Matilde B. L. is 71 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután with his wife, who is a homemaker.

Mr. Matilde is a leather strap peddler in Jiquilisco and at the regional market in Usulután.  He sells his goods Monday through Sunday, taking advantage of weekends because of the greater affluence of people in parks and markets.

Matilde is a hard worker who wants to provide a stable income for his wife.  He is requesting a loan through Integral to buy more straps.  Matilde has high expectations of improving business and having a better lifestyle.

loans.use: Leather strap sales

loans.name: Shirly's Group

texts.en:
Shirly M. is from the village of Brgy. Sta. Lucia, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Shirly is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Shirly is separated from spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Shirly owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ice cream to the local community. Shirly has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Shirly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Shirly is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Shirly from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita L. is from the village of Dapaon. She is 44 years old. Arcelita is a group member of PMPC. Arcelita is married and has two children who are still studying. To make a living, Arcelita owns a business raising hogs. She operates the business by herself with some help from her children.

Arcelita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Arcelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arcelita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed and other necessities for the pigs. This will be Arcelita's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila T. owns a motorcycle which is operated by her husband on a day-to-day basis to make their living. Leonila is 47 years old, married and has four children. They are from the village of Dapaon. She is a group member of PMPC. Leonila has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Leonila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for maintainance and repair of the motorcycle. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional income to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Maintainence and repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria S. owns and operates a general store selling different products in her community. She is from the village of Dapaon. Gloria is 50 years old, married and has five children. Two of them are already married, while the other two are still in school. Only one of them is working and helping earn the family's living. Gloria is a group member of PMPC. She has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ellaindina's Group

texts.en: Ellaindina O. owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Ellaindina has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Ellaindina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ellaindina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve the general living conditions of her family. Ellaindina is the leader of a seven member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is from the village of Lagag. She is 42 years old, and is married, with four children. Rosie is a group member of PMPC. To make a living, she owns and operates a farm.

Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for the plants. This will be Rosie's fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to buy fertilizers and insecticide spray.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn T. and her granddaughter are pictured in the photograph. Sorn T. is a widow who operates a farming business. Sorn T. was married, but her husband died several years ago. She has three children: one is married and lives away from home, and the other two are single. Sorn T. depends on one son who works as a horse cart driver. He always uses his horse cart as the main vehicle for picking up both his customers and the many items for earning his daily income. Recently, Sorn T.’s son has been facing difficulties transporting his customers, because his horse cart is slow and that affects how he can satisfy the needs of his customers. Sorn T. really wants to help her son but she doesn’t have sufficient money to make it possible. To solve this problem, Sorn T. decided to request a loan for her son to add to her savings so that she can buy a motorcycle. This motorcycle will be connected with the existing horse cart so that her son can provide faster transportation and meet his clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to connect with an existing horse cart.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia E. is from the village of Mandih. She is 64 years old, and a widow with four children. Bonifacia is a group member of PMPC. To make a living, Bonifacia owns and operates a fish vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community.

Bonifacia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Bonifacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonifacia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be Bonifacia's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila P. is 38 years old, married and has one child. She is from the village of Poblacion on the island of Mindanao. To make a living, Mila dries and sells fish. She also receives a salary as a public school teacher.

Mila has been engaged in her dried fish business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Mila is requesting a new loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 20,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe L. is 55 years old, married and has six children. She is from the village of Poblacion on the island of Mindanao. To make a living, Maria Fe sells a variety of different dried foods to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Maria Fe joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan, her third from PMPC, of 15,000 PHP that will be used to purchase more fish. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is forty years old, married and has three children. She is from the village of Pangalalan within the municipality of Sindangan, a part of Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Evelyn sells a variety of different products from her sari-sari to the local community. She has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 9,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan, her fourth from PMPC, of 30,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory for her shop and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Tessie Iniego's Group

texts.en:
Tessie I. is 56 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the village of Aggub, a part of the municipality of Solano, Nueva Vizcaya province on the Luzon islands. Tessie is the group leader of a thirteen-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Tessie makes and sells barbecue pork and chicken. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Tessie joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her barbecue pork and chicken. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her barbecue chicken and pork

loans.name: Adebiet

texts.en:
Adebiet S. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. His four children attend a local secondary school.

Adebiet operates a meat trading business in his town with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1998 and has since built a stable operation. After these many years of operation, he has gained much experience in his trade.

People usually prepare their meat for winter between December and March, and therefore during those months the price of meat falls. Adebiet plans to buy a large amount of horse and sheep meat at a cheap price and preserve those frozen meats to sell in the upcoming spring months when the price of such a product is very high.

So Abediet is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of meat to sell this spring. In the future he hopes to have his own cellar that can contain a large amount of meat.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Ephantus Sandika

texts.en:
Ephantus Sandika M. is 52 years old, married to Evagerine and they have four children. Ephantus has been in the carving business for the last 13 years. He has been carving sculptures for sale in a semi permanent premise in Nyali, Mombasa and has been doing well.



This marks Ephantus' second loan from KADET, and he plans to purchase more art materials for carving the sculptures. 


He hopes to direct the anticipated profits to his children’s school fees.His dream is to own a permanent business premise where he can make, display and sell his wares.

loans.use: To purchase more art materials for carving

loans.name: Carren Achieng

texts.en:
Carren has been selling fish in Naivaha town for the last three years. She is 31 years old, single, and mother of three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a new fishing net.

In the future, Carren hopes to be a big supplier of fish in Navaisha town.

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Eseno Ene

texts.en:
Eseno Ene has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last 12 years. She is 43 years old and married to Silila Ole M.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy two cows, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Eseno hopes to be a leading distributor of beef in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy two cows, which she will rear and later sell at a profit

loans.name: Sesoi Ene

texts.en:
Sesoi Ene has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last four years. She is 52 years old and married to Musama Mereu. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan amount to buy sheep, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Sesoi hopes to run a curio shop parallel to her livestock farming to diversify her sources of income.

loans.use: To buy sheep, which she will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Vienna

texts.en:
Vienna is a 44-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: Lechon Manok Vending, Food Vending, and Buy & Sell Cake business. She lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF. By working hard in her Lechon Manok Vending, Food Vending and Buy & Sell Cake businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 30,000 PHP. Vienna is borrowing 25,000 PHP so she can fund operations. This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her most recent loan of 29,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Vienna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman who lives in Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a tricycle transport business. Her husband Nicolas, who is 49 years old, works as a helper to earn his living. They have five children who are between 2 and 25 years old. 

Clarita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Clarita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,300 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to purchase a motorcycle for the business so that she can continue to save up for new business ventures and the education of her children. Clarita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Luzviminda

texts.en:
Ma. Luzviminda is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: pig fattening and a general store. Her husband Bonifacio A., who is 41 years old, works as a welder to earn his living. They have 3 children who are between 14 and 23 years old. One child has a family and the other 2 are currently going school. 

Ma. Luzviminda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Luzviminda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to increase funds in business operations so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and the family. Ma. Luzviminda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To increase funds for business operations

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is 58 years old, married, and supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living condition with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Medina would like to borrow PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her store. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Medina aspires to elevate her family's living condition and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gemalyn's Group

texts.en:
Gemalyn J. is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Gemalyn is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gemalyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gemalyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Gemalyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gemalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Gemalyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gemalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santamo Ole

texts.en:
Santamo has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last 10 years. He is 37 years old and married to Malarito Ene Sanatamo. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy goat meat to sell.

In the future, Santamo hopes to open more butcher shops around Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy goat meat to sell

loans.name: Marithah

texts.en: Marithah A. O. is forty three years old. She is married and they have five children aged between twenty years old and ten years old. Her business is located in the town of Kakamega, which is in the region in Kenya known for production of sugarcane that is well known as the sugarbelt region. Marithah sells clothes and school uniforms to the local residents. She has been in this business for eight years now. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area with the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 60,000 to buy school uniforms to sell as the school will open soon. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and purchase land. She describes herself as a hardworking and visionary lady.

loans.use: School uniforms

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman who lives in Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Marcelo, who is 39 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have five children who are between 2 and 18 years old. Evangeline joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evangeline has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 5,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Evangeline is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: To purchase more stock for the general store

loans.name: Melelta Ole

texts.en:
Melelta, 32, has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last six years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy five cows, which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Melelta hopes to run his livestock business in a profitable manner.

loans.use: To buy five cows, which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.en:
Francisca R. is from the village of Sinippil, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Francisca is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Francisca is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a direct selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetic products such as talc powder, lotions and make-up kits in the local community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur B. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, in Uvurkhangai province in Mongolia. His eldest daughter, age 13, attends a local secondary school. He and his family live together in a house and fence. With the help of his wife, Enhtur operates a successful tourist camp business in his town. He opened his tourist camp in 1999, operating with only two gers (a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling) on his father's plot of land. After years of operation, his business has proven very profitable. Therefore, he was able to buy more land and erect more gers next to Erdenezuu, which is an ancient Buddhist temple. Additionally, he has also built a winter house that is connected with a hot and cold water system. 

Enhtur now has contracts with tourist companies in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Those companies send foreigners and tourists to his camp. His earnings have enabled him to buy a car and greatly improve his family's standard of living. For the future, he plans to expand his business by building a restaurant in his camp. 

Enhtur also works for the local history museum to supplement his earnings. Enhtur is a modest and hardworking man and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to repair and decorate the shower rooms for his tourist camp.

loans.use: To repair and decorate the shower rooms

loans.name: Munguntsetseg

texts.en: Munguntsetseg D. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence, in the Yaarmag of Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband operates a taxi service, while her oldest daughter works as a salesperson. Munguntsetseg operates a photography business in Suhbaatar's square, Ulaanbaatar's central area, where she takes people's pictures. Both she and her husband earn a minimum of 20,000 MNT profit per day. She has been working as a photographer since 1994 and has gained much experience. Munguntsetseg is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to improve her husband's car.

loans.use: To improve her husband's car

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en:
Genelita is a 43-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,400 PHP. 

Genelita is borrowing 10,000 PHP so she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 4,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Genelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nchiroine Ole

texts.en:
Nchiroine Ole has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last year. He is 38 years old and married to Ipat Ene Nchiroine. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy goats, which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Nchiroine hopes to practice large scale livestock farming.

loans.use: To buy goats, which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Zubadahan's Group

texts.en:
Zubadahan T., 54, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised five children, the youngest daughter is at school and the others are employed. Fifteen years ago, with an initial investment of 1000 soms, Zubadahan started to sell convenience goods. Now her monthly profit is 5000 soms. She has applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase more goods to increase her inventory. In the future, Zubadahan wants to expand her business and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
