If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Delgermurun

texts.en: Delgermurun S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in an apartment in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Delgermurun operates an energy device trading business. She started her business in 2007 and has gained significant experience. She is a very talented and smart woman who can speak Chinese as well as her native language. She has been achieving small and medium tenders related to her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business by advertising through TV, newspaper and other media devices. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to use for cost offsets which have risen due to importing more energy devices from China.

loans.use: To import more energy devices from China

loans.name: Harison

texts.en:
Harison is 23 years old, single, and supporting five members of his family. He runs a retail shop, and has been in business for six years. Right now, his monthly income is 8,500 KES.

He is borrowing a loan of 30,000 KES and plans to use it to purchase the following goods: 6,000 KES for sugar, 5,000 KES for milk, 7,000 KES for flour, 3,000 KES for salt, 4,000 KES for cooking oil, and 5,000 KES for powder soap.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business. This is his second loan, and he successfully repaid his previous loan. His dreams and hopes are to have a big business and a nice family.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul J., 47, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised three sons; the younger son studies at school and the other sons are working in Russia. 

Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Aigul began cultivating rice, sunflowers and corn. Selling her harvest, she makes 15,000 soms per month. Aigul applied for the loan because she needs money to begin repairing her house. With money received from the loan, she will purchase building materials: cement, schist, etc. In the future she plans to purchase a piece of land for seeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gunjidmaa

texts.en:
Gunjidmaa G. is 44 years old and lives with her father and two children in Har-horin, the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire. Her father is retired, and her two sons are both university students. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. 

Gunjidmaa currently operates a meat trading business in her town. Initially she sold her meat only through her stall. But after years of hard work, she now purchases meat and other animal products in bulk from herders in the countryside, and transports it to Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia, where she sells it. Gunjidmaa started her meat trading business in 1995 by selling out of a rented stall at the market in her town. 

In 2006 Gunjidmaa suffered a major injury which resulted in a stop to operating her business for two years. She restarted her business in 2008 and has built a stable operation. After many years of operation, her earnings have enabled her to not only provide for her entire family, but also pay her two sons' tuition fees. 

Gunjidmaa is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat and meat products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and meat products

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en:
Dorjpalam S. is 55 years old and lives with her mother in a house with a fence in Har-horin sum, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son currently works and lives in Korea. Dorjpalam operates a clothing business from a rented stall in the market in her town with the help of her daughter. She manages her business and has established herself in the business community. She sells a variety of clothing items that are imported from China. She has been engaged this business since 2000 and has gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Dorjpalam is a modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import more clothing items from China for selling during the New Year holiday.

loans.use: To import more clothing items from China

loans.name: Otgontsend

texts.en:
Otgontsend D. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home and fence in Yaarmag in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His younger three children all attend school while his eldest son works in the rural area.

Otgontsend operates a coal and firewood trading business. He started this business in 1995 and has since gained a lot of experience in his trade. All the family members help him with the business. Otgontsend is a hardworking man and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of coal and wood before prices for such products rise.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of coal and wood for reselling

loans.name: Sanjidmaa

texts.en: Sanjidmaa L. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their house and fence in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, in the Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. Her son is a university student and her daughter attends a local secondary school. Her husband works as a fireman for the local museum and Sanjidmaa operates a souvenir products trading business between April and October, which is a seasonal business. In addition, she sells a variety of shoes from her home during winter months to supplement her earnings. She started her souvenir trading business in 1998 and has since built a stable operation. Her earnings have enabled her to buy her own car for her family. She is a modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more souvenir products for her business.

loans.use: To buy more souvenir products

loans.name: James Kasis

texts.en:
James Kasis S. is a 35-year-old man, married to Millicent Chemutai. Together they have four children and live in the Kapomboi area of the town of Kitale. He sells used clothes in the same area. James has been in this business for five years now and gets a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This will be James's first loan from KADET, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy two bundles of used clothes worth 25,000 KES, to 1,000 KES for transport and 5,000 KES to buy shirts and trousers for resale. 

With the income he is going to get he plans to expand the business by adding more stock and also to buy a plot of land later on. In the future, James wants to be a wholesaler and also to educate his children at higher levels, like taking them to university.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for resale

loans.name: Horloo

texts.en:
Horloo S. is 60 years old and lives with her husband and adult daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home with a fence, in Yaarmag, in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends the university and her husband is retired after working for the Mongolian military.  

Horloo operates a recycling business. She purchases a variety of secondary raw materials at her shop and sells those materials to the processing companies for a profit. 

With the help of her siblings, she will use this loan to start another business of coal and firewood trading to supplement her earnings. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to start her new business in the future.

loans.use: To start operating a coal and firewood trading business

loans.name: Nakinyi Ene

texts.en:
Nakinyi Ene has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last one year. She is 36 years old and married to Kiranto Ole L.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy goats and sheep, which she will sell later at a profit.

In the future, Nakinyi hopes to practice zero grazing and increase her produce.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep, which she will sell later at a profit

loans.name: Soyolmaa

texts.en:
Soyolmaa P. lives with her husband and two sons in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her sons both attend a local high school. Soyolmaa supports her family by operating a shoe making business. 

Since 2002 she used to work as a helper in a cafe, and during the winter months she worked in the shoe making factory as a shoemaker. Based on her previous work experience she started her own business. She will use this loan to buy more supplies and materials for her shoe making business.

Soyolmaa is a modest person and says, "I want to be able to afford to send my sons to the university." She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and tools for her shoe making business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and tools

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. K. is thirty years old. She is married to a doctor and they have two children, age 9 and 7, for whom they hope to provide a good education to the university level. 

Her business is located in Seveni in Busia and she is served by the Kakamega branch. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for the production of sugar cane and is well known as the sugar belt region. She sells timber at wholesale prices to retailers. She has been in this business for five years now and has five employees. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is transportation, since timber is bulky and heavy. 

She works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy more timber to meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and purchase land to build a residential house. She describes herself as honest and industrious.

loans.use: To buy more timber for resale

loans.name: Tanatar

texts.en:
Tanatar K. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home and fence. His oldest son works while two younger children both attend a local school. 

Tanatar operates a small wooden products production business in his home where he produces a variety of wooden items such as beds, chairs, tables and doors. He has been engaged this business for the past eight years and has gained significant experience during that time. In the future, he says, " I want to establish my own carpentry factory." 

He plans to buy a large amount of wood and timbers for the production of his wooden items, so he is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and materials

loans.name: Negimas Ene

texts.en:
Negimas has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town for the last year. She is 56 years old and married to Kapawaua Ole T.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy cabbages, onions and carrots to sell.

In the future, Negimas hopes to grow her business and even build a structure from which to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions and carrots

loans.name: Kanygul

texts.en:
Kanygul B.  was born in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is a 56-year-old 'deserved mother' of seven children (such a title is given to those women who have more than five children). After graduating from college, Kanygul worked in the trading sphere for a long time. Her colleagues characterized her as a very diligent and responsible person. 

In 1992, using a starting capital of only 5,000 KGS, Kanygul started her business of cultivating potatoes, beans, tomatoes, cucumbers and carrots.  She concentrated all her efforts on supporting and improving her household. For this very reason, Kanygul wants to take out a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy mineral supplements to fertilize her land. It will allow her to provide high-quality products to the local market and to obtain new customers.  With the revenues from this investment, Kanygul plans to give higher education to her children. In the future, Kanygul plans to develop her farm in one more direction of agriculture by engaging in livestock breeding.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: John Kinyua

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He is 28 years old and married to Faith Nyambura. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and ferilizer for planting.

In the future, John hopes to practice farming in a more profitable way, such as by using technology to increase his yield.

loans.use: To buy seeds and ferilizer for planting

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren A. A. is twenty-nine years old. She is married to a carpenter and they have four children between the ages of eight months and eleven years, for whom they hope to provide a good education to the university level.

Her business is located at Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for the production of fish from Lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. Caren owns a restaurant in which she sells food to construction workers and local people. She has been in this business for six years now and has three employees. She says that this business is profitable, and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy ingredients for making food to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. She describes herself as an honest and humble lady.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Nting'oondu Ole

texts.en:
Nting'oondu, 22, has been rearing animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last five years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy five cows, which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Nting'oondu hopes to practice livestock trading in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy five cows for rearing

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
Cholpon S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Cholpon, 40, is married. Her husband works in Russia. She takes care of four daughters and a son.  In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Cholpon sells dairy products. In this way she makes about $110 per month. She is also engaged in livestock breeding. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase six sheep in order to increase the number of livestock. In the near future Cholpon plans to start building a house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Erdentsetseg is 51 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a studio apartment, which they rent. Her husband Nasantogtokh works along with her. She operates a paper and book shop near the college and school area. Her regular customers are all students. She has been operating this business for nine years and has gained a lot of experience. Erdenetsetseg is planning to purchase her own studio apartment with her savings. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment and more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and more products

loans.name: Urmathon's Group

texts.en:
Urmathon A. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south part of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 51, married, and has six children with her husband. Their children went to work in Russia. Urmathon works as a nurse, but in order to make additional money, the family breeds cattle. Urmathon wants to purchase cattle for breeding with the proceeds from the loan. In the future she wants to improve the family’s living conditions and a purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. O. is twenty six years old. She is married to a businessman and they have four children between one and nine years old. They hope to give their children a good education at the university level. 

Judith's business is located in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for its fish production from Lake Victoria, and is well known as the lake basin. She owns a tailoring shop where she makes and sells clothes. She has been in this business for six years and has two employees. She says that this business is profitable and her only major challenge is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well, and she describes herself as an honest and humble lady.

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy materials for making clothes to meet the demand of her customers. She sees her business growing to a big fashion house.

loans.use: Cloth materials

loans.name: Donohon's Group

texts.en:
Donohon K. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 42 and married, and her husband earns money by providing transportation services. Together they have four children.

Ten years ago, Donohon started to sell convenience goods with the initial investment of 8000 soms. She now earns 15000 soms per month. The profit has made it possible for her to improve the family’s living conditions. With the proceeds from this loan, she wants to purchase additional inventory to increase product turnover. In the future she wants to start building a house for her sons.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen A. O. is 28 years old, single and has a three-year-old child to whom she hopes to provide a quality education to university level. Hellen's business is located at Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for fish production from Lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. 
Hellen owns a grocery store in which she sells eggs, tomatoes, onions, kale and green vegetables. She has been in this business for four years now. She says that her business is profitable and the only major challenge she faces is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more vegetables to meet customer demand. She hopes to expand her business, get married and start a beautiful family. She describes herself as an honest and humble lady.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Harrison Mwangi

texts.en:
Harrison has been selling cereals in Naivasha town for the last year. He is 44 years old and married to Joyce Wanjiru. They have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy maize, beans and rice in bulk to sell.

In the future, Harrison hopes to grow his business and become a big dealer of cereals in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and rice in bulk to sell

loans.name: Dinar Isakova's Group

texts.en:
Dinar I. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 51 and married to a cattle breeder. Together they bring up two sons: the elder is a removal man who earns 5,000 KGS per month and the younger son studies at school. Dinar herself earns money by selling agricultural products. She started this activity five years ago with an initial investment of 8,000 KGS, and now she earns 15,000 KGS per month. With this loan, Dinar wants to purchase carrots, potatoes and onions for sale. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land and build a house there.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Faridahan Mamatova's Group

texts.en:
Faridahan M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 43 and married to a tractor driver. Together they bring up two sons. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Faridahan breeds livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening, she earns 5,000 KGS per month. This profit has made it possible for her to save money and purchase construction materials for building a house. With this loan, Faridahan wants to purchase livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to finish building a house for her sons.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily A. O. is 37 years old, widowed and has four children aged between 5 and 15. She hopes to give her children a quality education to university level. Her business is located at Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for fish production from Lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. 
Emily owns a salon where she does ladies' hair. She has been in this business for six years now. She says that her business is profitable and the only major challenge she faces is lack of equipment due to financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy salon equipment to meet customer demand. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Emily describes herself as an honest and humble lady.

loans.use: To purchase salon equipment

loans.name: Mavludahon Mirzamahmudova's Group

texts.en:
Mavludahon M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 39, married, and has one daughter and two sons. Her daughter works in a sewing workshop and her sons study at school.
Mavludahon works in a bakery with her husband. She has applied for a loan because she needs money to start repairing a shed. In the future she wants to see her children get married.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff. .

loans.use: To repair a shed

loans.name: Salamat's Group

texts.en:
Salamat A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a nice ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 54 and is married to a security guard. Together they have raised two sons, both of whom work in construction. In order to earn money, Salamat cultivates and sells agricultural products. In this way, she earns 3000 KGS per month. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs extra money for purchasing a vehicle. In the future she wants to repair the house and celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle

loans.name: Nelson Njoroge

texts.en:
Nelson has been selling shoes in Naivasha town for the last two years. He is 36 years old and married to Loise Wanjiku. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of 40,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more shoes to sell.

In the future, Nelson hopes to build his own shop from which to operate and save on paying rent.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Emily Jeptum

texts.en:
Emily Jeptum K. is a 32-year-old woman, married to Philip Kiptoo. Together they have one child. She offers financial sevices (M-PESA) to people in the Moi's Bridge area of Kitale Town. She has been in this business for two years now and gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES from the business.

Emily has been with KADET for three years now, and this will be her third loan. She plans to use the entire loan to boost her business by adding more money to it. With the income she is going to get, she plans to pay school fees for her child. 

In the future, she wants to raise her family's living standards and expand her business to other marketplaces and towns.

loans.use: To establish an "M-PESA" outlet

loans.name: Swaydan

texts.en:
Swaydan is a 50-year-old single man from Baalbeck. He has owned a grocery store since 2000, and has 15 years of experience in this field.  His clients like dealing with him because he is honest and has a good reputation.  

Swaydan works for his living. He had a dream of improving his business and providing himself a secure, healthy living, but his financial situation has been hard to improve because of the unstable political situation in the region. 

Swaydan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to improve his business, hoping he can accomplish part of his dream. He will add new products requested by most of his clients, and he will try hard to make his business successful.

loans.use: To add new products

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 52 years old. He lives with his wife and six of their children in Kibera, which is in the outskirts of Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. John and his wife have operated a grocery business in Kibera for a number of years. It is mostly managed by his wife  while John is involved in other work. With this loan, John wishes to buy more groceries to grow the business.

loans.use: to boost his wife's grocery business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 22 years old. He is a single young man who is quite ambitious. David produces and sells comedy VCDs. For the past three years, he has been both performing comedy and recording plays for sale. David is very talented and also is a farmer to earn extra income. He does his work from Gitiha center in Kiambu.

A friend introduced David to KADET LTD and he is now requesting a second loan to cast a comedy to record and sell out. If this loan improves his business, David plans to invest more into his farming activities. David hopes that his comedy work will expand into a stable business that will make him famous.

loans.use: to produce comedy VCD

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter C. is 30 years old.  He is married to Rodah, who is a famer.  They are blessed with four school-going children between 11 and six years old.  He is a carpenter and has been in this business for five years.  Right now his monthly income from the business is KSH 12,000.

Peter is requesting a loan for Kshs 15,000 and plans to use it to purchase timber and workshop materials. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and farming activity. This is his second loan.  He successfully repaid his previous loan well and in good time. 

Peter's hopes and dreams are to educate his children for a better life, and to engage in a bigger business like owning a supermarket.

loans.use: To expand the workshop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. A. is a married woman. She has three children between the ages of 2 and 11. She hopes to give them a quality education to the university level. 

Her business is located in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for production of fish from Lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. She owns a grocery store in which she stocks vegetables, eggs, salt, cooking fat, etc. She has been in this business for two years now. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is the lack of a permanent stall from which she can run her business. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She plans to use her loan of KES 20000 to restock her business to meet her customers' demands. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She also sees herself owning a house. She describes herself as an honest and God-fearing lady.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, eggs, salt and cooking fat for resale

loans.name: Stephen Kiragu

texts.en:
Stephen has been selling cereals in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 45 years old and is married to Ruth Njeri. They have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to restock his shop with beans and maize.

In the future, Stephen hopes to be a leading supplier of cereals in Naivasha.

loans.use: To restock shop with beans and maize

loans.name: Sizanani Group

texts.en:
Sithembile is 44 years old, married with five children, ages 11 to 23 years. Her husband works in a factory. She sells chickens in Eshowe in South Africa. Sithembile, the leader of her borrowing group, is raising her hand in the photo above.

She's been in this business for a year and sells from her home. She also earns income from the government's children grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is clients who do not pay after buying on credit.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses and Kiva to buy chickens. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children  to university and buy enough food for her family. In the future, she would like to sell new products and have more clients.

She will thank WDB and Kiva if they will make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for resale

loans.name: Zanele Group

texts.en:
Bongisiwe is 32 years of age and married with four children between the ages of 1 and 12 years. She runs a blocks manufacturing business from her home. She also earns an income from the government's child support grant and has four dependents that she takes care of. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy materials for making cement blocks. Bongisiwe would like to buy a tractor for her business in five years time. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children to high school and university, and she hopes for a bright future.

She added that she will be faithful to KIva and WDB. She is the leader of her borrower group and is raising her hand in the photo above.

loans.use: To purchase material for making blocks

loans.name: Sibongokuhle Group

texts.en:
Angeline is 42 years old and is standing on the right side of the photo above, lifting up her hand. She is married with three children between 2 and 13 years old. 

She runs a plowing business from her home and has been in this business for six years. She also earns income from the government's child support grant and takes care of seven relatives.

She says that the main challenge to her business is that she has no vehicle for selling her products. 

She has requested this loan through WDB AND Kiva to hire a plowing vehicle. In five years time, she would like to see herself living in a  better home. She also appreciates WDB and KIVA for helping her.

loans.use: To hire a plowing vehicle

loans.name: Peter Mwangi

texts.en:
Peter has been operating his food stall in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He is 25 years old and is married to Milka Wanjiku. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend.   This will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 20,000 in full and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy cooking oil and flour in bulk.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his food stall so he can serve many customers at the same time.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and flour in bulk

loans.name: Ayanda Group

texts.en:
Ntombi is 49 years old and married with eight children from 2 to 24 years old. She also looks after four relatives. In the photo above, she is standing on the right, raising her hand. Her husband works as a builder. She runs a retail business selling chickens. She also earns an income from the government's old age and child support grant. 

She requested this loan to buy chickens. The extra income from this loan will help her send her children to university and will build a big house for her children. In five years she would like to see her business grow and sell blankets.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Mbalenhle Group

texts.en:
Nombulelo is the leader of her borrowing group and is standing in the center of the photo above. She is 42 years old and has six children, ages 5 to 18 years. Her husband works as a welder, and Nombulelo has been operating a corner store for four years in Hlabisa, South Africa.

She sells frozen products, cosmetics, refreshments and prepaid airtime for cell phones from her shop at her home. She hopes in the future to expand her shop into a big shop and to add more products. Currently she faces problems with competition and late payments from clients. 

Nombulelo has requested a loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase airtime, frozen products, and chickens to increase her stock. She hopes that the extra income generated from this loan will help her to build a big house for her family and pay educational fees for her children.

She appreciates the opportunity that WDB and Kiva give her. She has seen the green light for her and her family's lives.

loans.use: To purchase airtime, frozen products and chickens

loans.name: Yaakoub

texts.en:
Yaakoub is a 29-year-old married man, living in Baalbeck with his wife and three children. 

Yaacoub owns a sawmill, which belonged to his father since 1985, and he has 15 years of experience in this field. 

Yaakoub’s business is doing well since most of his clients dealt with his father at the beginning and are still dealing with him because of the good reputation he inherited. His clients are everyone in need of such service. 

Yaakoub is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for a requested wood order. His family is living fine, since he works hard to provide them with what they need. Yaakoub hopes to buy a wood compressor in the future.

loans.use: To pay for a requested wood order

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie H. is a 31-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a pig fattening business. She lives in Medellin, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4200. 

Gerlie is  borrowing PHP 10000 so that she can purchase feed and medicines for her pigs. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 4000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Gerlie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and feed for the pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Geoffrey Kuria

texts.en:
Geoffrey has been repairing bicycles in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 38 years old and is married to Martha Wairimu.  They have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 30,000 in full and in good time.  He plans to buy more bicycle spare parts with this second loan.

In the future, Geoffrey hopes to open a spare parts shop to run side-by-side with his repair shop.

loans.use: To buy more bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman who lives in Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two businesses: one a passenger transport (by motorized tricycle) and the other a general store. Her husband Felixardo, who is 32 years old, drives the tricycle to earn his living. They have four children who are 1 to 7 years old. 

Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly income of 8,400 PHP, bettering the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as down payment for another motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of business and the education of her children. 

Marilyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle transport

loans.name: Bambanani O Gengele Group

texts.en:
Jabulile is 42 years old and widowed with 5 children, ages between 2 and 18 years. She sells cosmetic products and cement for blocks in Hlabisa in South Africa. In the photo above, she is standing in the center of her fellow group members.

She's been in this business for 2 years.  Besides selling cement for blocks, she also sells tea products, juice, body lotion, and other cosmetics. She also earns income  from the  government’s children grant. She says that the main challenges to her business are lack of water and a shortage of customers because of competition.

She requested this loan through Woman’s Development Business (WDB) to buy cement, sand for blocks, and cosmetics products. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to continue in building her house, pay for educational fees and help her first-born go to a technical school. In the future, she would like to see her business expand, increasing her employees from 4 to 10, and adding a workshop to produce blocks in order to sell in different places.

Comments: She appreciates WDB and Kiva about a great job well done, and she ask WDB and Kiva to continue helping other people.

loans.use: To buy cement for blocks, sand and cosmetics products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, onions, tomatoes, seasoning, beans, peppers etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add more cash to his currency exchange business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more "African slippers"

loans.name: G.s.  Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: Maura Estela tiene 45 años y Maria Benita tiene 46 años, juntas conforman el grupo solidario Mujeres Unidas. Ellas tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Maria Benita inicio con la ayuda de su conyugue que es la venta de cerdos, desde hace mas de 9 años que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho esfuerzo es que ha logrado mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. ellas se han unido para solicitar este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima que será necesaria en ambos negocios y así salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maura Estela is 45 years old and Maria Benita is 46 years old.  Together they make up the 'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) community bank.   The two women have different business activities.

Maria Benita began her pig sales business with her husband's help.  She has had this business for more than 9 years.  Through a lot of hard work, she has managed to improve her family's standard of living.  The women have joined together to request this loan which will buy raw materials that are needed for both of their businesses.  They hope, in this way, to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: Pablo Antonio A. se criò en el ceno de una familia muy humilde y de escazos recursos economicos, desde niño tuvo que ayudar a su padre a trabajar en la agricultura. En la actualidad èl se dedica al cultivo de cafe de manera independiente, tiene 47 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Nueva Marolica en el municipio de Patuca, Olancho. Pablo considera que la ventaja de dedicarse al cafe es que es un producto que se vende rapido y a buen precio, aunque al principio tuvo dificultades ya que no habia una calle accesible por la cual transportar el producto hacia el mercado fuera de la zona. Èl solicita el prestamo porque necesita sembrar una manzana de tierra y ocupa comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra. Con el apoyo del prestamo tendra una mayor plantacion y por lo tanto su cosecha sera mas. Su meta es tener cultivos diversificados y piensa muy pronto sembrar platanos, esto le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y de antemano se siente agradecido con las personas que leeran su historia y le apoyaran.
texts.en:
Pablo Antonio A. was born into a very humble family of scarce economic means.  When he was a boy he had to help his father farm.  He currently grows coffee independently.  Pablo is 47 years old, married, and has 6 children.  He lives with his family in Nueva Marolica community, in the town of Patuca, Olancho.

Pablo considers that the advantage of growing coffee is that it is a product that sells quickly and fetches a good price although when he started out he had problems as there was no accessible road along which he could transport his produce to the market which is located outside of his area.

Pablo is requesting this loan because he needs to sow a 1.75 acre plot of land, buy fertilizers and pay laborers.  With the support of this loan he will have a bigger plantation and he will have a bigger harvest.  His goal is to grow a variety of crops and he is planning very soon to start growing bananas.  This will help him to improve his family's quality of life.

This is Pablo's first loan cycle with FAMA and he gives his thanks in advance to the people who will read his story and support him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay laborers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bertalina Del Rosario

texts.es: Bertalina Del Rosario tiene 42 años, su actividad es la venta de comida hace mas 8 años que tiene este negocio. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de ofrecerles a sus clientes una buena calidad de comida, inicio este medio de vida por sus tías que le enseñaron a cocinar los deliciosos platillos que ofrece a su público en general. Ella se levanta temprano desde las 6 de la mañana para realizar las compras de sus frutas y verduras necesarias para la elaboración de sus platillos. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en: Bertalina Del Rosario is 42 years old.  Her business activity is selling meals.  She has had her business for more than 8 years.  She is a very enterprising woman and she enjoys offering her customers good quality food.  She started this business thanks to her aunts who taught her to cook the delicious dishes that she offers to her customers.  She gets up early, at 6.00am, to shop for the fruit and vegetables that she needs to make her meals.  She will use her loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlos Nahun

texts.es: Carlos Nahun S. tiene 22 años de edad, es casado, tiene un pequeño hijo de dos años de edad, y reside en la comunidad de Buena Vista en el municipio de Patuca, Olancho. Carlos se dedica a cultivar cafe. Iniciò con capital propio ya que tenìa una mula y la vendiò para comprar las semillas de cafe.
texts.en: Carlos Nahun S. is 22 years old.  He is married and has a 2 year-old son.  He lives in the community of Buena Vista, in the town of Patuca, Olancho.  Carlos grows coffee.  He started his business with his own capital since he had a mule which he sold to buy coffee seeds.

loans.use: To buy manure and pay laborers

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos vive en casa propia en la zona Limanipata, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno es menor de edad; Santos es peluquero y su esposa es  ama de casa, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la construcción de un baño en su casa, pues hasta el momento no cuenta con uno y sería de mucha utilidad e higiene.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Santos lives in his own home in Limanipata, a neighborhood on the periphery of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has three children, one of whom is still a minor.  Santos is a hairdresser and his wife is a housewife.  He supports his family with his income.

This is the first time that Santos has applied for a loan.  He will use his loan to build a bathroom in his home since he doesn't have one right now.  It would be very useful and improve hygiene.

The socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies Santos to receive a loan.

loans.use: To build a bathroom in his home

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel, reside en el municipio del jicaral, donde vive con esposa sus hijos que viven de forma independiente. Miguel tiene 64 años, se dedica al destace de cerdo, su padre lo inicio en este negocio, no tiene un horario fijo, y actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de cerdo. Este préstamo ayudara a realizar la compra necesaria de mercadería. Uno de sus sueños es la creación de una pequeña pulpería, mejorar los ingresos familiares y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel lives in the town of Jicaral with his wife.  His children live independently.

Miguel is 64 years old and works as a pig butcher.  His father started him off in this business.  He does not work regular hours and he currently needs a loan to buy pigs.  This loan will help him to make his purchase.  One of his dreams is to set up a small grocery store, to improve his family income and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothing articles like blouses, underclothes, socks, t-shirts and hand bags

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: Jose Armando C. es un joven de 25 años de edad, casado, con un hijo, y reside en la comunidad de Nueva Choluteca en el municipio de Patuca, Olancho. Desde hace algunos años se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. Iniciò este tipo de negocio porque en un cumpleaños un familiar le regalò un cerdito y resulto ser hembra, luego de un tiempo èsta creciò y quedo preñada y pariò 10 cerditos. Pero como eran muchos cerditos Jose no los podia mantener, asi que decidio instalar una porqueriza y ahora se dedica a criar cerdos para luego venderlos o destazarlos y vender su carne. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra comprar 12 cerditos mas y asi conseguira incrementar su oferta. Su meta es alcanzar una solvencia economica que le permita darle una mejor condicion de vida a su familia. Ha sido cliente de FAMA por seis años y ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: sfgsfgdrf

loans.use: Compra de cerdos

loans.name: Clemencia Cristina

texts.es:
Clementina de 38 años, es una joven trabajadora que hace tres años atrás comenzó con la venta de gelatina y fan a sus vecinos y conocidos, poco a poco la conocieron hasta que pudo reunir dinero y tener su propio negocio. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín pudo construir en su casa en la parte delantera un pequeño local para ubicar la tienda y pasar más tiempo con sus dos hijos que ahora tienen 10 y 9 años. Trabaja todos los días sola desde muy temprano vendiendo en su  tienda bebidas, confites, gelatinas, fan. Aunque ahora no esta bien surtida la tienda ella espera con el préstamo comprar varios víveres para poder vender a sus clientes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mercadería y bebidas, gelatinas. Uno de sus objetivos en cinco años es tener una papelería surtida con mucha mercadería.
texts.en:
Clementina, age 38, is a hard-working young woman.  Three years ago she started selling gelatin and flan to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Little by little they got to know her, and she was able to get together the money to have her own business.

She lives in a periurban area called Fortín.   She was able to fix up a small area in the front of her house for her store.   That way she is able to spend more time with her children, who are 10 and 9 years old.  She works alone every day.  She starts very early selling drinks, sweets, gelatin, and flan in her store.  

Even though the store is not well stocked now, she plans to use the loan to buy various supplies to be able to sell to her customers.  She wants to use the loan to buy merchandise, drinks, and gelatin.  

One of her objectives is in five years to have a stationery store stocked with a lot of merchandise.

loans.use: Drinks and gelatin

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo M. R. es un agricultor de 42 años de edad, casado, con tres hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Nueva Danli en el municipio de Patuca, Olancho. Wilfredo iniciò su cultivo de yuca en media manzana de tierra porque no tenìa dinero para sembrar mas. Luego de un tiempo un amigo de èl le comentò que habìa solicitado un prestamo en FAMA y entonces Wilfredo decidiò presentarse a las oficinas a solicitar un prestamo tambien. Su prestamo su aprobado y en la actualidad tiene sembrado 4 manzanas. Ahora el solicita un prestamo para sembrar una manzana mas y necesita comprar abono y pagar la chapia. Su meta es ser un agricultor diversificado para poder tener otros ingresos y asi mejorar su vida y la de su familia, porque quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales universitarios. Ha sido cliente de FAMA por cuatro ciclos y ha cance
texts.en:
Wilfredo M. R. is a 42 year-old farmer.  He is married, has three children, and lives with his family in the Nueva Danli neighborhood of Patuca, Olancho.  Wilfredo started out growing cassava on just under an acre of land because he didn't have enough money to sow any more land.  One of his friends told him that he had requested a loan from FAMA and Wilfredo decided to go to FAMA's offices to request a loan too.  His loan was approved and he currently sows over 7 acres of land.

Wilfredo is requesting this loan so that he can sow another 1.75 acres, buy manure and pay laborers.  His goal is to farm a variety of crops so that he can make more income and thereby improve his own life and that of his family because he would like his children to go to university and become professionals.  He has been a client of FAMA for four loan cycles.

loans.use: To buy manure and pay laborers

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Grimanesa; ella tiene 50 años de edad, viuda y tiene 8 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de picantería lugar donde venden comida típica y cerveza  la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo esta la única actividad que realiza, la socia es una persona muy alegre y con ganas de seguir adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como carne,arroz,azúcar entre otros mas para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Grimanesa is a member of the "SAN VALENTIN" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Grimanesa is 50 years old, widowed, and has 8 children.  Her business is a restaurant where she sells traditional food and beer.  She has been in this business for years and it is the only business activity that she carries out.  She is a very cheerful person who wishes to get ahead in life. 

Grimanesa is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as meat, rice, sugar, etc. for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business such as meat, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of bitter kola nuts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 57 años de edad, viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros como polos, chompas, casacas, blusas, ropa para bebes entre otros más, la socia tiene su establecimiento en una galería por el centro de la ciudad, a la vez la socia trabaja como docente en un colegio estatal y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería de ropa para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "SAN VALENTIN" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Maria is 57 years old, widowed, and has 2 children.  Her business is buying and selling children's, women's and men's clothes such as polo shirts, sweaters, jackets, blouses, baby clothes, etc.  She has an establishment in a mall in the city center.  She also works as a teacher in a state school and this is how she gets her family ahead in life.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy merchandise (clothes) for her business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (clothes) for her business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Patricia; La socia tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica a la artesanía, la socia tiene un pequeño stand en el centro comercial Inti Pakareq, ella trabaja desde muy temprano limpia su stand y junto a su hijo después de desayunar ordenan sus adornos, tejidos, bisutería y todo lo que vende, las socia se acomoda y con sus flores en el macetero comienza a atender a todos los clientes que pasan por su stand y los invita a pasar a su tiendita y a probarse las chalinas, las mantitas, los guantes y gorras que vende, también les ofrece sus llaveros y demás, la socia requiere l préstamo para comprar lanas porque ella mientras está en su stand va tejiendo en lana de alpaca y lana sintética. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lana de alpaca y otras lanas.

 La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the "INTI QUILLA" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Patricia is 32 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  Her business is selling handicrafts and she has a small stall in the Inti Pakareq shopping center.  She works from very early in the morning, cleaning her stall and, together with her child, after having breakfast, they arrange their ornaments, knitted items, jewelry and everything else they sell.  She sets herself up and, with her flowers in her flowerpot, she begins serving all the customers who pass by her stand, inviting them to come over to her little store and try on the scarves, shawls, gloves and caps that she sells.  She also offers them her keyrings and other products.

Patricia requires this loan to buy wool because while she is on her stall she knits with alpaca and synthetic wool.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying alpaca and other wools.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in buying alpaca wool and other wools

loans.name: Leiny Cielo

texts.es:
Leiny L. de 35 años, tiene una casa de caña y vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 9, 2 años y uno que tiene recién 9 días de haber nacido. Ella hace 7 años comenzó a trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares con una copiadora que había comprado con nos ahorros. Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de trabajo hasta que decidió comprar algunos utensilios para tener su propia papelería. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana ubico su papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h30pm todos los días vendiendo cuadernos, plumas, láminas y sacando copias a color, blanco y negro. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para seguir con su negocio por eso quiere continuar comprando con el préstamo artículos para su papelería como cuadernos, plumas, grapas, hojas etc. 

Su objetivo es continuar con su negocio porque le ayuda económicamente a su familia y poderlo incrementar con mas mercadería para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leiny L. is 35 years old, has a thatch house, and lives with her husband and three children, ages nine, two, and her youngest child, born nine days old.

She began working seven years ago so that she could help her husband with the family expenses.  She works with a copy machine that they bought with their savings.  Little by little, she began increasing her working capital, until they decided to buy some items to start a paper goods store.

Living in a suburban zone, she placed her paper goods store in the front part of her home.  Now she works from 8:00 am to 11:30 pm, selling notebooks, pens, sheets of paper, and making color and black and white copies.  She has many aspirations to continue her business, and wants to use the money from this loan to buy articles, such as notebooks, pens, staples, sheets of paper, etc., for her store.

Her objective is to continue her business and increase its inventory because it helps her family financially.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Veruska

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Veruska; ella tiene 33 años de edad, soltera; La socia se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa para niños, damas, caballeros y ropa para bebes, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su mama en el mismo negocio, a la vez la socia trabaja en el seguro social brindando información a todos los asegurados referente a sus citas, la socia es una persona bien optimista y de esta forma ella sale adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería de ropa para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the community bank named "San Valentin". The bank is located in the district, province and region of Cusco. 

The member's name is Veruska. She is 33 years old and she is single. Her business is to buy and sell clothing for kids, ladies, gentlmen, and infants. She works together with her mother in the same business. She also works in the hospital where she provides information to insured individuals about their appointments. She is a very optimistic person and this is how she is able to get ahead.

She requests a loan to purchase items of clothing for her business.

She is happy to receive this loan and she is committed to the payment terms.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Asunción; ella tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la crianza de animales como cuyes, conejos y aves, la socia lo distribuye a sus clientes de forma ambulatoria de  preferencia a los restaurantes y clientes que le solicitan de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas  animales y para la comida de estos mismos como maíz, pasto entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the community bank named "San Valentin". The bank is located in the district, province and region of Cusco. 

Her name is Asuncion. She is 42 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. She raises livestock such as guinea pigs, rabbits, and foul. She distributes her products to clients from door to door, giving special attention to restaurants and clients who have placed orders. This is how she is able to support her family. 

She requests a loan to purchase more livestock and to purchase food for them such as corn, hay, etc. 

She is happy to receive this loan and she is committed to the payment terms.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.en:
Carlos Humberto is 25 years old and single. He lives in the South-Eastern part of Guayaquil, an area called Fortin. His house is made of cement, and he has electricity but no running water. Ten years ago, Carlos Humberto started working as a computer maintenance assistant for a computer firm. Soon after, he decided to start his own cyber café. 

He opens every day in the morning, as soon as he returns from the university. Due to high delinquency in the area, he was forced to protect his cyber café with electronic bars. Customers can use the internet by paying $1 for every 2 hours.
 
Carlos Humberto plans to use his $1,000 loan for keyboards and programs. His goal for the future is to start a cyber café in the city center and to finish his studies at his university.

loans.use: To buy computer programs and keyboards

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more items like sardines, milk, eggs, butter, bath soap, toothpaste, and toiletries

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, de 35 años, vive con su esposo Antonio (40), y también con sus cuatro hijos, juntos habitan su casa propia en el distrito de Quimbiri.Ella es el apoyo incondicional de su pareja, juntos se dedican a labrar sus campos  de café, cacao y plátano. Elisa se desempeña como agricultora hace bastante tiempo y en sus días libres se dedica a otros negocios, como por ejemplo la venta de variedad de frutas de la zona como: plátanos, mangos y frutas cítricas, también aprovecha la temperatura veraniega  para  preparar sus refrescos de frutas. Considera que la venta de frutas es muy rentable por que tiene mucha acogida de sus consumidores, y los primeros meses del año los considera desfavorables por la presencia de lluvias, y  las cosechas de sus plantaciones disminuyen y la venta de frutas escasea por los constantes  derrumbes que se producen en la vía de transporte. Con el tiempo piensa mejorar su puesto  de venta de  frutas  y comprar mostradores  para exhibir mejor su mercadería.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene  con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, además es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal.Elisa tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados, en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería en frutas, para lograr satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Elisa, age 35, lives with her husband Antonio (40), and their four children. They live together in their own home in the Quimbiri district. She is her partner's unconditional supporter. Together they work their coffee, cocoa and banana fields. Elisa has worked as a farmer for a long time, and on her free days she does other businesses. For example, she sells a variety of local fruit such as: bananas, mangoes and citrus fruits. She also takes advantage of the summer temperatures to prepare her fruit drinks. She considers fruit selling to be very profitable because they are well-known by the customers. The first months of the year are considered to be unfavourable due to the presence of rain, and the harvests from their plantations diminish. The sales of fruit diminish due to the constant transportation breakdowns. With time, she wants to improve her fruit sales stall and buy displays to better exhibit her merchandise. This is her second loan with MFP, and she has the capacity to pay all of the quotas on time. Furthermore, she is one of the most active members in her community bank. Elisa plans to invest the requested 1000 soles in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise in fruit, in order to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: She will purchase more fruit to stock her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 35 años,  es divorciada y vive con sus dos jóvenes hijos; juntos habitan en una casa alquilada en el distrito Quimbiri, y cada día se  esfuerzan por salir adelante.María, trata de luchar contra las adversidades del destino y trabaja con mucho empeño para sacar adelante a su familia. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer enfocada en sus negocios y luchar por el bienestar de sus hijos; y la mayoría de sus ingresos económicos los genera en su puesto de comercio de prendas de vestir de calidad. Trabaja hace cinco años de forma independiente, y hace dos meses instaló un  restaurante donde ofrece los mejores platos orientales, y trabaja con el apoyo de un chef y así no descuida su anterior negocio. En su restaurante le va muy bien y esta muy agradecida con sus clientes pues son muy exigentes con la calidad de los platillos, además  para el futuro desea continuar creciendo económicamente y también quiere invertir su capital en otros negocios.Es el  15avo préstamo que  con MFP, por el cuál se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, en su banco comunal es una socia colaboradora  y muy querida  por el resto de  las socias.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en adquirir más inmuebles para  su restaurante;  de esta manera busca que ofrecer lo  mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: María, age 35, is divorced and lives with her two young children. They live together in a rented home in the Quimbiri district. Every day they work hard to get ahead. Maria tries to fight against the adversity of destiny and works very hard in order to be able to get her family ahead. She is characterized by her strong focus on her business and her fight for her children's well-being. She generates the majority of her income through her sales stall where she sells quality articles of clothing. She has worked independently for five years, and two months ago she opened a restaurant where she offers the best Oriental dishes. She works with the support of a chef, so she does not have to disregard her other business. Her restaurant is going very well, and she is very grateful to her customers, who are very demanding with regards to the quality of the dishes. In the future, she wants to continue growing economically. She also wants to invest her capital in other businesses. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP, and she promises to repay it punctually. She is a collaborative  member of her community bank, and she is very beloved of the members. Maria plans to invest the requested loan in acquiring more furniture for her restaurant. This way, she hopes to offer her customers the best.

loans.use: She will purchase furniture to improve her business

loans.name: Tesmilda Elizabeth

texts.en:
Tesmilda Elizabeth is 31 years old and separated. She has two children ( four and 13 years old). She is pregnant with her third child. She lives in the southeastern part of Guayaquil, an area called Fortin, known for having mostly dirt roads and houses made of cane. 
 
Tesmilda Elizabeth runs a pharmacy and also offers telephone services. She invested her savings in medicine and started the pharmacy because she likes this type of work. She opens her pharmacy every day at 7 am. 
 
Tesmilda Elizabeth plans to use her $1,000 loan to buy more medicine. She sells the medicine for twice the price she buys it for. In the future, she hopes to open a cyber café for her daughter and to expand her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Yully Del Rocio

texts.es:
Yully de 45 años, buscaba hace varios años atrás un empleo pero por la falta de oportunidades decidió tener su propio negocio de comidas y vender a las personas que viven por el sector. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ha trabajado desde muy temprano preparando las comidas para poderlas servir hasta las 14h00pm. Vende almuerzos a $ 1.25 los cuales vienen con sopa, segundo y un jugo de frutas. Uno de los inconvenientes que ahora tiene es que las calles donde viven el municipio las está regenerando y a los clientes se les hace un poco dificultoso ir a comer. 

Uno de los objetivos de ella es continuar con su negocio pero por que se acercan tiempos de lluvia ella quiere que su casa este bien construida por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo techos, cemento para poder arreglar el baño y el techo de su casa.
texts.en: Yully, age 45, looked for a job for several years, but due to the lack of opportunities she decided to open her own food business and sell to the people who live in her neighbourhood. Bit by bit, with hard work and dedication, she works from very early in the morning preparing her food in order to be able to sell it from 2:00 pm on. She sells lunches for $1.25. These come with soup, a second course and a fruit juice. One of her current challenges is the fact that the streets in her area are being redone, causing inconvenience to the customers who would like to come to her to eat. One of Yully's goals is to continue with her business, but as the rainy season is approaching she wants her home to be well-built. Thus, she wants to use this loan to buy thatching and cement in order to repair the bathroom and roof of her home.

loans.use: thatching, cement

loans.name: And Jappo Group

texts.fr:
