Le groupe de solidarité AND JAPPO du Banc villageois de Ngeune S. est créé la veille de l'inauguration le 27 décembre 2010. Le groupe est composé de 27 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont pratiquement toutes des liens de parenté. Le petit commerce est leur activité principal

DIALE D. debout à l'extrême gauche sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes et de poissons. Avec son premier prêt à CAURIE-MF elle va renforcer son activité qu'elle fait depuis 4 ans.

Elle soutien son mari sur la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group And Jappo, which belongs to the Banc Villageois in Ngeune S., was established the day before its inauguration on 27th December 2010. The group is made up of 27 women coming from the same neighborhood. They are almost all related. Their main activity is small business.

Diale D., who is standing on the far left of the photo, is responsible for the group. She is 42 years old, married and mother to ten children. She has a small business selling vegetables and fish. With the loan from Cauri-MF she is going to strengthen the business which she has been carrying out for the past four years. She helps her husband to support their family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fish

loans.name: Friad People Yone Group

texts.en:
These are small scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL each, to enable them expand their businesses. With their loans they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by feeding and clothing their children, and sending them to school.

Isatu C. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni, 47 years ago. Isatu is married and has five children – one in primary school, two in college, and two adults.  

Isatu sells items like rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste) and salt. She has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more of these items at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy items like rice and salt at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora con muchas ganas de superación. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral es soltera y aun no tiene compromiso. Trabaja en una empresa llamada Nestle (la empresa se dedica hacer dulces). 

Ella trabaja en Nestle como obrera hace aproximadamente 8 años atrás. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro pero por ahora quiere construir mejor su casa que es de cemento pero no está arreglada para el tiempo de lluvias. Quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, pinturas, bloques etc. 

En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y poder independizarse para mejorar y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en: Lucrecia, age 38, is a hard-working woman with a great desire to succeed. She lives in a periurban zone called Perimetral. She is single and is not yet engaged. She works for a company called Nestle (this company makes sweets). She has worked for Nestle as a worker for approximately 8 years. She has many hopes for the future, but at the moment she wants to improve her home. It is made of cement, but is not built for the rainy season. She wants to use this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, paints, blocks, etc. In the future she wants to keep working in order to become independent and have a home that is well constructed.

loans.use: cement, paints

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Go Try Group

texts.en:
Dauda C., left, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born fifty-two years ago in Makeni city, Dauda is married and has three children. He has been selling new school bags and second-hand bags for twenty-three years and will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand his business inventory.  

This is the first loan that Dauda and his group's members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy dozens of bags to add to his inventory

loans.name: Future In Our Hands Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Future In Our Hands” group. They are small-scale business people in the northern city of Makeni. This is not their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and increased profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve.

John C., left, is the leader of this group. Born in Makeni, he is thirty-five and married with two children who are attending primary and secondary school respectively. John has been selling used bags for twelve years and with his share of this loan, will buy bales of used bags to add to his business.

loans.use: Buy bales of used bags to add to his business

loans.name: And Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND BOK JOM du Banc villageois de Ngeune S. est créé le jour de l'inauguration le 28 décembre 2010. Le groupe est composé de 28 femmes issues du même quartier et sont unies par des liens de voisinage et aussi des parents. Le petit commerce est leur activité principal

COUNA G. debout à l'extrême gauche sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de céréales (mil)Avec son 1er prêt à CAURIE-MF elle va renforcer son activité qu'elle fait depuis environs 4 ans.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The AND BOK JOM solidarity group was created on December 28, 2010, the inauguration day of the Banc Villageois of Ngeune S..  The group consists of 28 women from the same area who have come together as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They are engaged in small business activities.

COUNA G., seen standing at the far left in the photo, is the head of the group. She is 25 years old, married, and the mother of four children.

She has been running a small business selling grain (millet) for the past four years. She will use her first loan with CAURIE-MF to strengthen her activity. 

Her goal is to help her husband in providing for the family’s needs.

loans.use: Buying a sack of millet

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: Olimpia, de 27 años, vive con su esposo  Mauth (30)  y tienen cuatro hijos con los que vive en su casa propia en el distrito de Quimbiri.Olimpia, es muy empeñosa en sus quehaceres y con ese optimismo decidió instalar su negocio de venta de ropa, hace  20 años, y esta muy satisfecha por los buenos resultados. Para ella es muy útil tener su negocio cerca de su casa porque le ahorra el tiempo para realizar otras actividades antes de abrir y poder ofrecer su mercadería. Considera que lo dificultoso es que no obtiene la ayuda necesaria de su pareja, porque él realiza otras labores que son impedimento para poder apoyarla. Según ella lo provechoso del negocio  es que cuenta con varios clientes que llegan a su negocio por que les brinda una buena atención y a buenos precios  las prendas, y por esta razón desea invertir en cantidad de mercadería; porque sus clientes  le realizan muchos pedidos.Es el  séptimo crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, ya que su banco comunal le es de mucha utilidad para seguir progresando.Olimpia tiene planeado invertir  el dinero que solicita en surtir con mayor cantidad de  mercadería en ropa,  al gusto de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que sus compradores queden satisfechos con sus pedidos, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Olimpia is 27 years old.  She lives with her husband Mauth (30) and has four children with whom she lives in her own home in Quimbiri district.

Olimpia is very hard working and, with that optimism, she decided to set up a business selling clothes 20 years ago.  She is very satisfied with the good results that she has obtained.  It is very useful for her to have her business near her home because it saves her time and means she can do other things before she opens up and starts selling her merchandise.  She considers that the difficult part of her work is that she doesn't receive the help she needs from her partner because he does other tasks which are an obstacle to him supporting her.  She says that the good thing about her business is that she has several customers who come to buy from her because she provides them with good customer service and good prices on her clothes.  She would like to invest in a quantity of merchandise because her customers make a lot of orders.

This is Olimpia's seventh loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time since her community bank is of great help to her in making progress in her business.  Olimpia plans to invest the money she is requesting in stocking her business with a larger quantity of merchandise (clothes) that are to her customers' taste.  Her goal is for her customers to be satisfied with their orders.  In this way she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: God Bless Business Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you the members of the “God Bless Business” group. They are small-scale business women based in Makeni city. They are requesting for a loan of SLL 800,000 to enable them to further improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Salamatu K. I, left, the leader of this group. Salamatu was born in a small town call Lunsar. She is twenty-eight. and married to a business man. The couple has two children who attend primary school.

Salamatu sells rubber bowls, cooking oil, soap, etc. and has been a business woman for many years. With her share of the loan, she will buy items wholesale to resell in her retail business.

loans.use: Buy rubber bowls, cooking oil, soap, in quantity

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Hold Tight” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000.00 to invest in their businesses. 

Nancy is the leader of this group. She is thirty and married with two children who attend primary school. Nancy sells margi (a seasoning used to give sauce a sweet taste) wholesale. She has been a business woman for six years and, with her share of this loan, will buy large quantities of margi to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy the seasoning margi in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth M. M. vive en la Col. Centro de Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos, México. Ella tiene 39 años de edad  concluyo la educación básica. El crédito lo va a utilizar para ampliar su negocio, ella vende artículos de mercería, regalos y muñecos de peluche, ella va a comprar con su crédito muñecos de peluches, bolsas para regalo, mercería y juguetes para los reyes magos. Ella aprendió el negocio por su papá que tenía un negocio igual en la plaza de Axochiapan de venta de regalos. Ella desde pequeña acompañaba a su papá a comprar la mercancía para surtir su negocio y conoció donde comprar los artículos para el negocio. Ella inició hace 15 años con su esposo es herencia de su papa cuando ella era soltera se encargaba del negocio de su papa ya después comenzó de poquito vendía en una mesita afuera de su casa, fue cuando decidió invertir  con los prestamos fue creciendo fue comprando mas mercancía para surtir su negocio y creció poco a poco, ella tiene su negocio en su casa, se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, también nos comenta que de su negocio obtiene para sacar adelante los gastos de su casa y se siente feliz porque a pesar de que hay temporadas de bajas ventas su negocio siempre le deja buenas ganancias. Algunos de los desafíos que enfrenta son el aumento de los precios y de la competencia, pues nos comenta que en los quince años que lleva vendiendo, se han instalado en su misma calle otros cuatro negocios del mismo giro, por lo cual planea ampliar su negocio y lo piensa lograr con los préstamos de KIVA y Fundación Realidad, ella piensa en solicitar un préstamo mayor y así poder comprar mas mercancías y tener un negocio competitivo.
La señora Ruth es casada, su esposo trabaja en su casa en electrónica repara televisiones, modulares, Dvd, tiene dos hijos José  Manuel de 6 años de edad estudia la primaria  y Yoselin de 14 años de edad estudia la secundaria. Su esposo y su hija le ayudan en el negocio atendiendo en algunos momentos del día. Ella considera que su negocio le ha ayudado mucho a salir adelante con su familia y  hacer mejoras en su vivienda. Entre los planes que tiene a futuro son el de ampliar su negocio colocando una cortina para que su mercancía se vea más bonito que estemos bien de salud y que haya buenas vetas. Las mejoras que desea para el futuro de sus hijos que le echen ganas al estudio Entre las mejoras que tiene planeado realizar en su negocio son repellar su casa, pintarla, etc. la señora Ruth se siente muy feliz con el préstamo que recibió ya que de esa manera ha podido hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. La señora Ruth quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por la oportunidad, más que nada por la confianza que nos dan ya que no nos conocen y nos prestan, gracias a eso hacemos crecer nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
Ruth M. M. lives in Col. Centro, Axochiapan, in the State of Morelos, in Mexico.  She is 39 years old and completed her basic education.  She will use her loan to expand her business selling sewing supplies, gifts and cuddly toys.  She will use her loan to buy cuddly toys, gift bags, sewing supplies and toys for 'Reyes Magos' (a holiday which is celebrated in Mexico on January 6th, when children receive gifts from 'The Three Kings').  Ruth learned the trade from her dad who had an identical business in Axochiapan town square where he sold gifts.  Since she was small, Ruth used to accompany her dad to buy the merchandise to stock his business and so she knew where to buy products for her business.

Ruth started her business 15 years ago with her husband.  It was an inheritance from her dad.  When she was single she would look after her dad's business and then she started, little by little, selling on a small table outside her home.  When she decided to invest with loans, her business grew and she was able to buy more merchandise with which to stock her business.  It grew gradually.  Now Ruth has her business located in her home.  She feels proud to have her own business and she also tells us that it helps her to cover her household expenses.  She feels happy because, in spite of the fact that there are seasons when her sales are low, her business always makes good profits.

Some of the challenges that Ruth faces are rising prices and competition.  She tells us that in the fifteen years she has been selling, another four similar businesses have set up in her street.  For this reason, she plans to expand her business through loans from KIVA and Fundación Realidad.  She is thinking of requesting a larger loan so that she can buy more merchandise and have a competitive business.

Ruth is married.  Her husband works from home fixing televisions, modulars, DVD players, etc.  She has two children.  6 year-old José Manuel is in elementary school and 14 year-old Yoselin is in high school.  Her husband and her daughter help her in her business, serving customers at different times of day.  She considers that her business has helped her a lot in getting her family ahead in life and making improvements to her home.  She has a number of plans for the future, including expanding her business and putting up a curtain so that her merchandise looks nicer.  She wants to continue enjoying good health and to continue making good sales.  The improvement that she would like to make in her children's futures is for them to want to study.  Other improvements that she would like to make include plastering and painting her house.

Ruth feels very happy with the loan that she received since it has enabled her to grow her business and increase her sales.  She would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the opportunity.  Above all, thank you for the trust that you place in us since you don't know us and yet you still lend us money.  Thanks to this, we are able to grow our businesses".

loans.use: Compra de munecos de peluche, bolsas para regalo, merceria y juguetes

loans.name: Sincerity Group

texts.en:
Members of the “Sincerity Group” are pictured here. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The group is seeking a loan of 800,000 SLL per member which will be used to expand businesses, increase profit, and consequently improve the standard of living for group members. 

The leader of this group is Ibrahim K.. He is 40 years old and married with four children all of whom are attending school. Ibrahim was born in Makeni. For the past fifteen years, he has been selling used clothes. With his share of this loan, Ibrahim will buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria forma parte del banco comunal “Caminando Juntos” de la comuna de Quilicura. Su negocio consiste en la preparación y venta de desayunos y colaciones, desde hace 30 años. Trabaja con dos de sus 4 hijos (todos adultos). Tiene dos empresas, como clientes frecuentes,  a las que vende todo el año sus productos. 
Con este préstamo comprará alimentos para preparar sus platillos. Su meta es cambiar su vehiculo, ya que el que tiene es antiguo y  ha tenido varias fallas. 
Gracias a Fondo Esperanza, Victoria dice que ha mantenido su negocio. Además también le ha sido muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo.
 Quilicura es una comuna perteneciente a Santiago, capital de Chile, ubicada en el extremo noroeste de región metropolitana. El origen del nombre de la comuna viene del mapudungun (lengua mapuche): "kila", que significa “tres” y "kura" que significa “piedra”, por lo que se deduce que el nombre de Quilicura equivale a "tres piedras", como  el nombre que le dieron los primeros habitantes de este valle en referencia a los tres cerros que son perfectamente visibles y que delimitan la comuna.
texts.en: Victoria is part of the communal bank “Caminando Juntos” in the municipality of Quilicura. Her business has been in the preparation and sales of breakfasts and light meals since 30 years ago. She works with two of her 4 sons (all adult). She has two businesses, frequent customers, to whom she sells her products year round. With this loan, she will buy foods to prepare her plates. Her goal is to exchange her vehicle, since the one she has is old and has various faults. Thanks to Fondo Esperanza, Victoria says that she has been able to maintain her business. Furthermore, she has been very pleased to share with her companions in the group. Quilicura is an area of Santiago, the capital of Chile, located in the extreme Northeast of the metropolitan region. The origin of the name of the municipality comes from mapudungun (Mapuche language): “kila” means “three” and “kura” means “rock,” which means that the name Quilacura means “three rocks,” such is the name that the first inhabitants gave to this valley in reference to the three hills which are perfectly visible and which border the municipality.

loans.use: To purchase foods

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 59 years old and married. He lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. His adult children have married and moved out, but Eduardo takes care of one grandchild. Twenty-one years ago, Eduardo’s wife encouraged him to start his own business renting out washing machines. Currently, Eduardo rents washing machines by the hour to his neighbors and other people who need this service. Apart from this business, he also raises and sells chickens. Eduardo’s wife mainly takes care of the house but occasionally she helps in the business as well. 

Eduardo has requested a loan of $1,000 USD to buy chickens and chicken feed. His goal is to expand both of his businesses and buy two more washing machines. Eduardo hopes that in the future his family will help him with his businesses.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel forma parte del banco comunal “Confiando en Ti”, perteneciente a la ciudad Chillán. Ella arrienda un kiosco, cerca del centro de la ciudad,  en donde vende diarios y confites desde hace 4 meses. Sus horarios de trabajo son de lunes a sábado, de 8:30 hrs. A 17:30 hrs. Antes del arrendar el kiosco, vendía artículos de hogar de manera ambulante.
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, es decir, diarios y confites. 
Vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, de  14 y 4 años.
Su  sueño es tener un kiosco propio.  
A Maribel le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, para mantener su negocio. También está muy agradecida ya que, debido al terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero perdió su casa y su negocio,  y por medio de Fondo Esperanza obtuvo una mediagua, en donde ha hecho ampliaciones y vive todavía.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Maribel is part of the communal bank, “Confiando en Ti,” in the city of Chillán. She rents a kiosk, close to the center of the city, from which she has sold newspapers and candies for 4 months. Her hours of work are Monday to Saturday from 8:30 to 5:30. Before renting the kiosk, she would sell home items from the streets.

With this loan, she will buy merchandise, as stated, newspapers and candies.

She lives with her husband and their 2 children, 14 and 4 years old.

Her dream is to have her own kiosk.

The loans from Fondo Esperanza have served Maribel well to maintain her business. Also, she is grateful since, due to the earthquake from the previous 27th of February, she lost her home and business but through Fondo Esperanza she obtained a hut, where she has made expansions and lives today.

Chillán is a municipality of the South central area of Chile. It’s name means “Seat of the sun” in mapudungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuches. Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the homeland” or the “Land of Artists,” because the city has given birth to distinguished people in the history of Chile, such as the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: Diarios y confites

loans.name: Ta-Marsu Group

texts.en:
Members of the “Ta-marsu Group” from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, are pictured here. They are small businessmen who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL for each group member. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers and increase sales and profits, thereby improving their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Osman K.. Osman was born in the northern city of Makeni about 61 years ago. He is married and has seven children, two of whom are still attending school. For the past four years, Osman has been selling shoes. With his share of this loan, Osman will buy dozens of slippers to add to his inventory.

loans.use: to buy slippers to increase inventory

loans.name: Rosalvina

texts.es: Rosalvina, de 55 años, vive con su esposo Juan (60) y sus cuatro  hijos; juntos habitan su casa que es  propia en el distrito de Quimbiri. Rosalvina, tiene muchos planes futuros y  su edad no es impedimento para poder trabajar con mucho empeño en su negocio. Se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos, razón por la cual, su tienda lleva el nombre de “Multiservicios” donde ofrece el servicio de fotocopias, anillados, espiralados, de libros y cuadernos, además  en el lugar también ofrece variados perfumes. Dice que su negocio es muy rentable, porque sus clientes encuentran lo que necesitan en un solo lugar. Su negocio se sitúa en el  distrito donde vive, en ese lugar ya  trabaja 10 años. Le  gusta  este negocio  por que le favorece crecer  económicamente y a la vez puede conversar con todo tipo de personas. Sus hijos son los pilares, para que su negocio sobresalga hacia delante, pues le ayudan bastante, entre  sus  planes para el futuro negocio se encuentran  abastecerse de mercadería  y no caer en la escasez  como los años anteriores.Es su primer crédito con MFP y se  compromete en abonar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues se  siente agradecida  por el apoyo  prestado por el resto de las socias de su banco comunal.Rosalvina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de variados materiales que necesita para abastecer su negocio, de esta manera espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosalvina is 55 years old and she lives with her husband Juan, 60, and their four children. They live together in their own home in the district of Quimbiri. Rosalvina has many plans for the future and her age is not going to stop her from working hard on her business. She sells various products, which is why her store is named "Multiservicios", meaning multiservices. She provides various services such as photocopies, document and book binding. She also sells perfumes in her store. She says that her business is very profitable because her customers are able to have everything they need in one location. 

Her business is located in the same district where she lives. She has had the same place for 10 years. She enjoys the business because she is able to grow financially and because she is able to chat with all kinds of people. Her children are her pillars of strength, the reason for moving ahead with her business. They help her a great deal. Among the plans for the future is to acquire enough inventory to never be sold out as in past years. 

This is a first time loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to the payment terms. She is very grateful for the support afforded her by the other members of her community bank. Rosalvina plans on investing the requested funds in the purchase of various goods she needs to supply her business and to provide a better level of service to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité est crée le 14/05/2010.il est composé de 15 femmes issues du meme quartier. le groupe a été composé par affinité entre ses membres et sur la base de confiance. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA.

Madame THIECKA D. debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo, en écharpe blanche est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge.

Elle fait le petit commerce de colliers en perle et de tissu. Elle fait aussi de la coiffure dans son quartier.

Avec le prêt reçu elle compte renforcer son activité en achetant plus de marchandises

son objectif est de renforcer son épargne , et de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on May 14, 2010. It is made up of 15 women, all living in the same neighborhood. They have set up their group due to affinity and trust shared by its members. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Fonk Sa Bopp Grand Louga.

Mrs Thiecka D., standing far right in the photo and wearing a white scarf, chairs the group. She is 46 years old and the mother of five children in her care.

She has a small store in which she sells pearl necklaces and fabrics. She offers also hairdressing services in her neighborhood. She will use her loan to strengthen her activity and buy more supplies for her hairdressing business.

Her goal is to save more money and support her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her hairdressing business

loans.name: Darou Ndiaye Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité est crée le 14/05/2010.il est composé de 13 femmes venant du même quartier. le groupe a été composé par affinité entre ses membres et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA.

GNAGNA T. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du Groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 

Elle fait du commerce de légume au marché central de son quartier depuis plusieurs années. Elle est à son second prêt avec CAURIE-MF

Elle compte appuyer son mari dans la prise en charges du ménage
texts.en:
This group was formed on May 14, 2010. It is made up of 13 women members, all originally from the same quarter. The group came together through friendships and neighbors. The group is part of the community bank named Fonk Sa Bopp Grand Louga. 

Gnagna T. is pictured in the far right in the photo and she is the leader of the group. She is 43 years old, she is married, and she has 7 children. 

She has had a produce business for many years, selling in the central market of her neighborhood. This is her second loan through Caurie-MF (Kiva Field Partner).

She plans on helping her husband support their family.

loans.use: To purchase produce for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Vicente

texts.es:
Carlos de 26 años, es un joven trabajador que para ayudar a su familia él decidió comprar un carro para convertirlo en expreso de una escuela. Por esa buena decisión esta actualmente ayudando a su familia haciendo expreso a una escuela del “Recreo”. 

Su trabajo lo hace en las mañana desde las 06h00am recoge a los niños hasta las 07h45 que termina el recorrido en la escuela y los recoge para llevarlos a la casa a las 14h00pm cuando terminan su jornada escolar. Viviendo en una zona urbana en Duran un lugar a las afuera de Guayaquil trabaja con entusiasmo todos los días para poder tener dinero y construir mejor su casa. 

Para que sus objetivos no se queden atas el quiere con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener más clientela para su expreso y su casa mejor construida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 26 years old, a hard-working young man who purchased a car and converted it into a school bus in order to help support his family. Since he made his decision he has been able to help his family by providing school bus services to a school named “Recreo”. 

He works in the mornings from 6am when he picks up the children until 7:45am when he finishes the route and drops them off at school. He picks up the kids to go back home at 2pm, when classes have finished for the day. He lives in an urban region named Duran, a location in the outskirts of Guayaquil. He works with enthusiasm every day to earn an income and to build a better house.

So that his goals are not left behind he requests a loan to purchase construction materials to improve their home. In the future he wants to have a larger client base for his school bus and to have a better home to live in.

loans.use: To purchase cement, construction blocks, and paints.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Rocio

texts.en:
Mercedes is 40 years old and married with four children ages 23, 21, sixteen and fourteen. She lives in Primavera de Duran and her husband is a fisherman. Mercedes has a small business selling clothes and beauty products. Some of her family members have similar businesses and that is how she started out. She was able to invest a small amount of capital into her products and little by little her business grew.  Mercedes works alone from 8am until 5pm. Her business challenges include competition and insecurity. 

Mercedes has requested a $900 USD loan to buy more merchandise to sell. She will also use part of her loan to make improvements to her house. In the future, Mercedes hopes to have a stable business and to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to make home improvements

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, D. 43 años, vive con su esposo  Alejandro (45) y  juntos tienen tres hijos menores que  habitan en su casa que es  propia y esta  ubicada en el distrito D. Quimbiri.Isabel, es muy querida por los habitantes D. su vecindario; desD. muy pequeña quería salir adelante y tenia el sueño D. poseer negocio propio. En otros tiempos  apoyaba a su esposo en las labores cotidianas D. su chacra, así aprovecho los ingresos que le brindaba su parcela y gracias a esto  pudo instalar  su propio negocio. En la carnicería que tiene en la actualidad ofrece variedad D. carnes D. res, así  trabaja hace cinco años y le gusta mucho su labor; porque obtiene jugosas ganancias y sabe administrar bien su puesto. Además  tiene mucha demanda y  trabaja con varios restaurantes D. la zona y provee D. alimentos  para diferentes actividades como: fiestas D. promoción y festejos D. todo tipo. Su negocio  se sitúa en el mercado central D. su distrito y en la atención cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo e hijos, además para el futuro  tiene planeado comprar más ganado y  D. esta manera quiere satisfacer con los pedidos.Es el  tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones D. pago puntualmente.Isabel tiene planeado invertir los tres mil soles en la compra D. ganado en su viaje que realizara a la sierra del Perú.
texts.en: Isabel is 43 years old, she lives with her husband Alejandro, 45, and they have three young children together. They live in their own house located in the district of Quimbiri. Isabel is well liked by her neighbors. Since she was very young she has wanted to come out ahead and to have a business of her own. In a previous time she used to help her husband with agricultural activities in their field. She took advantage of the income that she was earning and thanks to that she was able to set up her own business. In the butcher shop that she now has, she sells a variety of beef meats. She has had the business for five years and she very much enjoys her work. She sees excellent earnings and she knows how to properly manage her business.  She also sees a great demand and she works with various restaurants in the region that cater to various special occasions, such as: promotions and all types of celebrations.  Her business is located in the central market of her district and she gets help with the store from her husband and children. In the future she plans on purchasing more livestock in order to satisfy client demand. This is her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she is committed to her repayment obligations. Isabel plans to invest the three thousand soles in the purchase of beef cattle while on her trip to Peru.

loans.use: To purchase beef cattle.

loans.name: Bethel 6 Group

texts.en:
Wendy is one of the members of a group called Bethel 6. They are micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to business endeavors in education and sales. Those in sales offer such items as clothing, natural goods, and shoes. They live and work in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, which is famous for its athletes and its sugar industry. At present, its economy depends on the duty-free industrial zones, the cement industry, and minor activities such as tourism. 

Wendy is engaged in clothing sales. She requested her first Esperanza loan almost two years ago, shortly after starting her business, and she is now receiving her third loan. For both her previous loans, she repaid her installments on time and made good investments. Thanks to this opportunity, she and her husband have been able to better provide for their two children.

Wendy is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of new clothes for men, women, and children. She is going to use her profits to further invest in the business and plans to focus her attention on improving the business in order to continue to raise her family's standard of living. She is determined to continue to save regularly so as eventually to be able to build a better home. Her favorite activity is reading, and she tries to find time to study despite the time constraints imposed by her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Lisseth Maria

texts.en: For the past two years, Lisseth Maria, age 21, has been working as a secretary. To generate additional income to cover her expenses, she has started a small business selling a variety of products. This is her first loan through D-MIRO and she will use the money to buy clothes (particularly pants and shirts) to offer for sale. She hopes to grow professionally and to improve and increase her business in the future. Lisseth is unmarried and lives in a rented brick house in a suburban area in Guayaquil called Orquídeas.

loans.use: To buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Belgica Maribel

texts.es:
Bélgica de 39 años, comenzó a trabajar con un capital propio hace tres años atrás para ser vendedora de productos Yanbal  (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes).  

En la actualidad su trabajo lo realiza recorriendo las calles y ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinos y conocidos desde muy temprano y sola. Vende perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, desodorantes a un bajo costo. Quiere continuar trabajando para mejorar la vida de sus hijos de 17 y 8 años de edad. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones por eso quiere continuar con la venta de cosméticos ya que es su ingreso económico fijo por eso quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio estable en un local.
texts.en:
Bélgica is 39 years old.  She began to work three years ago using her own capital to become a seller of Yanbal products (a company whose products are sold independently by entrepreneurial women).

Currently she works door to door offering her products to her neighbors and people she knows.  She starts early and works alone.  She sells perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and deodorants at a low price.  She wants to continue working to improve the lives of her children, who are 8 and 17 years old.

She has many aspirations, so she wants to keep selling cosmetics, since it is her fixed source of income.  Therefore, she wants to buy perfumes, creams, and deodorants.  In the future, she wants to have a stable business in a store.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, deodorants

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est crée le 14/05/2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues du même quartier. le groupe a été composé par voisinage et par affinité entre ses membres. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA 

NDEYE PENDA K. debout à l'extrême droit de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge de se 07 petits fils et neveu.

Elle fait de la couture et la broderie depuis plusieurs années, elle fait aussi de la coiffure 

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et de mobiliser beaucoup d'épargnes tout en appui la famille en nourriture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOKK JOM was created on 5/14/10. It is made up of 12 women from the same neighborhood, who came together as neighbors and friends. 

The group is part  of the Banc Villageois  of Fonk Sa Bopp Grand Louga.  Ndeye Penda K., standing at the far right of the photo, is the group's leader. She is married and the mother of 2 dependent children. She also cares for her 7 grandchildren and nephew. For several years, she has been involved in sewing and embroidery, she also does hair styling. Her goal is to strengthen her activities and  put a large amount of money into savings, as well as supporting the family's expenses for food.

loans.use: To buy embroidery and sewing supplies

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda, es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, tiene 52 años, esta casada y tiene 7 hijos. Hilda se dedica a la siembra y venta de verduras. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abonos, herbecidas, medicamentos. Hilda vive en la Comunidad de Compañía, donde posee un terreno y siembra todo tipo de verduras como: zanahoria, coliflor, col, poro, lechuga, betarraga, apio, nabo, etc, aprendió de está actividad desde muy niña de sus padres ahora lo práctica con sus hijos, claro cuando ellos disponen de tiempo, porque estudian. Hilda todos los días lleva sus verduras al mercado mayorista Nery García Zarate.
Le gusta Finca, porque accede a los créditos y puede ahorrar y gracias sus ahorros puede educar a sus hijos.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan su propio negocio
texts.en: Hilda is a member of the Los Ladrilleros de Compañía Community Bank. She is 52, married, and has 7 children. Hilda sows and sells vegetables. She will invest this requested loan in the purchase of fertilizers, herbicides and medicines. Hilda lives in the Compañía Community, where she owns a plot of land and sows all types of vegetables such as- carrots, cauliflower, cabbage, leeks, lettuce, beets, celery, turnips, etc. She learned this work from her parents at a young age, and now does it with her children--when they have time, because they are in school. Hilda brings her vegetables to the Nery Garcia Zarate wholesale market every day. She likes Finca because she is getting loans and can save--and thanks to her savings, she can educate her children. Her dream is for her children to be professionals and for her family to have their own business.

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizers, herbicides and medicines

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 41 años, convive con Gladis (32)  y juntos tienen tres menores  hijos con los que habitan  su casa que es propia y esta ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri.Alberto es muy entusiasta y  se levanta cada día muy temprano para empezar con la atención de  su tienda de abarrotes; además le gusta atender solo, y  se dificulta un poco cuando se acumulan sus compradores, es entonces cuando pide apoyo a su esposa o hijos. Su negocio esta ubicado en la zona céntrica de su distrito, en ese lugar trabaja hace 20 años y goza de su labor;  los días jueves no son de su agrado por que en esos días escasea de compradores y pasa la mayor parte del día practicando distintos deportes. Su tienda le resulta productiva porque la venta de su mercadería la realiza en su casa y se ahorra el gasto de alquilar un local; entre sus planes a futuro se encuentran comprar mayor cantidad de abarrotes para incrementar su tienda y así pueda abastecer bien a sus compradores.Es el  décimo  préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que es muy fraterno y solidario.Alberto tiene planeado invertir los  dos mil soles solicitados en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, con esto piensa  implementar mejor  su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Alberto, age 41, lives with Gladis (32). They have three young children together, and live in their own home in the Quimbiri district. Alberto is very enthusiastic and gets up very early every day to start working in his grocery store. He enjoys working alone, but finds it can be challenging when there are many customers at once--this is when he asks his wife or children to help out. His business is located in the central zone of the district. He has worked there for 20 years and loves his job. He does not like Thursdays because on these days there are no customers and he spends the better part of the day playing different sports. His store is very profitable because it is in his home and thus he saves the cost of renting a location. Among his other plans for the future, he plans to purchase a larger quantity of groceries to expand his store and satisfy his customers. This is his tenth loan with MFP, and he promises to pay the quotas punctually. In his community bank he is very well-liked, as he is very friendly and supportive. Alberto plans to invest the requested 2000 soles in the wholesale purchase of a large quantity of merchandise. With this, he hopes to better stock his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of food merchandise

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros de Compañía, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. 
Se dedica la fabricación de ladrillos en la comunidad de compañía. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leña y carbón para el quemado de ladrillos, aprendió de ésta actividad desde niña, pues sus padres se dedicaban a éste trabajo, ahora la practica con sus esposo, los ladrillos que produce los vende a la ferreterías de Ayacucho o a veces los clientes le compran en su comunidad.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque se practica mucho el compañerismo, le enseñan los valores y dan créditos.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Pelagia is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañía [Bricklayers of Compañía] Community Bank. She is 45, married, and has 2 children. She makes bricks in the Compañía community. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of firewood and coal for brick burning. She learned this work as a child, as her parents did it. She now does this work with her husband. She sells their bricks in the Ayacucho markets, or sometimes to customers who buy them in the community. She enjoys her Community Bank meetings because they practice fellowship, teach values and give loans. Her dream is for her business to grow.

loans.use: the purchase of firewood and coal

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.en:
Zainab S., about 29 years old, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Zainab was born in the city of Makeni. She and her husband, who is employed as a driver, have three children, two of whom are attending primary schools. The youngest is still too small to attend school.

For seven years now, Zainab has been selling rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil in the area), beans, and other food items. This is the first loan that Zainab and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Zainab is going to use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy rice, palm-oil, beans, and so on at wholesale prices to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy rice, palm-oil, beans, and so on at wholesale prices to add to her stock.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros de Compañia, tiene 61 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Elena se dedica a la siembra y venta de verduras. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de remedios, abono y pago de peón. Aprendió de ésta actividad desde muy niña con sus abuelitos, ahora lo desarrolla con sus hijos, Elena vende sus verduras en el mercado mayorista Nery García.
Le gusta las reunionres de su Banco Comunal, porque le facilitan dinero para trabajar y puede ahorrar, le gusta la  capacitaciones porque aprende nuevas cosas. Su sueño es poder construir su casa para sus hijos y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Elena is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañia [Bricklayers of Compañia] Community Bank. She is 61 and a single mother of 3 children. She sows and sells vegetables. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of medicines, fertilizers, and in paying her workers. She learned this work at a young age from her grandparents, and is now teaching her children. Elena sells her vegetables in the Nery Garcia wholesale market. She enjoys the meetings in her Community Bank, because they provide money for her work and she is able to save. She enjoys the training because she learns new things. Her dream is to be able to build her own home for her children, and for her business to grow.

loans.use: the purchase of medications and fertilizer

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros de Compñía, es casada, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo de 1 año y 8 meses. Vicente se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leña y carbón para quemar los ladrillos.
Vicenta aprendió de la elaboración de ladrillos desde muy niña ahora realiza éste trabajo con su esposo le va bien, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque le dan créditos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es poder juntar un capital y poder abrir una tienda de abarrotes en general y poder ahorrar para la educación de su hijo.
texts.en: Vicenta is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañia [Bricklayers of Compañia] Community Bank. She is 30, married, and has 1 child aged 1 year and 8 months. Vincente makes bricks. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of firewood and coal to burn the bricks. Vincenta learned brickmaking at a young age and now does this work with her husband. It is going well. She enjoys the meetings in her Community Bank because they provide her with loans and she can save. Her dream is to be able to raise capital and open a general grocery store, and to be able to save for her child's education.

loans.use: the purchase of firewood and coal

loans.name: Sop Nabi Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité est crée le 14 Mai 2010.il est composé de 14 femmes issues du même quartier.le groupe est formé par voisinage et affinité entre ses membres. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA.

NDEYE COUMBA S. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait de la couture et la broderie depuis plusieurs années , 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en fourniture pour la couture et la broderie. 

Elle a comme objectif de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created May 14, 2010. It consists of 14 women from the same area who came together as neighbors and through shared affinity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA.

NDEYE COUMBA S., seen standing at the far right of the photo, is the head of the group.  She is married and the mother of six children.

She has been doing sewing and embroidery for several years. Her new loan will allow her to purchase sewing and embroidery supplies.

Her goal is to assist her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: Buying jewelry, necklaces and clothing

loans.name: What God Say Group

texts.en:
This is a photo of the members of the “What God Say” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu B., age 24. She was born in Makeni, where she lives with her husband and their four children. Her husband is a worker in a medical clinic. Two of the children are attending primary school and two are as yet too small to attend school. 

For many years now, Isatu has been selling women’s clothes, trousers, “lappers” (a type of traditional wrap clothing), and so on. With her share of this loan, she will buy more women’s clothes to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more women’s clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Oswaldo Raul

texts.es:
Oswaldo de 47 años, hace varios años atrás trabaja como maestro constructor en obras que le solicitan hacer por un tiempo determinado. Inicio esta actividad para continuar con lo mismo que hace toda su familia. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana trabaja desde muy temprano en las construcciones. Realiza su trabajo solo pero cuando tiene varias construcciones contrata a dos o tres personas para que le ayuden. Los materiales que mas sutiliza en las construcciones son cemento, arena, bloques ya que las casas que construye son muy resistentes.  

Uno de los inconvenientes para ganar mas dinero es la competencia que hay en este servicio de construcción por eso quiere comenzar a dar servicios con materiales incluidos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, arena, cerámica para una casa que está construyendo y así  obtener buenas ganancias. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando para mejorar la casa.
texts.en: Oswaldo, age 47, has worked as a master builder for several years, doing jobs for which he has been requested to work for a determined period of time.  He began this work to continue in the footsteps of the rest of his family. He lives in a periurban zone and works in construction, starting very early in the morning. He works alone, but when he has several jobs he hires two or three people to help him. The materials that he uses the most of in construction are cement, sand, and blocks, as the houses that he builds are very strong. One of his challenges in making more money is the competition in construction; so he wants to start providing a service with  materials included. With this loan, he wants to buy cement, sand and ceramics for a house that he is building, and thus make better earnings. In the future he wants to keep working to improve his home.

loans.use: cement, stones, ceramic

loans.name: Nedy

texts.es: Nedy, de 22 años, convive con Freddy (24) y tienen tres  hijos, juntos  habitan  en su casa que es propia y esta ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri.A pesar de su juventud sabe  administrar las labores de sus casa, y también de su pequeña tienda de abarrotes que instaló hace seis meses; es por esta razón  que atiende a su familia muy temprano para disponer de tiempo en su puesto, pues su pareja trabaja  en una banda de músicos. Manifiesta con satisfacción que su negocio es muy rentable porque vende su mercadería a precios cómodos y sabe como atender  a sus consumidores. Con el poco tiempo que lleva en su tienda ya obtuvo buenos ingresos,  y es por esta razón que piensa ampliar su vivienda  y surtirse  de  mayor cantidad de productos.Es el tercer crédito que tiene  con MFP y esta comprometida en  pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere ocasionar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, pues se siente muy contenta.Nedy tiene planeado invertir los dos mil soles en refaccionar  su quiosco, y también comprara cantidad de mercadería, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Nedy is 22 years old and lives with 24 year-old Freddy.  They have three children and live together in their own home which is located in Quimbiri district.  In spite of her youth, Nedy knows how to manage her housework and also her small grocery stall that she set up six months ago.  She takes care of her family very early in the morning so that she can spend time in her store.  Her husband works in a band of musicians.  She says with satisfaction that her business is very profitable since she sells merchandise at affordable prices and she knows how to serve her customers.  During the short time that she has been running her store she has made good profits and, for this reason, she would like to extend her home and stock her store with more products.

This is Nedy's third loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time since she doesn't want to inconvenience the other members of her community bank as she is very happy to be a part of the bank.  Nedy plans to spend her 2,000 soles in remodeling her store and buying a quantity of merchandise.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To remodel the physical structure of her business and to buy merchandise

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen Rosa, age 51, has a cooking business. She prepares food and goes from door to door selling cooked lunches. She prepares the lunch meals for $0.90 each and sells them for $1.50 each. She has two grown children, whom she was able to raise thanks to the money generated from this business endeavor. Carmen Rosa works from 9 a.m. until 2 or 3 p.m. She is unmarried and lives in a cement house in a suburban area in Guayaquil called Orquídeas. 

Carmen Rosa plans to use her $1,000 loan to buy a new stove ($600), rice ($200), and other ingredients for her lunches.

The main difficulty she faces in her business is transportation. In the future, her goal is to buy a van to help her distribute her food.

loans.use: To buy a new stove, rice, and other necessary ingredients for her cooking business

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité est crée le 14/05/2010.il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Elles font partie des promoteur du Banc Villageois de FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA qui abrite leur groupe

KHADY D. debout à droite de sur la photo avec une écharpe blanche en bandoulière est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de poisson frais. En parallèle elle vend des habits et chaussures 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer ses activités afin de réaliser des bénéfices plus importants que dans le passé.

Elle soutien son mari dans le payement de la scolarité des enfants. Progressivement elle se procure de meuble pour sa maison
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on 5/14/10. It is made up of 11 women from the same area, who came together as friends and neighbors. 

Their group belongs to the Banc Villageois "Fonk Sa Bopp Grand Louga." Kady D., standing on the right of the photo wearing a white wrap, is the group's leader. She is  46 years old, married and the mother of 6 dependent children. Kady runs a small business selling fresh fish, and she also sells clothes and shoes.  Her new loan will allow her to strengthen these activities in order to make more profit than before. She helps her husband in paying for the children's schooling. Little by little, she is also looking for furniture for her house.

loans.use: To buy fish to re-sell

loans.name: M.h 5 Group

texts.en:
Odilis is one of the members of the M.H 5 group. Group members are entrepreneurs dedicated to clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoe sales, teaching, food sales, sales of underwear, etc. in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the country’s most rural cities where the economy depends on agriculture.

This Esperanza associate is the mother of two children. Her long-term partner and she have raised their children with many sacrifices and much effort. She started her business eight months ago, at home, with a little money that she was able to save.

She is getting her second loan. Her previous loan was repaid satisfactorily, and she has maD. some good investments. She currently operates a business selling underwear.

Odilis is planning to invest the money from the new loan in underwear for children, women, and men. She will use her profits to finish building her house, which she has been building little by little. Her favorite pastime is to study the Bible. Her main challenge is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: “Virgen de Guadalupe”, es una Alcancía Comunal conformada por 7 personas  muy trabajadoras cada uno se dedican a distintas actividades  y son  responsables con sus pagos.  Felicitas es socia de esta Alcancía Comunal, tiene 47 años de edad  es conviviente y tiene tres hijos. Ella empezó a trabajar como vendedora ambulante  hace veinte años, a raíz de que su esposo no trabajaba y le faltaba dinero para el sustento diario de su casa y los gastos de sus menores hijos, comenzó vendiendo dulces como ambulante, esto solo por muy poco tiempo, ya que no le alcanzaba el ingreso de esto Felicitas decidió vender anticuchos, hígados fritos de pollo y alitas fritas de pollo, en el paradero del lugar donde vive , ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar puertas para su casa y también comprar los utensilios(platos, tenedores, cuchillos) necesarios para su negocio. Felicitas sueña con poner una bodeguita en su casa y  trabaja mucho para poder mejorar el ambiente de su casa. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a los socios quienes están muy felices con su préstamo.
texts.en:
“Virgen de Guadalupe” is a community bank with 7 very hard-working members who each have a different business activity and are responsible with their payments.

Felicitas is a member of this community bank.  She is 47 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She started working as an itinerant street vendor twenty years ago as her husband was not working and she needed money to support her household and cover her children's expenses.  She sold sweet treats as an itinerant street vendor for a short time but, as she didn't make enough money in that business, Felicitas decided to instead sell kebabs, fried chicken livers and fried chicken wings where she lives. 

Felicitas requested this loan from EDAPROSPO to buy doors for her house and also to buy the utensils (plates, forks, knives) that she needs for her business.  Felicitas dreams of setting up a small grocery store in her home and she works hard so that she can improve her home.  In the photograph we can see that the members are very happy to be receiving their loan.

loans.use: To buy doors and utensils (plates, forks, knives)

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 55 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su  esposo Raúl, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero aun viven con dos de ellos.Todas las mañanas esta trabajadora mujer pasa apresuradamente al mercado aledaño de su barrio, para realizar las compras de carne, verduras y demás condimentos. Luego de las compras empieza con la preparación del menú del día, pues ella trabaja desde hace 27 años, para el  comedor popular de su barrio, ubicado a dos cuadras de su casa. En ese lugar  brinda sus servicios  con otras damas que son  vecinas de su barrio, y por su labor le brindan como  pago cinco  platos de comida  diarios, con los que alimenta a su familia. Su esposo trabaja en la  carpintería de su casa, fabricando accesorios para el  hogar, y  Dina lo ayuda por las tardes en el lijado de maderas, y se  mantiene muy entretenida con esta labor. Para el futuro tiene planeado  adquirir una  máquina lijadora eléctrica, pues siente que su labor será más rápida.Es su 34avo crédito  que tiene con MFP, y se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, pues considera  que este crédito le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Dina tiene planeado invertir  el dinero del crédito en  la compra de cantidad de materiales como maderas, colas, clavos, entre otros accesorios, que necesita y de esta manera espera continuar fabricando sus muebles.
texts.en:
Dina is 55 years old.  She lives in her own home alongside her husband Raúl.  They have four children but now only live with two of them.  Every morning this hard-working woman hurries off to the market in an adjacent neighborhood to buy meat, vegetables and condiments.  After she has done her shopping, she starts preparing her meals for the day.  She has been working for 27 years in her popular neighborhood eatery which is located two blocks from her home.  Here she provides her services with other ladies from her neighborhood.  As payment for her work, she receives five plates of food a day with which she feeds her family.  Her husband works from home as a carpenter , making household accessories, and Dina helps him in the afternoons, sanding wood.  She keeps busy with this work.  In the future, Dina plans to acquire an electric sander since she feels that this would make her work quicker.

This is Dina's 34th loan with MFP and she has, once again, pledged to be responsible in making her repayments.  She considers that this loan will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Dina plans to invest her loan money in buying a quantity of materials such as wood, adhesives, nails, and other accessories that she needs.  In this way, she hopes to continue making her furniture.

loans.use: To buy materials for her furniture workshop

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, tiene 32 años, tiene un niño de 1 año y medio de edad. Gladys tiene un negocio de internet, el cual esta bajo en esta epoca porque ya acabo la epoca escolar.
Gladys es socia de FINCA Perú y gracias a los prestamos que ha recibido su negocio se ha expandido significativamente. A ella le gusta trabajar con FINCA Perú por el trato personal que dan a sus socias y las tasas de interés bajas en los préstamos. Gladys invertirá su préstamo en más productos para su negocio y dice que su sueño es algún día abrir otro café Internet o una imprenta.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Llapanchik community bank.  She is 32 years old and has a one and a half year-old child.  Gladys has an Internet café business.  Business is quiet at the moment because the school year has ended.

Gladys is a member of FINCA Perú and, thanks to the loans that she has received, her business has expanded significantly.  She likes working with FINCA Perú because of the personal service that they provide to their members and the low interest rates on the loans.  Gladys will invest her loan in buying more products for her business.  She says that her dream is to some day open another Internet café or a printer's.

loans.use: To buy paper and ink

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos D. 24 y 28. 
Tres veces a L. semana Esther viaja hasta tres horas en autobús a las comunidades rurales en L. región D. Ayacucho para comprar el queso y los cereales. ElL. dice que el negocio va bien ahora. Esther es socia D. FINCA Perú desD. hace 2 años y dice que elL. ha aprendido a ahorrar dinero. 
Esther quiere continuar con FINCA Perú y usar su próximo préstamo para comprar más queso y granos. Su sueño ahora es construir una casa para su familia y ver a su hijo menor terminar su licenciatura en ingeniería agrícoL..
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Llapanchik community bank.  She is a single mother and has two children aged 24 and 28.  Three times a week Esther travels up to three hours by bus to the rural communities of Ayacucho region to buy cheese and cereals.  She says that her business is doing well.

Esther has been a member of FINCA Perú for 2 years and she says that she has learned how to save money.  Esther would like to continue working with FINCA Perú and she will use her next loan to buy more cheese and grains.  Her dream is to build a house for her family and to see her youngest son finish his degree in agricultural engineering.

loans.use: To buy more cheese and grains

loans.name: Fernanda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Fernanda de 27 años, es una joven emprendedora que aprovecho la oportunidad que su mama se fue al exterior para mejorar su calidad vida y comenzó administrar una pequeña tienda que ya tenía con la mama por 10 años. 

Viviendo con su esposo que es comerciante y sus dos hijos que tiene 9 y 6 años en una zona urbana llamada Suburbio ha trabajado en la tienda desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. En la tienda vende varios víveres como arroz, azúcar, bebidas, enlatados, dulces etc.    

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con su negocio comprando con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, bebidas entre otros víveres. En el futuro quiere incrementar el negocio y comprar una casa ya que en la que vive es de la mama.
texts.en:
Fernanda is 27 years old.  She is an enterprising young woman who took advantage of the fact that her mom went abroad to improve her quality of life and she started managing a small store that she had already owned with her mom for 10 years.

Fernanda lives with her husband, who is a salesman, and their two children, aged 9 and 6, in an urban area called Suburbio.  She works in her store from 7.00am to 10.00pm every day.  In her store she sells a variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, drinks, canned goods, candy, etc. 

Fernanda has many aspirations for the future.  For this reason, she would like to continue working in her business and will use her loan to buy rice, sugar, drinks and other foodstuffs.  In the future, she would like to increase her business and buy a house since the one in which she currently lives is her mom's.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and drinks

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 18, 17 y 9. Sus hijos mayores acaban de terminar la secundaria y quieren ir a la Universidad San Cristóbal en Ayacucho. 
Maria ha tenido muchos problemas con su cónyuge antiguamente, ahora, ella y él se llevan mucho mejor y se siente más seguro sabiendo que ella tiene su propia fuente de ingresos y ahorros.
El sueño de María es comprar un terreno y ver a sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: María is a member of the Llanpachik community bank.  She is 44 years old, married, and has three children aged 18, 17 and 9.  Her older children have just finished high school and want to go to San Cristóbal University in Ayacucho.  Maria has had a lot of problems with her husband in the past.  Now they get on much better and she feels more certain knowing that she has her own source of income and savings.  María's dream is to buy a plot of land and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy auto parts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 55 años, esta  separada de su esposo, y tiene tres hijos, los cuales son menores y aún estudian en el colegio.Todas  las tardes en la puerta de su casa  instala  su  toldo y su carrito sanguchero, donde  fríe papas en rodajas  y pollos,  y los vende acompañados de  cremas y  ensalada de col,  estos platillos  cuestan de un sol a dos soles que  incluye una sonrisa de la vendedora . Rosa  realiza este negocio, desde hace más de 4 años, y es por esta razón  que todos sus vecinos entre otros  transeúntes del barrio, la reconocen como tal. Pero, piensa que la calidad de su atención puede mejorar,  y por ello quiere instalar  mayólicas en la pared y el piso de su negocio, para que se convierta en un lugar más acogedor. Tiene el anhelo de  ampliar  su negocio e instalar un restaurante, donde ofrecerá los mejores platillos que sabe cocinar, además  quiere vender  productos de construcción como fierros, ladrillos entre otros, sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lograra concretar sus planes.Es el 34avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en  pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesto hacerlo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a su grupo comunal, pues  es muy querida, por la solidaridad que demuestra.Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero del préstamo en comprar cantidad de  cemento, mayólicas, además de  sillas y mesas, para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old.  She is separated from her husband and has three children who are still dependent on her and still studying.

Every afternoon, outside her front door, Rosa sets up her awning and her chicken cart where she fries sliced potatoes and chicken.  She sells this accompanied with creams and coleslaw.  These meals cost between one and two soles and include a smile from the seller.

Rosa has been in this business for more than 4 years and, for this reason, all of her neighbors and people who pass through her neighborhood recognize her.  However, she thinks that she could improve the quality of her customer service and, for this reason, she would like to install maiolica (tin-glazed pottery) on the walls and floor of her business so that it becomes a more welcoming place.

Rosa would like to expand her business and set up a restaurant where she will offer the best dishes that she knows how to cook.  She would also like to sell construction supplies such as tools, bricks, etc.  She knows that, with a lot of hard work, she will achieve her goals.

This is Rosa's 34th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She is ready to do so since she doesn't want to inconvenience her community bank as she is a very well-liked member because of the solidarity that she shows.  Rosa plans to invest her loan money in buying a quantity of cement and maiolica, as well as tables and chairs, so that she can offer her customers a better service.

loans.use: To buy materials to remodel her business

loans.name: Las Nazarenas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Nelly forma parte del grupo “Las Nazarenas”, conformado desde hace 5 meses por 7 amigas-vecinas y fue conformado en sus inicios por la directora del colegio “El Nazareno” donde asisten sus hijos, Nelly tiene 29 años y vive en Huaycan, esta conviviendo y tiene tres hijos de 09, 03 y 02 años. Ella tiene seis meses trabajando con Edaprospo y fábrica Muebles en su mueblería llamado “Mueblería Nelly” desde hace dos años, su padre es carpintero y tiene una avanzada edad por lo que ella comenzó a encargarse del taller. Ella desea abrir su Stand de muebles en el futuro y para esto fue que se unió al grupo, mas también sabe que tendrá que ahorrar y pide a Edaprospo siga haciéndole habilitaciones para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly is a member of the group “Las Nazarenas” (The Nazarenes), which was formed five months ago and consists of seven friends and neighbors. It was founded by the director of the Nazarene School where their children attend.

Nelly is 29 years old and lives in Huaycan. She is in a common law marriage and has three children (ages 9, 3, and 2). She has been working with EDAPROSPO for six months and makes furniture from her store called “Mueblería Nelly” (Nelly’s Furniture Store) which she started two years ago. Her father is a carpenter who is elderly, so she has started to take charge of the workshop. She wants to open a furniture stand in the future, an idea she had when she joined the group. Nelly knows that she will have to save more money and request continued assistance from EDAPROSPO to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 51 años, nació en el distrito de Chincheros provincia de Cusco y actualmente vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia del Cusco.

Cristina se dedica a la venta artesanía; joyería, platería, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el centro artesanal del Cusco. Ya son 30 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Cristina que espera recibir de $ 300 USD  y desea aumentar artesania y comprar materiales como plata piña, plata, perlas y otras cosas más. 

Cristina pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal está empezando una nueva etapa y estará bien administrado por la antigua junta directiva.
texts.en:
Cristina is 51 years old.  She was born in Chincheros district, in Cusco province and she currently lives with her husband and three children in Wanchaq district, in Cusco province.

Cristina's business is selling handicrafts: jewelry and silverwork.  She has a small sales stall in Cusco craft center.  She has been in this business for 30 years and it is going very well indeed thanks to the hard work that she puts in.  Cristina hopes to receive $300USD in her next loan.  She would like to increase her crafts business and buy material such as pure silver, silver, pearls, etc.

Cristina is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "El Templo del Inca" (The Incan Temple) community bank.  The community bank is starting a new stage and will be well run by its former board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials such as pure silver, silver, pearls, etc.

loans.name: Felicitas Hermelinda

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 43 años, nació en la ciudad del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia del Cusco.

Felicitas se dedica a la venta artesanía; bisutería, joyería, platería y tejidos, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el centro artesanal de San Francisco. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Felicitas que espera recibir de $ 300 USD  y desea aumentar negocio y va comprar mercadería como por ejemplo mantas, tejidos y otras cosas más.

Felicitas pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal está empezando una nueva etapa y estará bien administrado por la antigua junta directiva.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 43 years old.  She was born in the city of Cusco and she currently lives together with her husband and five children in Wanchaq district, in Cusco province.

Felicita's business is selling handicrafts: costume jewelry, jewelry, silverwork and knitted items.  She has a small sales stall in San Francisco craft center.  She has been in this business for 25 years and it is going very well indeed thanks to the hard work that she puts in.  Felicitas hopes to receive $300USD in her next loan and would like to increase her business and buy merchandise such as, for example, blankets, knitted items, etc.

Felicitas belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "El Templo del Inca" (The Incan Temple) community bank which is beginning a new stage and will be well run by its former board of directors.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as, for example, blankets, knitted items, etc.

loans.name: Herlinda Janneth

texts.es:
Herlinda de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín. Esta divorciada pero tiene tres hijos. Ella no tuvo oportunidades laborables por eso opto por ser comerciante informal de sabanas.

Su trabajo lo realiza sola ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 09h00am hasta que termina el trabajo vendiendo las sabanas desde $ 30.00 en adelante. Uno de los inconvenientes que ahora tiene es la temporada de lluvia y se le dificulta caminar con las sabanas. 

Continuar con su negocio es una de sus aspiraciones por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo sabanas, almohadones para seguir vendiendo a sus conocidos y vecinos. En el futuro quiere incrementar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 52 years old and lives in a peri-urban area called Fortín.  She is divorced but has three children.

Herlinda didn't have any work opportunities and so, for this reason, she chose to sell sheets as an informal saleswoman.  She works alone and works from 9.00am until she finishes her work, selling her sheets for $30 and upwards.

One of the disadvantages Herlinda currently has is that it is the rainy season.  This makes it difficult for her to walk with her sheets.  She wishes to continue with her business and so would like to use her loan to buy sheets and pillows so that she can continue selling to her acquaintances and neighbors.  In the future, she would like to increase her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy sheets and pillows

loans.name: Ufani Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad tiene 57 años, nació en el departamento de Ayacucho y actualmente vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Cusco provincia del Cusco.
