Soledad se dedica a la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, leche y muchas cosas más, ella tiene un pequeño kiosco donde expende sus productos y la pueden encontrar desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Soledad que espera recibir de $ 600 USD  y desea aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.

Soledad pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal está empezando una nueva etapa y estará bien administrado por la antigua junta directiva.
texts.en:
Soledad is 57 years old.  She was born in Ayacucho department and currently lives together with her husband and three children in Cusco district, in Cusco province.

Soledad's business is selling foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk and many other products.  She has a small kiosk where she sells her products and she can be found there from 6.00am until 10.00pm every day.  She has been in this business for 8 years and it is going very well indeed thanks to the hard work that she puts in.  Soledad hopes to receive $600USD for her next loan and would like to increase her business capital, buying merchandise such as, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

Soledad is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "El Templo del Inca" (The Incan Temple) community bank which is starting a new stage and will be well managed by its former board of directors.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.en:
Maria Rosa is a 59-year-old widow. She lives in Playas canton, one of the tourist destinations of Ecuador, which is known for its large variety of seafood. Her children are grown and have moved out of her house. 

Maria Rosa moved to Playas from the province of Manabí 30 years ago. When she first arrived in Playas she started a restaurant which was, and still is, very successful. Nine years ago she was able to reinvest the money she made. She opened a stand in Bahia, selling clothes for men, women and children. Now she has two sources of income: the restaurant during the tourist season and the clothing stand the whole year round. 

At 6:30am Maria Rosa rides to her clothing stand in Bahia, taking her merchandise on a tricycle. At 9pm she packs away the merchandise on her tricycle and returns home. A problem she faces in her business is the high delinquency during the tourist season.

She plans to use her $500 loan to buy clothes to sell. In the future she hopes to increase her business and open another stand in Bahia. She hopes to leave a good example for her children by working hard.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SANTO DOMINGO”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ricardo; El socio tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 4 años de edad; El socio se dedica  a la artesanía, le socio tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de artesanía en el centro comercial Inti Pakareq, el atiende su stand desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche de corrido, el socio se dedica  ala bisutería, el realiza trabajos en alpaca, y cordones de fantasía, el hare aretes y collares, también brazaletes. El socio requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como alambres de alpaca, hilos, alicates delgados, piedras de fantasía, pinis, cuarzos y otros. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales.

Los otros socios se dedican a prestar servicio de moto taxi, artesanía, venta de ropa, librería, abarrotes, una de ellas es docente, otra socia se dedica a la atención de su restaurante pollería. 

El socio valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Santo Domingo"; The bank is located in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

One of the members is Ricardo; he is 44, has a partner and two children ages 15 and four; the member sells crafts at a stand in the shopping center Inti Pakareq, he works at the stand from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. with no break, the member works with beading and makes crafts in alpaca, jewelry strings, earrings and necklaces, as well as bracelets. 

The member requests a loan to buy materials such as alpaca, thread, plyers, beads, stones and others.  

The other members provide goods and services such as taxi, crafts, clothing, bookstore, groceries, one of them is a teacher and another one has a chicken restaurant.

The member values the loan and commits to make the payments according to the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: Invest in buying materials

loans.name: Eduardo Rafael

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 47 años, nació en el departamento de Chiclayo y actualmente vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq provincia del Cusco.

Eduardo trabaja en el ejército en el área de logística pero también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de calzados a pedido del cliente. La mercadería lo compra del departamento de Trujillo y expende sus productos con un catalogo.    Ya son 3 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Eduardo que espera recibir de $ 300 USD  y desea aumentar el capital del negocio y va comprar mercadería como por ejemplo zapatos. Su anhelo de Eduardo es abrir una tienda de venta zapatos.

Eduardo pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal está empezando una nueva etapa y estará bien administrado por la antigua junta directiva.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 47 years old.  He was born in Chiclayo department and currently lives with his wife and three children in Wanchaq district, in Cusco province.

Eduardo's works for the army in logistics.  He also has a small business selling footwear to order.  He buys his merchandise in Trujillo department and sells his products with a catalog.  He has been in this business for 3 years and it is going very well indeed thanks to the hard work that he puts in.  Eduardo hopes to receive $300USD in his next loan and would like to increase his working capital, buying merchandise such as shoes.

Eduardo's wish is to open a shoe store.  He belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "El Templo del Inca" (The Incan Temple) community bank which is starting a new stage and will be well managed by its former board of directors.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as shoes

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Maribel, tiene 29 años D. edad, tiene tres hijos menores D. edad. Ella vive en la zona D. El Resplandor en el distrito D. Carabayllo.
Hace dos años Maribel forma parte del grupo llamado “El Triunfo”, formado por siete integrantes quienes la eligieron como tesorera D. la Junta Directiva del grupo.
Maribel se dedica a la venta D. accesorios para el hogar desD. hace aproximadamente un año. DesD. muy joven ha sido muy trabajadora, e inició apoyando a sus padres en la venta D. control remotos, antenas y otros; hoy en día con el apoyo D. su pareja inició su propio negocio y asi con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio salen adelante y han logrado comprar su terreno y cubrir las necesidades D. sus hijos.
Uno D. sus anhelos es poder tener un local propio, en una zona que sea muy comercial.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para surtir mas su negocio D. venta D. accesorios del hogar.
texts.en:
Maribel is 29 years old.  She has three dependent children and lives in El Resplandor, in Carabayllo district.  For two years, Maribel has been a member of a group called "El Triunfo" (Victory).  The group has seven members who elected her as the group's treasurer.

Maribel's business is selling household accessories.  She has been in this business for approximately one year.  Maribel has been a hard worker since she was very young.  She started out supporting her parents, selling remote controls, aerials, etc.  Now, with the support of her partner, she has set up her own business and with a lot of hard work and dedication, she has managed to get ahead in life, buy a plot of land and cover her children's needs.  One of her wishes is to own her own premises, in an area with a lot of commercial activity.

Maribel will use her loan to buy merchandise to better stock her business selling household accessories.

loans.use: To invest in buying merchandise to increase her stock of household accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts to improve her auto rickshaw service

loans.name: Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe está conformado por 13 socias quienes son mujeres que laboran en diferentes actividades en su parroquia o en la ciudad, estas actividades les han permitido crecer en la economía de sus hogares y así salir  adelante. Viven en la parroquia Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió en donde la su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y  a la agricultura, en esta parroquia podemos disfrutar de la paz de la naturaleza.

La Señora. María B. vive en la comunidad de San Antonio, es socia del banco comunal Cumbe y este es su segundo crédito. 
Tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos quienes todos son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Vive junto a un nieto quien tiene 11 años de edad  y estudia en la escuela. Con el trabajo de ella y de su esposo han logrado construir su casa propia, su esposo labora como albañil.
Doña María se dedica a compra y venta de pollos pelados, los cría hace un año y los vende en su propia comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura, pero lo que cultiva es mas para su consumo.
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos para el negocio. Su meta es  tener más animales para la venta.

La Señora. Julia Huylasaca vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 19 años, vive en unión libre y esta muy feliz ya que tiene 7 meses de embarazo. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá.
La Señora. Julia por el momento se encuentra en su casa debido a su embarazo pero antes laboraba en la atención de una tienda.
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con este negocio. Su meta es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The Cumbe Communal Bank is comprised of 13 members.  They are women who work in different business activities in their parish or in the city.  These activities have allowed them to grow financially in their households and to get ahead.  They live in the Cumbe parish, which has a cold climate.  The people there raise animals and farm.  One can enjoy the tranquility of nature in this parish.

María Buelve lives in the San Antonio community.  She is a member of the Cumbe Communal Bank, and this is her second loan.  She is 62 years old, married, and has seven children.  All of her children are adults, married, and live independently.  She lives with an 11 year old grandchild who attends school.  Through work, she and her husband have managed to build their own house.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.

María buys and sells dressed chickens.  She raises them for a year, and she sells them in her own community.  She also farms, but what she grows is more for her consumption.

She will use her new loan to buy more chickens for the business.  Her goal is to have more animals to sell.

Julia Huylasaca lives in the Cumbe parish.  She is 19 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She is very happy to be seven months pregnant.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  They do not have their own house, so they live in her mother’s house.

At the moment Julia is in her house due to her pregnancy.  However, she previously worked tending a store.  This is her first loan in the communal bank.  She was invited by a friend.  She will use the loan to buy chickens to start this business.  Her goal is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo tiene 54 años, nació en la ciudad de Puno y actualmente vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq.

Luis Alfredo tiene un pequeño restaurante llamado “El Fogon" donde vende menú a S/. 3.50 nuevos soles. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Luis Alfredo que espera recibir de $ 500 USD  desea comprar artefactos como por ejemplo horno pollero, congeladora y otras cosas más.

Luis Alfredo pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.

El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito de las flores y localizándose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo, age 54, was born in the city of Puno.  He currently lives with his wife and their three children in the Wanchaq district.  Luis Alfredo has a small restaurant named “El Fogon” (The Kitchen Stove).  He sells prepared meals for S/. 3.50 nuevos soles.  He has had this business for two years, and it is going extremely well for him thanks to the great effort he puts into his work.

With the next loan Luis Alfredo hopes to receive $500 USD.  He wishes to buy items like a roasting oven, a freezer, and other things.

Luis Alfredo belongs to the “El Templo del Inca”  (The Incan Temple) Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.  The communal bank is in its second year, and it is well managed by the governing board.

The Wanchaq district is in the Cusco province in the Cusco department.  It is called the district of the flowers.  It is five minutes from the Plaza de Armas in the architectural capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is an enchanting city, which dates back to Inca times. The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

loans.use: To buy items like a roasting oven, a freezer, and other things.

loans.name: El Valle Renace Group

texts.es:
Mercedes Lisethe,  tiene 30 años D. edad, tiene dos pequeños hijos. Ella es integrante del grupo “El Valle Renace”, formado por 11 personas, entusiasta y trabajadoras redientes del distrito D. Carabayllo.

Mercedes se dedica a la venta D. diversos productos, ya sean comestibles como quesos, trucha y otros, como también a la venta D. prendas D. vestir y accesorios a pedido. Inició con la venta D. productos golosinarios D. forma ambulatoria, poco a poco fue invirtiendo y tratando D. ofrecer y contar con los productos que le solicitaban.
Una D. sus metas y motivo por el cual se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo es poder cubrir los gastos D. estudios D. sus hijos para ofrecerles la oportunidad D. tener una profesión.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en compra D. mercadería y cubrir pedido D. quesos.
texts.en:
Mercedes Liseth, age 30, has two small children.  She is a member of the “El Valle Renace” (The Valley Is Reborn) Communal Bank.  It is comprised of 11 people who are enthusiastic and hard-working residents of the Carabayllo district.

Mercedes sells diverse products.  She sells food like cheese and trout.  She also sells clothing and accessories by order.  She started by selling sweets in an itinerant manner.  Little by little she was investing and trying to have and sell the products that were requested. 

One of her goals and the motivation for her hard work is to be able to cover her children’s educational expenses.  She wants to give them the opportunity to have a profession.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise and to cover cheese orders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare special food for the end of the year festivities

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 45 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo, y sus  4 hijos, los cuales aun estudian en el colegio.Luz cose camisas, pantalones y sabanas, que luego que las termina, las vende  en los diversos mercados de su zona. Ella tiene varios clientes, que saben de la calidad de sus trabajos, y  no dudan en hacerles más cantidad de pedidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es realizar los trazos de los moldes de las prendas, y las trata de hacer las más perfectas posibles para darle un buen acabado a sus prendas. Es así que, desde los 16 años, realiza  esta labor que tanto le apasiona, pero piensa que su labor puede ser más eficaz  con una máquina remalladora para mejorar los  acabados de las prendas, y es por esta razón que  para mas adelante quiere comprar esta máquina. Tiene planeado  para el futuro, equipar su taller de confecciones en su casa y de ese modo espera  mejorar su calidad de vida.Es el 11avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar  puntualmente  sus cuotas, pues  desea  obtener mejoras para su negocio. En su grupo comunal, es un socia muy responsable y siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de su grupo.Luz tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la compra de  telas de algodón y polipima, pues  son  telas frescas apropiadas para la estación de verano.
texts.en:
Luz, age 45, lives in her own house with her husband and their four children.  They children are still in school.

Liz makes shirts, pants, and sheets.  She then sells them at the different markets in her zone.  She has several customers who know the quality of her work, and they do not hesitate to place more orders with her.  What she likes most about her work is drawing the patterns for the garments.  She tries to make them as perfect as possible so that the garments are of good quality.  

She has been doing this work, which she is passionate about, for 16 years.  However, she thinks that her work could be more efficient with an overlock machine to improve the finishings on the clothes.  That is why she wants to buy this machine in the future.  In the future she plans to equip her seamstress shop in her house.  That way she hopes to improve her quality of life.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments on time because she wants to get improvements for her business.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank, and she is always concerned about the group’s well-being.

Luz plans to use the requested loan to buy cotton and polycotton fabrics.  They are cool fabrics that are appropriate for the summer season.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to improve her business

loans.name: Zucima

texts.en:
Zucima A. is from the village of Orang Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. Zucima is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Zucima works in someone else's agricultural business raising fish for sale. Zucima has been engaged in this business for more than 18 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Zucima joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zucima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby fish to raise and sell in the future. Zucima is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fish food and other supplies. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Zucima from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish food and other supplies

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa T. is from the village of Commonwealth, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. Felipa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling "Hypo" stain remover in the local community. Felipa is just starting this business.

In 2007, Felipa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Felipa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa O. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagn, Lanao Del Norte. She is 48 years old. Marisa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Marisa is just starting this business.

In 2007, Marisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for planting and harvesting vegetables for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is from the city of Maningcol Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old. Esther is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing boarding house services to local community members. Esther has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. Esther is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esther from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Ma. Georgina

texts.en:
Ma. Georgina D. P. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old. Ma. Georgina is single. To make a living, Ma. Georgina owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing xerox services to local community members. Ma. Georgina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ma. Georgina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Georgina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Ma. Georgina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ma. Georgina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo Y. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. He is 39 years old. Carmelo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Carmelo has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Carmelo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelo is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmelo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis E. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin  Misamis Occcidental. He is 30 years old. Dennis is married and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Dennis owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Dennis has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Dennis joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dennis has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Dennis is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 34th loan taken out by Dennis from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe M. is from the town of Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is 43 years old. Fe is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as milk, noodles, egg, canned goods, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Fe is requesting a new loan of 7500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Leandro

loans.name: Odongerel

texts.en:
Odongerel is 42 years old and lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives in a brick house, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. Odongerel’s two sons live apart from her, but she still supports them. Odongerel believes that if her sons live on their own, they will gain valuable life skills. 

In 1996, Odongerel began purchasing Mongolian dairy food products from local herders and reselling them to customers. In 2008, she sold her dairy food equipment in order to purchase a metal container at Narantuul market. In 2009, she began working together with her oldest son to operate a clothing accessories retail business from an outdoor stall and the metal container she owns at Narantuul. 

Currently, she doesn't own the outdoor stall's rental contract. She's renting from a middleman and not directly from the Narantuul market. It's her goal to have 2 million MNT of working capital in order to purchase the rental contract from the current owner. Her working capital was 500,000 MNT last year and has now reached 1 million MNT. 

With this loan of 1,500,000 MNT, Odongerel will purchase clothing accessories like socks, hats, gloves, and slippers from Ereen City, China. Odongerel hopes to resell these accessories at her stall before the Mongolian Lunar New Year in February. At this time of year, it is the custom to give small gifts to family members and friends. She expects her sales to be very high at this time.

loans.use: To purchase small clothing accessories for traditional Mongolian Lunar New Year

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is 32 years old and lives with her mother and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a brick house, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. Odgerel’s mother is retired and stays at home, while her daughter attends secondary school. Odgerel supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

In 2006, when she first began her business, she sold only leather belts and traditional Mongolian fabric belts. In the beginning stages of her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. At the time her stall had 1 million MNT in working capital. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand.

However, in 2009, Odgerel had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul in order to make her business more stable. Now her working capital is almost 4 million MNT, and she sells many clothing accessories like socks, gloves, hats, and belts. With this loan, Odgerel will purchase small clothing accessories from Ereen City, China. She is hoping to sell the clothing accessories to rural and urban customers who visit Narantuul before the traditional Mongolian Lunar New Year. At this time of year, it is the custom to give small gifts to family members and friends. Odgerel wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

Odgerel's business goal is to one day operate her own clothing shop. Odgerel also said, "It's my personal goal to support my mother and daughter so they can live happily."

loans.use: To purchase small clothing accessories for traditional Mongolian Lunar New Year

loans.name: Munhbayasgalan

texts.en: Munhbayasgalan K. is a 38 year old and lives with her husband and two children in Harhorin of Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house and fence. Her two children both attend university while her husband works for the local mining company. Munhbayasgalan operates a grocery trading business in her town. She sells a variety of food products such as ice cream, meat, dairy product and other in her own small shop next to her home. She started her food trading business in 1997 after building her small shop in her fence. Almost 13 years of owing this business, she was able to establish a stable business in her local community and her earnings have enabled her to buy a mini truck for her business. For the future, she plans to start operating PC game center to supplement her earnings. With her business profits, she has paid her children's tuition fees. Munhbayasgalan is a clever and hardworking person and is requesting  a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase computers and other equipments in order to open PC game center in the near future.

loans.name: Jesús Amelia

texts.es:
Jesús Amelia tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el pueblo joven Santa Rosa, una zona marginal que forma parte del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega la cual funciona en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Ella ofrece sus productos a sus clientes tanto al crédito como al contado. Ella siempre trata de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes por lo que en el tiempo que lleva funcionando su negocio este ha empezado a contar con buena acogida. Ella también se dedica a trabajar como costurera. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es panadero, a sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Jesús desea adquirir mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jesús Amelia is 26 years old, married, and lives with her family in the town of Santa Rosa, a marginalized area that is part of the District of Lambayeque and experiences considerable commercial activity. This community is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Jesús Amelia has a store that she operates from her home. There she offers her customers different everyday products such as basic necessities and groceries. She provides these products to her customers on credit as well as for cash. Jesús Amelia always provides good service to her customers and her business has been well-received during the time it has been in operation. In addition, she works as a seamstress. The earnings from this activity are used to help her husband, a baker, get ahead with their family’s finances.

Jesús Amelia wants to acquire merchandise to meet the current demand. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN to help achieve this goal.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean O. is from the city of calabayan ozamiz city. She is 31 years old. Mary Jean is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport services. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mary Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mary Jean from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better transportation service

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 33 años D. edad, es casada y tiene un hijo dependiente, vive junto a su esposo en el sector 18 D. Febrero, una zona urbano – marginal D. la ciudad D. Lambayeque, conocida por sus atractivos turísticos y por tener un comercio que se ha venido expandiendo en los últimos años, actualmente es una D. las ciudades eje en el comercio D. la región, queda ubicada a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Ella adquiere su mercadería , principalmente productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes, en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista D. la región) y luego la ofrece a sus clientes, como el negocio es una fuente importante D. ingresos familiares, Ana María trata D. mantenerlo ofreciendo un buen trato a sus clientes.

Su bodega ha ido creciendo y su demanda también se ha estado incrementando. Por ello Ana María desea ampliar su establecimiento con la compra D. abarrotes D. modo que pueda satisfacer la creciente demanda que su negocio viene experimentando, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ana María ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través D. Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad ella adquirió la mercadería que necesitaba para sacar adelante su negocio y debido a ello se encuentra contenta y bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través D. Kiva.
texts.en:
Ana María is 33 years old, married, and has one dependent child. She lives with her husband in the February 18th sector, a marginalized urban area of the city of Lambayeque which is known for its tourist attractions and for experiencing commercial growth the past few years. It is currently one of the business hubs of the region and located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Ana María sells basic necessities and groceries from a store established in her home. She acquires her merchandise, primarily consumer stables and grocery items, at the Moshoqueque Market (a wholesale market in the region) and then offers them to her customers. Her business is an important source of income for her family. Ana María tries to maintain her business by providing good service to her customers.

Her store is growing and demand is steadily increasing. For this reason Ana María wants to expand her store by purchasing groceries so that she can meet the growing demand that her business is experiencing. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help her meet this goal.

Ana María has already received a Kiva loan from Edpyme Alternativa as part of its “Seed Capital” product. She used that opportunity to acquire merchandise needed for her business to succeed. Ana María is happy and extremely grateful to everyone who helped her through Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn D. S. is from the city of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Merlyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Agapito Leandro

texts.es:
Agapito tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el caserío Cruz del Médano, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Agapito cría chanchos, pavos y gallinas para luego venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente visitan su caserío. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar como pescador, el es tripulante de una embarcación pesquera que se hace a la mar durante los meses de Abril, Junio y Octubre, durante los meses en que no se encuentra pescando trabaja en una fábrica de sal. La necesidad de seguir trabajando para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida hace que siempre busque el modo de agenciarse de ingresos para sacarlos adelante.

Agapito desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales para poder obtener mejores ingresos, asimismo desea realizar mejoras en sus corrales. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Agapito ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad el pudo realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda y por ello se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que se colaboraron con ella a través de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Agapito is 36 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in the village of Cruz del Médano in the District of Mórrope which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

He makes a living by raising and selling small animals. Agapito raises pigs, turkeys, and chickens and then sells them to traders who regularly visit his village. This business is an important source of income for his family. In addition he works as a fisherman and is a crew member of a fishing boat that heads out to sea during the months of April, June, and October. During the months he is not fishing, Agapito works at a salt factory. He needs to continue working so that he can provide his family a better quality of life. Therefore he always seeks for ways to earn income so that they can get ahead.

Agapito wants to improve the diet of his animals so that he can earn more income. He also wants to make improvements to his livestock pens. For this reason he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

Agapito has received a Kiva loan from Edpyme Alternativa through its “Seed Capital” product. With that opportunity he was able to make a few improvements to his home. He is extremely grateful to everyone who supported him through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase feed for his animals & make improvements to his animal pens

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie B. is from the village of Campo 1, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Elsie is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as dry goods in the local community. About GDMPC:

loans.name: José Anibal

texts.es:
José Aníbal tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Tranca Fanupe del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola caracterizada por que sus pobladores son bastante humildes y trabajadores. La localidad pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su domicilio. Allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. José ofrece sus productos  tanto al crédito como al contado y siempre trata de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes por lo que en el tiempo que lleva funcionando su negocio este ha empezado a contar con buena acogida. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

José desea adquirir mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José Aníbal is 19 years old, single, and lives with his family in the village of Tranca Fanupe, in Mórrope district.  This is an agricultural area which is characterized by the fact that its inhabitants are quite humble and hard working.  The village is located in Lambayeque province, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

José Aníbal has a grocery store in his home where he offers his customers different staples and groceries.  He offers his products both on credit and for cash and he always tries to provide his customers with good service.  Over the time he has been in this business, this has led to his store becoming very popular.  He uses the profits he makes from this business to cover his personal costs and to help his parents with the family's finances.

José would like to acquire merchandise so that he can meet current demand.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire merchandise so that he can meet his current demand

loans.name: Karina Liliana

texts.es:
Karina tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el sector Víctor Raul, una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, la zona en bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside y al público en general. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Karina desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales con la compra de alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión ella espera lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo para que sean vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old, married, and lives with her family in Víctor Raul sector: a marginal, urban area in Lambayeque region.  This area is quite well known for its commercial activity and is located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Karina works raising and selling young animals.  She raises poultry in an area behind her home.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit her area.  She also sells to the general public.  She uses the profits she makes from this business to help her husband with their family's finances.

Karina would like to improve her feeding of her animals by purchasing balanced animal feed.  She hopes that this investment will help her animals to develop better and be sold for a better price.  In order to achieve this goal, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To improve her feeding of her animals by purchasing balanced animal feed

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector El Sandial, una centro poblado rural del distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace cuatro años en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento concentrado y forraje, el cual es sembrado por su esposo de este modo garantizan el rápido crecimiento de sus animales, lo que les permite comercializarlos de mejor manera y percibir mayores ganancias.

María Esther empezó vendiendo animales menores y actualmente, con las ganancias de su negocio y con el apoyo brindado por un préstamo Capital Semilla financiado por Kiva, pudo adquirir dos cabezas de ganado vacuno, de las cuales comercializa la leche que produce con un acopiador de la zona. Actualmente ella desea seguir creciendo como empresaria adquiriedo otra vaca, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.

María Esther se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través del fondo Kiva. Gracias al préstamo en aquella oportunidad ella pudo sacar adelante su negocio e implementarlo un poco más.
texts.en:
María Esther is a 37 year-old mother who lives with her huband and child in El Sandial, a small, rural village in Pítipo district.  Pítipo district is an agricultural district in Ferreñafe province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

María Esther has been raising animals at home for four years.  When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to her neighbors and the traders who always visit her area.  She feeds her animals with concentrated animal feed and fodder which her husband grows.  In this way, she guarantees the rapid growth of her animals and is better able to sell them and make more profit.

María Esther started out selling small animals and currently, with the profits from her business and the support offered her by a seed money loan financed by Kiva, she was able to acquire two heads of cattle whose milk she sells to a trader in the area.  She would currently like to continue growing as a businesswoman, acquiring another cow.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa with which she hopes to achieve her goal.

María Esther is very grateful to the people who work together with her through Kiva.  Thanks to her last loan, she was able to get ahead in her business and make a little more progress in it.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Jenneth's Group

texts.en:
Jenneth B. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Jenneth is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members' if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jenneth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenneth owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Jenneth has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jenneth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenneth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jenneth is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Jenneth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory, and use as working capital

loans.name: Rosa Alejandrina

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial. La localidad pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su domicilio. Allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Rosa ofrece sus productos  tanto al crédito como al contado y siempre trata de brindar un buen trato a sus clientes por lo que en el tiempo que lleva funcionando su negocio este ha empezado a contar con buena acogida. Ella complementa sus ingresos con la venta de ropa y abarrotes Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio adquiririendo mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old, single, and lives with her family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with a fair amount of commercial activity, which is located in Lambayeque province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Rosa runs a small grocery store in her home.  There she offers her customers different staples and groceries.  Rosa offers her products both on credit and for cash and she always tries to provide her customers with good service which is why her business is now very popular.  Rosa supplements her income by selling clothes as well.  She uses the profits that she makes from this activity to cover her personal expenses and help her family financially.

Rosa would like to expand her business, acquiring merchandise so that she can meet her current demand.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To expand her business, acquiring merchandise to meet her current demand

loans.name: Rudy Victoria

texts.es:
Rudy es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón, pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes. Adicionalmente trabaja vendiendo prendas de vestir por pedidos, con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Rudy desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.
texts.en:
Rudy is a 49 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area with a semi-tropical climate which mainly produces fruit such as mangoes, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Rudy sells beauty products and cosmetics through catalogs.  She has a group of customers who buy her products frequently.  The more orders they make, the more points she earns with the company that provides her products and, therefore, the more profit she makes.  For this reason, she is always working hard to attract more customers.  Rudy also sells clothes to order.  Through these activities, she helps her husband to financially support their household.

Rudy would like to have stable capital so that she can acquire more products and have a permanent stock of cosmetics which will allow her customers to acquire the products they need quickly, without having to wait until the end of the month which is when the orders are delivered.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more products and to have a permanent stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el sector Tongorrape, una zona rural del distrito de Motupe. Una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como comerciante acopiador de maracuyá y limón, la zona en donde reside se caracteriza por producir principalmente estos productos. El adquiere sus productos a los agricultores de la zona y los comercializa con las procesadoras que se encuentran situadas en la zona donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de la zona.

Lorenzo desea ampliar su negocio obteniendo capital estable para seguir adquiriendo más frutas para ofrecerlas en venta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 23 years old, single, and lives with his family in Tongorrape sector, a rural, agricultural area in Motupe district, Lambayeque province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Lorenzo works as a passion fruit and lemon trader.  The area where he lives is noted for producing these fruits.  He acquires his products from the farmers in the area and then sells them to the processing plants in the area.  He also works as a laborer on a farm in his area.

Lorenzo would like to expand his business, obtaining stable capital so that he can continue acquiring more fruit to offer for sale.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will allow him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To expand his business, obtaining stable capital so that he can continue acquiring more fruit

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César tiene 47 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón, pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la ganadería y crianza de animales menores, el cría estos animales cerca a su domicilio cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive. El alimenta a sus animales con alimento balanceado y forraje. Los ingresos le ayudan para hacerse cargo de sostener la economía de su familia.

Actualmente César desea adquirir alimento para sus animales de modo que estos se desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a mejor precio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500  nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
César is 47 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  This is an area with a semi-tropical climate that is noted for mainly producing fruit such as mangoes, passion fruit and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

César works as a cattle and livestock farmer.  He raises his animals near his home and, when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to his neighbors and the traders who always visit his area.  He feeds his animals balanced animal feed and fodder.  He uses the profits he makes in this business to support his family financially.

Currently, César would like to acquire feed for his animals so that they develop better and can be sold at a better price.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative with which he hopes to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire feed for his animals so that they develop better and can be sold at a better price

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón, pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella cría estos animales en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento balanceado y forraje. Los ingresos le permiten ayudar a su esposo a sostener la economía de su familia.

Josefa desea adquirir alimento para sus animales de modo que estos se desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a mejor precio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500  nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Josefa, 54, is a mother living with her husband and children in the Tambogrande agricultural zone, a semitropical area characterized mainly by fruit crops like mango, passion fruit and lemons.  It’s part of Piura region and is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She raises small farm animals at home.  When they reach a good level of development she sells them to her neighbors and to merchants who frequent the area where she lives.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced animal feed and forage.  Income allows her to help her husband support the family’s economy.

Josefa wants to acquire feed for her animals so that they will develop better and be sold at a higher price.  She has, therefore, seen the need to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa she hopes will help her reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Aiymbubu

texts.en:
Aiymbubu K. is 48 years old and has four children. Aiymbubu was born into a low-income family and from early childhood, she had to help her parents around the house and earn money at the local diary factory. Aiymbubu got married at the age of 20. Soon she gave a birth to three daughters and one son. Unfortunately, her family life was not happy and she was divorced from her husband in 1997. As Aiymbubu became the only breadwinner for her children, she decided to start animal breeding. Using an initial amount of 15,000 Kyrgyz soms, she bought one milk cow, whose milk she sold to the dairy factory. Later on, her livestock grew and in order to reduce her expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastured her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. Now, Aiymbubu has two milk cows, two horses and 15 sheep at her farm. On the weekends, Aiymbubu and her son sells meat at the local market. 

As Aiymbubu is a very hardworking person, she is also engaged in sewing mattresses, cushions and coverings, which became very popular in her local area because of the low prices and good quality of her products. Now, Aiymbubu requests a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz soms to buy two bull calves for fattening and reselling.  It allows her further development of her household and business. In the future, she plans to hold her daughters’ weddings and give good dowries for them. Aiymbubu in a very positive person, who according to her motto, “nothing seek, nothing find”, makes every effort to provide her children with a prosperous life.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana V. is from the village of Nuesa. She is 26 years old. Joana is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Joana owns & operates a business venture selling cosmetics and apparel in the local community. Joana has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joana is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of Upper Inuman. She is 43 years old. Josephine is an individual member of PMPC. She is married with four schoolchildren and one infant. To make a living, Josephine work as a retailer of cosmetic products in the local community doing house to house selling.  

Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 17,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have additional capital to buy products.

location.town: Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Selling dried fish is the main part of 67-year-old Sen N.’ daily routine. Sen N. has been operating this business since 2000, and she earns an income in average $3 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a motor taxi driver. This couple has given birth to two children; both are single, and one of them is employed as a sewing worker at the garment industry.  Recently, Sen N. faces difficulties because her old house needs to be repaired and it is not comfortable for her and her family to live in. Because her saving is not enough to repair the broken house, Sen N. would like to request a loan from Kiva to add to her savings to repair her broken house.

loans.use: To repair her broken house.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is from the village of Nuesa. She is 35 years old. Rosemarie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Lopur Ekomol

texts.en:
Lopur has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 60 years old and married to Catherine Nabwaga. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy carrots, peas and tomatoes in bulk to sell.

In the future, Lopur hopes to open a big green grocer shop in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy carrots, peas and tomatoes in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy J. is 26 years old and a single lady. Nancy has three children: Nickson age 13 years, Brian 11 years and Kelvin five years. They all go to primary school.  Nancy sells cereals in Ndurio trading centre in Kabarnet town. She has been in the business for three years and she gets a monthly profit of Kshs. 4,500.  She has borrowed her first loan of Ksh 10,000 from KADET LTD and wants to use this money to buy maize worth Kshs 4,000 and beans worth Kshs. 6,000 for resale.

Nancy anticipates using the profits she gets to buy more cereals and to expand her business.  Her hopes and dreams are to meet the needs of her customers and to be able to support her family fully.

loans.use: To purchase cereals for sale

loans.name: April Mellowayne

texts.en:
April Mellowayne P. is from the village of Nuesa. She is 20 years old. April Mellowayne is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, April Mellowayne owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the community. April Mellowayne has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, April Mellowayne joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. April Mellowayne is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by April Mellowayne from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tima Ole

texts.en:
Tima Ole has been raising animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last one year.  He is 28 years old, married to Selina Tima and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 15 sheep, which he will raise and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Tima hopes to practice dairy farming which according to him is more stable and profitable.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep which he will raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Samuel Gachuhi

texts.en:
Samuel Gachuhi N. is 37 years old, married to Serah Mwangi and they have three children. He has operated his retail shop in Naivasha town for the last three years.

Samuel was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of 15,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to buy sweets, sugar, rice and flour in bulk to sell with the loan amount.

In the future, Samuel hopes to grow his retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sweets, sugar, rice and flour in bulk

loans.name: Michael Kinyanjui

texts.en:
Michael Kinyanjui N. is 36 years old, married to Hannah Muthoni and has two children. He has had a motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town for the last two years.

Michael was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 5,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to buy a new motorbike with the loan amount.

In the future, Michael hopes to buy a minibus to transport people from one place to another.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Stephen Mwangi

texts.en:
