Stephen Mwangi M. is 22 years old, married to Ivy Wanjiku, and they have one child. He has had a motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town for the last three years.

Stephen was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy a new motorcycle with the loan amount.

In the future, Stephen hopes to own a number of motorcycles, employing other people to operate them.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Peter Njunge

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 61 years old and is married to Eunice Wangari.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for planting.

In the future, Peter hopes to start a dairy farm.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: John Kinyua

texts.en:
John Kinyua K. has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years. He is 47 years old, married to Jacinta Wangari, and they have two children.

John was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm.

In the future, John hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Maryrose's Group

texts.en:
Maryrose A. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 23 years old. Maryrose is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maryrose is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Maryrose owns & operates a business operating motorcycle transport services. Maryrose has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maryrose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryrose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Maryrose is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maryrose from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Gladys Wanjriu

texts.en:
Gladys Wanjriu M. is 33 years old, married to Peter Karanja, and they have three children. She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years.

Gladys was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

In the future, Gladys hopes to practice large-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Yokasi

texts.en: Yokasi is a sixty year old, ambitious man, married to a teacher with six children. They live in a permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to set up a steady income generating activity for the family .He deals in lumber and has been in business for ten years and it is still reaping great benefits.Yokasi needs the loan to buy trees to cut up for lumber.

loans.use: Buying trees for lumber.

loans.name: Peter Njoroge

texts.en:
Peter Njoroge J. is 42 years old, married to Ruth Wanjiru, and they have four children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for over eighteen years now.

Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his third loan. He cleared all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to buy two dairy cows with the loan for milk production.

In the future, Peter hopes to increase his herd and practice large-scale dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Alice Kavithe

texts.en: Alice M. is 48 years old, married, and has two children.  She has been selling fruits and vegetables in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this is her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages in bulk to sell. In the future, Alice hopes to expand her shop and stock a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages in bulk to sell

loans.name: Phylis Wanjiku

texts.en: Phylis K. is 36 year old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.  She has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this is her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.  In the future, Phylis hopes to also practice dairy farming to diversify her sources of income.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Felista Wambui

texts.en: Felista, a 35-year-old single mother of five children, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan with which she plans to buy farm inputs and prepare to plant potatoes.  In the future, Felista hopes to practice large-scale farming and become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and prepare to plant potatoes

loans.name: Rahab Wairimu

texts.en:
Rahab Wairimu W. is 29 years old, married to Patrick Karanja, and they have three children. She has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last twelve years.

Rahab was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 30,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to buy two dairy cows with the loan amount.

In the future, Rahab hopes to employ modern farming methods to get the maximum yield from her farm.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Jovanis

texts.en: Jovanis is forty seven years old and a widow who lives with her four children in her own house in Fort Portal Uganda. The responsibility to take care of the family is vested in her and her dream is to educate her children up to university. She  has been selling old clothes for six years now and her business has enabled her to pay school fee.Jovanis needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees.

loans.name: Omar Gambo

texts.en:
Omar Gambo D. is a 47-year-old man married to Kibibi, and together they have been blessed with three children. Omar is a charcoal and firewood dealer and a water kiosk owner. He has been in these businesses for the last five years.

This being his first loan from KADET, Omar plans to purchase sacks of charcoal. He will direct the anticipated profits into the expansion of his firewood and water kiosk businesses.

Omar’s dream and hope is to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mzee Mbaruku

texts.en:
Mzee Mbaruku A. is a 47-year-old man married to Maimuna, and together they have been blessed with three children. Mzee is a retail shop owner and has been in this business for the last six years. His wife is a businesswoman who owns a water kiosk that generates additional income.

This being his first loan from KADET LTD, Mzee plans to purchase food to sell in his shop. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his business.

Mzee’s hopes and dreams are to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell in his shop

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à LAFIABOUGOU  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poisson frais, de tomates fraîches et de condiments  avec FATOUMATA B.. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 10 paniers de condiments de diverses qualités et 20 kg d’oignon. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de SIKASSO.
Elle vend à SIKASSO au marché de Médine et à  domicile au comptant  à une clientèle composée essentiellement des  femmes .
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group ("Harmony") is composed of four women, mostly married, who on average are 34 years old and have three children. Most of them live in a monogamous family in Lafiabougou, a neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is the first time that this group of women works with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. They sell fresh fish, fresh tomatoes and food condiments.

Mrs Fatoumata B., one of the group members, intends to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of condiments of various qualities and 20 kilograms of onions. She gets her supplies at the great market in Sikasso. She sells at the Médine market in Sikasso and from her home for cash to a clientele mostly made up of women.

Mrs B. expects to make an average profit of 35,000 CFA francs a month. Part of it will be saved or spent on household expenses, and any remaining amount will be invested in her business.

loans.use: Pour acheter des condiments alimentaires

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe LAFIA sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à LAFIABOUGOU  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso,(3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers tels les condiments alimentaires avec KOROTOUMOU D.. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 12 paniers de condiments de différentes sortes (20 kg d’oignon, des poivres, piments poudre de gombo, feuilles de baobab, cubes maggies, concentrées de tomates, etc.)  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso auprès ds grossistes. Elle vend à Sikasso au marché de Médine et à  domicile, en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement des  femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group named Lafia are mostly married women who are on average 33 years old and have 2 children each. They live in monogamous families in Lafiabougou, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They have sought out their first loan with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) in order to meet client demand. This group of women sells a variety of merchandise, such as condiments with Korotoumou D.. 

With their loan, they will purchase 12 baskets of a variety of condiments (20 kg each of onions, green peppers, gombo chili powder, baobab leaves, bullion cubes, tomato paste, etc). They make their purchases from the wholesalers in the large market in Sikasso. They sell their products in Sikasso, in the market of Medine and from their home. They complete the sales in cash and often on credit. Their clientele is mostly made up of women. 

Their forecasted earnings are a monthly sum of 45 FCFA, a part of which will be put away in savings and part will be used for the family's expenses.  The rest will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase condiments.

loans.name: Omar Ali

texts.en:
Omar Ali M. is a 38-year-old man. He is married to Shaima, and together they have been blessed with three children. His wife is a businesswoman who owns a water kiosk, which brings in additional income. Omar Ali is a poultry farmer. He has been in this business for the last two years and the business is doing well.

This is his first loan from KADET, and Omar plans to purchase chicks and chicken feed. The anticipated profits from his expanded business will be used to expand his wife’s business.

His dream is to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI est constitué de 8 femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans,  en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant majoritairement  dans des  familles monogames à  KABOILA I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits, de pagnes et de chaussures à l’image de AWA K..
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 90 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso et  de Bamako (capitale du Mali). 
Les chaussures s sont vendues au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The group name is Benkadi and it is made up of 8 women who are all married and are 36 years old on average. They have 2 children each and they majority of them live in monogamous families in Kaboila I, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They seek their third loan cycle with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) in order to meet client demand. This group of women is involved in the sale of garments, cloth wraps, and Awa K. brand shoes. 

With her loan they will purchase 90 pairs of shoes. She purchases her merchandise in the large market in Sikasso and in Bamako (capital city of Mali). 

The shoes are resold in the large market in Sikasso and to their families. The clientele is made up of both men and women and sales are completed in cash.

Her monthly earnings are forecasted to be 45 FCFA, a part of which will be used to support her husband in taking care of the family's daily expenses. A part will also be reinvested back into the business. 

Her ambition is to expand her business in order to better satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Paul Mwachongo

texts.en: Paul Mwachongo M. is 24 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school. Paul has been selling timber for the last five years and his business is doing well. This is Paul's second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more timber. The anticipated profits will be used for his children’s education. His dream for his family is to improve their standard of living. Paul also hopes to own several other businesses in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
KOTOGNOGONTALA  est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 36 ans,  2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures, de pagnes, de condiments alimentaires et de bois de chauffe avec SIRA S., qui compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 chargements de camions en bois de chauffe.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des marchés ruraux de bois et effectue ses ventes au grand marché de Sikasso et en famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 48.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Kotognogontala is a group of 10 married women who have are 36 years old on average. They have 2 children each and the majority of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They seek their seventh loan cycle from the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) in order to meet client demand. This group of women sells shoes, cloth wraps, condiments, and firewood with Sira S.. With their loan they will purchase 5 loads of firewood. 

She purchases her merchandise from the rural firewood markets and she resells the products in the large market in Sikasso and to their family. The client base is made up of both men and women and she completes her sales in cash and credit. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 48 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband meet the daily expenses, and some will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Kalosi

texts.en: Kalosi is a twenty six year old married man with a child, living in a rented house in Kamwenge Uganda. He dreams of building his own house. He sells second hand clothes and has been in business for two years amidst challenges of insufficient capital to meet the demands of his customers. Carlos needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: Buying second hand clothes for sell.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe  Sabali  sont  femmes mariées. Elles  ont en moyenne  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à  Mancourani I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pagnes et de chaussures avec WASSA C., qui compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso et  quelques fois à Bamako. Les chaussures s sont revendues au  grand marché de Sikasso et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, essentiellement au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités..
texts.en:
The five members of the group named Sabali are married women. On average they are 34 years old and they have 3 children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Mancourani I, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They seek their eighth loan through the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) in order to meet client demand. This group of women sells cloth wraps and shoes with Wassa C.. With their loan they hope to purchase 100 pairs of shoes. They purchase their merchandise in the large market in Sikasso and sometimes in Bamako. The shoes are resold in the large market in Sikasso and from their home to a clientele made up of both men and women. The sales are completed mostly in cash. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 75 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband meet the daily expenses, and some will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni M. is currently in the business of selling food stuffs and is requesting a loan to stock more food like bread, beer, soft drinks etc to sell.  Poni is 26 years old and is married to a husband who is a fisherman. She has 4 children and one child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock more food like bread, beer soft drinks etc to sell

loans.name: James Ngala

texts.en: James Ngala S. is 40 years old and married. His wife is a business woman. James is a café owner and has been in this business for one year. This is James' second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase sacks of rice, cereals, potatoes, and tomatoes. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of his business. His dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, cereals, potatoes, and tomatoes

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SORO YIRIWA  (3 femmes mariées  et 1 veuve) ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à Bougoula Ville, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits et légumes avec MADIALIA C., la présidente du groupe.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 30 sacs d’orange. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso et  dans les villages environnants.
Les fruits sont vendus au  grand marché de Sikasso et à domiciles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détails, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000fcfa dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Soro Yiriwa (3 married women and 1 widow) have an average age of 31 and they each have 2 children. They live in monogamous families in Bougoula Ville, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They seek their eighth loan through the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) in order to meet client demand. This group of women sells fruits and vegetables with Madiala C., the leader of the group. 

With her loan she hopes to purchase 30 sacks of oranges. She purchases her products in the large market in Sikasso and in the surrounding villages. 

The fruit is resold in the large market of Sikasso and from their home to a clientele made up of both men and women. The sales are completed in cash and credit. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 50 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband meet the daily expenses, and some will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits.

loans.name: Mackline

texts.en: Mackline is a twenty nine year old hardworking woman. She is a single mother of two children living in a rented house in Kamwenge Uganda with a desire to educate her children. For two years she has been dealing in second hand shoes and the business is still profitable. Her business desire is to set up a boutique. Mackline needs the loan to buy supplies of shoes.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies of shoes to sell

loans.name: Mary Wakini

texts.en: Mary Wakini W. is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  Mary has been a water vendor and a bodaboda operator in Shanzu for the 26 years and the businesses are doing well. This is her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to service her motor bike and renovate her business premise. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of her business. Mary’s dream for the future is to own rental equipment.

loans.use: To service her motor bike and renovate her business premise

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia C. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Virginia is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business venture in retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling some grocery items and other basic commodities in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kahondo Twimu Group

texts.en:
Silver is fifty years old, married with six children living in his own house in Kamwenge Uganda with a desire to educate his children up to the university level.  He has been farming tobacco for seven years now and he confesses to have not met any big challenges as the business is steadily progressing.  

He started with capital of five hundred but now has two million.  He is a member of the Kahondo Group where each member guarantees the other.  Silver needs the credit facility to plant more tobacco.

loans.use: To plant more tobbacco.

loans.name: Lilian Onyuma

texts.en:
Lilian Onyuma O. is a 38-year-old lady married to Dominic, and together they are blessed with three children. Lilian is a grocery shop owner and a charcoal dealer in Shanzu. She has been in this business for the last three years.

This marks Lilian’s second loan from KADET LTD. With the loan, she plans to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business. Her anticipated profits will be directed to her children’s education.

Lilian’s dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Salome Mnyazi

texts.en:
Salome Mnyazi S. is a 29-year-old single lady. She owns a grocery shop located in Majaoni and has been in business for the last two years.

This being her second loan from KADET LTD, Salome plans to purchase a stock of groceries and cover her sundry expenses. Salome’s anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of her business.

Salome’s hope is to own a permanent store.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of groceries and cover her sundry expenses

loans.name: Michael Jira

texts.en:
Michael Jira K. is a 38-year-old man married to Florence, and they have been blessed with six children. Michael owns a video café in Jomvu and has been in business for one year, while Florence is a business lady who owns a vegetable kiosk. Together they support their family.

This marks Michael’s first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase the latest new movies and seats for the café. He also plans to expand his wife’s vegetable kiosk with the anticipated profits.

Michael’s hope is to succeed in life.

loans.use: To improve his video café and expand his wife's kiosk

loans.name: Kabebere Group

texts.en: David is a forty seven year old married man living in his own house with eight children in Kamwenge, Uganda.  The responsibility of taking care of the family rests solely on him.  His dream is to set up an income generating activity for the them.  For ten years he has been a mechanic and he also sells spare parts which has enabled him to live a moderate life.  David needs the loan facility to buy spare parts for sale.  He is a member of Kabebere Group where each member guarantees the other.

loans.use: Buying spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Mayrambek

texts.en:
Mayrambek T. is 46 years old, married and has three children: his elder son serves in the army, one daughter has graduated and the youngest daughter is a schoolgirl.  After finishing school, Mayrambek worked as a driver at the local cargo station.  In order to support his family and find an additional source of income, he decided to start his own business in cattle breeding.  With the starting capital of 10,000 KGS, he managed to develop his farm and earn about 3,000 KGS a month. 

For successful implementation of his plans for maintaining his own farm with a large number of cattle, he took his first loan from Bai Tushum, which was used as intended and repaid without any delays.  Now Mayrambek has applied for a loan of 70,000 KGS to broaden his farm by purchasing ten sheep and two colts. With the additional revenues, he plans to increase the number of cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase ten sheep and two colts.

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday T. is currently in the bussiness of selling aicohol and food stuffs.  She is requesting a loan from Brac Southern Sudan in order to stock more beer, soft drinks, etc. to sell.  She is 45 years old and is widowed.  Monday has 4 children and 1 goes to school.  She hopes to build a concrete shop in the future.

loans.use: To stock more beer, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden K., a female who lives in Hai-gabat, Juba, Southern South Sudan.  She sells food like onions, tomatoes, etc.   Her future plan is to build a house for rent to help pay for her kid's school fees.

loans.use: To stock food like onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Betty  Wamboi

texts.en:
Betty Wamboi M. is a 29-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Titus and together they have three children. For the last three years, Betty has been selling clothes in Bamburi as her primary business. She also sells sausages to most of her customers who come to buy clothes.

This being her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to purchase more clothes to add to her stock. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of her business. Her dreams and hopes for the future are to own a car and become a supplier.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Bigoro Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Edinasi is a forty nine year old single mother of six children living in her own house in Kamwenge, Uganda.  The responsibility of taking care of the family is vested in her and she has a family dream of setting up an income generating activity for the family. 

For ten years she has been a farmer and the business is profitable despite challenges due to seasonal changes.  Eddmusi needs the loan facilty to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: Buying seeds for planting

loans.name: Chizi Mwero

texts.en:
Chizi Mwero N., 38 years old, is married and together with her spouse they have seven children. Chizi owns a food café and has been in this business for the last twelve years. This marks her second loan from KADET LTD. 

She plans to invest the loan to purchase flour, rice and cereals and to renovate the café. She has directed the anticipated profits to her children’s education. Her dream is to own a big hotel.

loans.use: to purchase flour, rice and cereals and to renovate the café

loans.name: Samira

texts.ru: Алимхонова Самира проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 36 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает таксистом. Сама Самира тоже работает таксистом. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Он перевозит людей с одного места на другое. До этого она работала по профессии. У нее высшее образование, экономист. Проработала по профессии 5 лет. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите. Целью кредита является покупка автозапчасти. На полученную прибыль Самира хочет купить бытовую технику и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: A. Samira lives in the Rudaki region. She's thirty-six years old, married and has four children. Both she and her husband work as experienced      taxi drivers. Samira has a degree in economics and worked as an economist for five years prior to becoming a cab driver. She's asking for a loan in order to purchase some spare parts. She plans to acquire some household appliances and fix up her house with the profit.

loans.use: To buy spare automobile parts

loans.name: Beatrice Akinyi

texts.en: Beatrice Akinyi O. is a 35-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Kelvin and has been blessed with three children. Beatrice owns a butchery as her primary business and she also practises dairy farming. Beatrice has been in this business for the last four years and it is doing well. This marks her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to purchase a dairy cow. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of her business and to her children’s education. Her dream is to own a number of rentals.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Specioza is 30 years old, married and has two children who are six and seven years old.  Currently, both of her children attend school.  Specioza sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for four years.  Her husband is a motorbike spare parts dealer.  

Specioza will use the loan to purchase more bananas and beans.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Specioza plans to increase her sales. In the future, she plans to have one million as capital.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Bayaraa G. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvs Province in Mongolia.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His wife works as an engineer for the Gold company which is operated on seasonal. 

Bayaraa operates a trading business.  He travels through the countryside selling a variety of goods such as salt, silk, fabrics, tea etc, to the herders and in return he gets raw materials which he then sells to the local market for profit.  He started his business in 2005 and has gained much experience in his trade.  After years of operation, he managed to expand his business and his working capital has increased by 1,300,000 MNT.  Bayaraa is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items and other products for his trade.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing items and other products for his trade.

loans.name: Suzane

texts.en:
Suzane owns a business that sells vegetables.  She is 38 years old, married and has three children who are between the ages of thirteen and sixteen years old.  Her husband works as a mason.  Suzane has been selling vegetables for 15 years.  

Suzane's loan will be used to add more oranges, pineapple and yellow bananas to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a house and she hopes to pay school fees for her children for the coming years.

loans.use: To add more oranges, pineapple and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 34 years old, married and has three children who are in the range of 5 to 12 years old. Currently, two of her children are enrolled in school. Charlotte sells vegetables, which she has done for four years. Unfortunately, her husband is currently in prison.  

Charlotte will use the loan to purchase pineapples, avocados and green bananas. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charlotte plans to buy more houses for renting because she has many houses, which also generates income. In addition, she would like to sell livestock in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Annonciate

texts.en:
Annonciate is a 32-year-old widow with two children who go to school. Annonciate sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for two years.  

Annonciate will use the loan to purchase more potatoes and bananas for additional sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Annonciate plans to reinvest in the business for continuous growth. She dreams of owning a stock of foodstuffs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is a 28-year-old married man with two children. He also cares for his sister. Currently one of his children goes to school. Jean Pierre sells charcoal, which he has done for nine years. His wife is a teacher. 

Jean Pierre will use the loan to purchase charcoal to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Jean Pierre plans to renovate a house and he dreams of becoming a wholesaler and owning a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. One of her children attends school. Dative sells meat, which she has done for seven years. Her husband works in a cinema show. 

Dative will use the loan to purchase more meat. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dative plans to reinvest in her business and to help her family. In addition, she dreams of having more than one butchery in the future.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell in her butcher shop

loans.name: Pelomina

texts.en:
Pelomina Y. is 30 years old and married with five children. Four go to school while the other works. 

Y. is in the business of selling soft drinks and water. She lives in Hai Gabat, Juba, southern Sudan. She hopes to build a bigger shop in the future.

loans.use: To stock more drinks

loans.name: Tseveen

texts.en: Tseveen B. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in a rented enclosure. Tseveen manages a shoemaking business in his home with help of his wife. He started his business in 2008 and has since built a stable operation. He can produce about 8-10 pairs of shoes per month which he sells at the local market, earning between 150,000 and 180,000 MNT profit monthly. His earnings have enabled him to open a saving account for him and his child. For the future, Tseveen says, "I plan to save enough money so that I can afford to buy my own plot of land and enclosure for my family." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary tools, materials such as leathers, and other supplies used in making his shoes.

loans.use: to purchase necessary tools and materials

loans.name: Tseren

texts.en: Tseren J. is 57 years old  and lives with her husband and three daughters in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live in an apartment which was purchased as an apartment leasing loan. All three daughters attend university. Her husband has operated a raw material trading business for many years and has built a stable operation over this time. Tseren is a trader, traveling between Russian and Mongolia to sell variety of goods between the countries. After years of hard work for both Tseren and her husband, they were able to increase their working capital for both of their businesses and their earnings have enabled them to buy a new mini truck and apartment for their family. Tseren is a modest woman and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing material for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material

loans.name: Jenipher Dorcus

texts.en: Jenipher Dorcus O., 45 years old, is married to Thomas and they have five children. Jenipher is a tailor and has been in the tailoring business for the last four years with a good income. This being her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to purchase more materials for making clothes. The anticipated profits have been directed to her children’s education. Her dream is to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Said Hamadi

texts.en:
Said Hamadi U., 36 years old, is married to Sofia and they have  two children. His wife is a businesswoman who owns a food kiosk and together they support the family. Said has been repairing bicycles and motorbikes for the last five years.

Said Hamadi U. has never borrowed from any other MFI. This marks his second loan from KADET, and he plans to invest the loan to buy new spare parts. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of his motorbike repair business. His hope and dream is to succeed in life through KADET LTD.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Pierre and his beauty salon business in Kigali, Rwanda! Jean Pierre is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 4 and 13 and two adopted orphans. Jean Pierre, who has been in the credit association since 2004, has a salon business in Kigali which attracts many working-class clients. He employs two people in his salon. He also works in the African Library.

Jean Pierre has requested a loan to buy two helmet hair dryers for his salon, which will be enable him to attract more customers and earn more profit. With this profit, Jean Pierre will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy two helmet hair dryers for his salon

loans.name: Mohamed Bonaya

texts.en: Mohamed Bonaya K. is 50 years old, married, and has four children. Mohamed has been a rental house owner and a water vendor for the last six years. This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he plans to renovate the water pump. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of his business. His hope for the future is to add more water pipes.

loans.use: To renovate the water pump

loans.name: Umurungi

texts.en:
Umurungi is a 38-year-old, married woman with two children between the ages of 10 and 13 years old.  She also cares for one relative. Her husband works in the government, while she sells products such as beans, rice, potatoes, and other products.  Umurungi has been working in this business for about ten years.  Her business is open from 5 a.m. to 5 p.m. most days of the week.

Umurungi will use the requested loan to purchase more beans for sale.  She will reinvest any profits made from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 32 years old and married.   She has one child who is one year old.  Marie Grace has been selling clothes for about three years.  Her business hours are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Saturday.

Marie Grace requests this loan through the Kiva partner Vision Finance Company to purchase more clothes to sell.  The extra income generated from the loan will help her reinvest in the future and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 30 years old and married with three children between the ages 4 and 10 years old. Jeannette sells new clothes, mainly wedding clothes. She has been in this business for about two years.  The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Jeannette will use this loan to purchase a variety of clothing styles for men and women.  With this loan, Jeannette envisions growing her business to such an extent that she can even start wholesaling.  Any profits from her expanded stock will be used for further business reinvestment, allowing her to continue to build a better future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Bonavanture

texts.en:
Bonavanture is 31 years old and is married with five children between the ages 1 and 14 years old.  Bonavanture is a self-employed businessman who sells cassava flour.  His shop is open from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day and he has been working in the business for five years. He is an ambitious man.

Bonavanture will use this loan to purchase a large quantity of cassava flour.  With this large quantity, he will also start wholesaling. He hopes to earn more profit to help provide for his family and to save in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Saverino

texts.en: Saverino is a 35-year-old woman, married to a driver with six children. She lives in a rented house in Kamwenge, Uganda, longing to educate her children. She has been operating a hotel for three years now and the income generated has helped her pay school fees for her children. Saverino needs credit to buy food for the hotel.

loans.use: To buy food to sell

loans.name: Henriette

texts.en:
Henriette is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of six and 11 years old. She lives in Gasabo district, where she owns a shop selling charcoal. Her business is open from 7 am to 6 pm every day. Since Henriette has only one year of experience, her profit is still too low to expand meaningfully, but she believes that a small amount of additional capital would positively change her life.

Henriette has requested her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal. She is photographed next to her sacks of charcoal above.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian forma parte del banco comunal “Los Principiantes” de la ciudad de Linares.  Ella se dedica a la artesanía en artículos de decoración, como pinturas en cuadros,  cajas de madera y cartón, restauración de antigüedades y muebles entre otras cosas, desde hace 20 años.  Tiene un taller para elaborar sus productos en el patio trasero de su casa. 
Lilian comenzó a trabajar independiente cuando aprendió a pintar sobre tela, en un curso gratuito. Con el tiempo fue investigando por su cuenta y aprendiendo otras técnicas para usar diversos materiales, perfeccionándose en su trabajo.
Actualmente, tiene varios clientes, quienes son trabajadores de empresas conocidas de su ciudad. 
Con este préstamo comprará materiales.
Su sueño es tener un vehículo más grande para transportar su mercadería y así poder venderla más fácilmente. 
Liliana es la única fuente laboral de su hogar. Tiene 5 hijos, pero vive solo con los 2 menores, de 17 y 20 años. 
A Lilian le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha podido ir creciendo en su negocio al invertir en mas materiales. Además le ha sido muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo y aprender sobre cómo administrar su negocio, durante las reuniones. 
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Lilian is a member of the "Los Principiantes" (The Beginners) community bank in the city of Linares.  She has been in the handicrafts business for twenty years, making decorations such as paintings and boxes made from wood and cardboard.  She also restores antiques and furniture.

Lilian has a workshop in the area behind her home where she makes her products.  She started working independently when she learned to paint on fabric through a free course.  Over time, she did some research of her own and learned other techniques for using other materials, perfecting her work.  She currently has several customers who work for well-known businesses in her city.  

Lilian will use this loan to buy materials.  Her dream is to have a larger vehicle for transporting her merchandise so that she can sell her products more easily.  Lilian's is the only source of income for her household.  She has five children but now only lives with her two youngest who are 20 and 17.  Fondo Esperanza's loans have been very useful for Lilian since she has been able to grow her business, investing in more materials.  It has also been pleasant for her to share with her fellow group members and to learn how to run her business during the group meetings.

Linares is an important urban center in Maule region which is located in the country' central zone.  Farming and wine production are important activities in this area and a lot of the products are exported.  Some of the main crops grown here are cereals (rice, wheat, corn and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbate, lettuce, chard and other vegetables) and fruit.  Linares is the main rice-producing province in Chile.  In fact, 78% of the national production of this cereal is grown in this province, especially in the town of Parral.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: Habib is 42 years old with five children, and married to a teacher. He lives in an owned house in Kamwenge, Uganda, and has a dream of educating his children to attain higher qualifications. He trades in coffee and has been in business for five years, despite challenges in price fluctuations and limited capital. His desire is to become one of the biggest dealers of coffee. Habib intends to use the credit facility to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 58 years old and married with two children between the ages 17 and 26. Angelique runs a butcher business, where she sells beef to the local community. She has a shop where she employs three people to help her run the business.

Angelique will use the loan to purchase two cows, with the aim of expanding her business. With this loan, she hopes to earn more profits which will be used to continue paying school fees for her three relatives, as well as build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Lilian Syokwia

texts.en: Lilian Syokwia C. is 28 years old, married, and has three children. Lilian sells second-hand clothes in the Bamburi open air market which is very busy and she has many customers. She also sells water and eggs. She has been in this business for the last two years and earns a good income. This is her second loan from KADET. She plans to renovate her business premises and add more clothes to her inventory. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of her business. Her dream is to own many kiosks.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises and add more clothes for sale

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is 37 years old and is married with three children. Gerard has been in the business of selling meat for about two years, and his business is open from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Gerard has requested a loan to increase his working capital, purchase more meat to sell and offer better service to his customers. He plans to use his profits to build a house.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and purchase more produce to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber, nails and wood varnish

loans.name: Derick

texts.en: Derick is a 20-year-old, hard working man, living in a rented house in Kamwenge, Uganda. For two years, he has been selling second hand shoes, and with the income generated, he has been able to support his parents. His major constraint is not having enough funds, and his business desire is to sell new shoes. Derick needs the loan facility to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand shoes

loans.name: Carolyne Owuor

texts.en: Carolyne Owuor A. is 50 years old, married, and has four children. Carolyne owns a vegetable grocery and also sells charcoal and paraffin to her customers.  This business has been in operation for the last eight years.  This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase vegetables, charcoal, and paraffin. The anticipated profits have been directed into the expansion of her business. Her dream is to own rentals houses in the future.

loans.use: purchase of vegetables, charcoal, and paraffin

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah O. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Aidah has a retail shop business, which she has run for ten years.         
To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Aidah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Aidah hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and milk

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert W. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Robert has a butcher's business, which he has run for five years.
To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more meat. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Robert hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Felicie

texts.en:
Felicie is 35 years old and is married with three children. She has owned her small general store for about four years. The hours of her business are from 6 am until 8 pm every day.

Felicie has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her shop by adding enough foodstuffs like sugar, rice, different types of flour and other goods, which seem to be in high demand in her area. Felicie plans to start saving, as well as improve her family's situation, with any profits that she earns.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 31 years old, and married with two children aged three and five. He is a hardworking man who runs a retail shop. His wife assists him in running his business. He started the business two years ago. Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his finances. He hopes to grow his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 40,000 KES to buy cooking fat, maize, beans and sugar.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, maize, beans and sugar

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty years old, married to a businessman, and has two children living in her own house in Kamwenge Uganda. She aspires to educate her children through university level. She has been trading in produce for four years and the business is very profitable, even amidst the challenge of price fluctuation. Agnes needs the loan to buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: Purchasing beans and maize for sale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a twenty-seven year-old hardworking married man with two children living in a rented house in Kamwenge Uganda. His ambition is to build his own house. He has been trading in produce for three years and the business is very profitable amidst the challenge of price fluctuation. Stephen needs the loan to buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac M. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Isaac has a grocery store business, which he has run for four years.
To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for his store. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Isaac hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Isaac hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his store

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en: Wilbroad is fifty years old, married, and has eight children. He lives with his family in their own house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He desires to educate all his children. He has a retail shop and has also been a farmer for over fifteen years, and his business is still profitable. His constraint is lack of enough capital to fund his business, and his dream is to have a wholesale shop. Wilbroad needs the loan to buy sugar, soap and salt for selling in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap and salt for resale

loans.name: Juma Abwoga

texts.en: Juma Abwoga T. is 34 years old and he has been a computer service provider for the last two years in Mwatate. His business is doing well. This is his second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more computer accessories and stationery for his business. The anticipated profits will be directed to the expansion of his business. His hope for the future is to own a bigger business premise.

loans.use: To purchase more computer accessories and stationery for his business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet A. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are currently in school. Juliet has a boutique business, which she has run for five years. She also has a bar.
To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 1,600,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for her boutique. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Juliet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 29-year-old single woman with three children, all below the age of 16. The family lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Jennifer has a dream of building a house for her family.
Jennifer knits sweaters and has also worked as a tailor for over a year now. Her business is profitable and it has allowed her to pay her children's school fees. Her business ambition is to own one of the biggest tailoring firms in town. Jennifer is requesting a loan to buy knitting yarn.

loans.use: To buy knitting yarn

loans.name: Getrude Khisa

texts.en:
Getrude Khisa N. is a single mother of five children. The family lives in Mitume in the town of Kitale, where Getrude's business is located. Getrude has been in the tailoring business for twenty years now and she earns a monthly income of 16,000 KES.

This will be Getrude's first loan from KADET and she plans to use the entire amount to buy materials for making school uniforms. With the income she will receive, she plans to expand her business by buying one more sewing machine that will make her work move faster. In the future, she wants to raise her family's living standard and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making school uniforms

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 45-year-old married man who is blessed with six children. He has been selling paint for two years. He has employed one person in his business. Julius appreciates Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for helping him to grow his business. This is because he uses his savings with Faulu Kenya to boost his business. With this loan of 20,000 KES, he will buy paint.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Ferdinand Njoroge

texts.en:
Ferdinand Njoroge N., 47 years old, is married to Nancy Wairimu and together they have four children aged between 8 and 20. They live in Eldoret. Ferdinand has been selling scrap metal for seven years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES from the business.

This will be Ferdinand's sixth loan from KADET LTD. He has been repaying all his other loans well and he plans to use this entire loan to buy scrap metal to add to his stock. With the income he is going to receive, he plans to add more stock so that he can earn even more income. His dream is to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal for resale

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 30 years old and the mother of a 4-year-old child. She has been operating a phone and phone accessories business in Nairobi since 2008 and has found it profitable. This is her primary business. With this loan, she plans to use 30,000 KES to buy more phones, 15,000 KES to add more phone accessories and 5,000 KES for more airtime for the community phones so as to maximize her profits. In the future, she hopes to expand and have the business stabilize, as well as open other outlets.

loans.use: to buy more phones, phone accessories and airtime

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en:
Ernestine, a 30-year-old married mother of three children between the ages three and six years old, is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Those goods include cosmetic products such as body lotion and toothpaste as well as foodstuffs including rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil. In business for six years, her shop is open from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. everyday.

Ernestine will use this loan to purchase a large quantity of sugar and rice, as they are in high demand. With this large quantity, she will also start wholesaling as she hopes to earn more profit to help provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sugar and rice

loans.name: Jephitha Mogere

texts.en: Jephitha Mogere M. is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He has been in the electronic business for the last four years. This is his second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more electronic items for his business. With the anticipated profits, he plans to open another business. His dream for the future is to open another electronics shop.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic items

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris, currently in a business brewing alcohol, is requesting a loan to start another business such as wholesale trade.  Doris, who is 28 years old, married to a farmer and has three children, two of whom attend school, is hoping to buy a plot of land for her business in the future.

loans.use: To start another business such as wholesale trade.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 32 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 11 years old and three adoptees. Her husband is a nurse, and they both work hard to provide all of the basic needs of their family. For the past four years, Jeanne has garnered much experience operating a small business selling telephones. She works from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. everyday, and her business is well-known.

One of the problems she faces is a lack of capital, so Jeanne is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business through the purchase of additional items, thereby enabling her to attract more customers and earn more profit.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Luchando Por Nuestros Sueños Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Luchando por Nuestros Sueños” y está conformado por 19 emprendedores, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chimbarongo.
Alexis, quien es el presidente de este grupo, en la foto se ubica en la última fila, por el centro y viste camisa blanca.  Él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de alfajores, cuchuflies y chocolates, desde hace 1 año. Trabaja en su casa y vende sus productos en almacenes y a particulares.
Con este préstamo comprará materiales para hacer sus productos, tanto los ingredientes, como los palitos y envoltorios para los chocolates.
Tiene una hijita de 12 años.  Su sueño es tener un local establecido y vender por mayor.
A Alexis le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, especialmente cuando sus ventas han sido más bajas. También está muy contento de compartir con sus compañeros de grupo.
Chimbarongo es una comuna ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins, 150 km. al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "lugar entre nieblas". La economía de Chimbarongo está basada principalmente en la elaboración de artesanías en mimbre, en el cultivo de frutales y la producción de vino.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Luchando por Nuestros Sueños” (Fighting for our Dreams) and is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who live in the city of Chimbarongo.

You can see Alexis, the group's president, in the center of the photo, in the back row, wearing a white shirt.  His business is making and selling 'alfajores' (traditional small cakes) , 'cuchuflíes' (filled sponge fingers) and chocolates.  He has been in this business for one year.  He works at home and sells his products in stores and also to individuals.

Alexis will use this loan to buy materials for making his products, both ingredients and little sticks and wrappings for the chocolates.  He has a 12 year-old daughter.  His dream is to have an established premises and to sell his products wholesale.

Fondo Esperanza's loans have been very useful for Alexis, especially when his sales have been very low.  He is also very happy to share with his fellow group members.

Chimbarongo is a town located in Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region, 150km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  Its name, in Mapudungan (the Mapuche language) means "place between the clouds".  Chimbarongo's economy is based mainly on the production of wicker handicrafts, growing fruit and wine production.

loans.use: To buy materials and ingredients

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: El Señor Gustavo se dedica al transporte de personas en el área urbana el tiene un auto con el que trabaja y de esta manera genera ingresos para su manutención y para ayudar a su familia especialmente a sus papas que son de edad avanzada.  Sus padres alquilan vajillas para acontecimientos y el señor Gustavo cuando hay contratos  trabaja de garzón junto con su padre, el es soltero y es de gran ayuda para sus padres por que siempre está pendiente de ellos. El financiamiento que se le otorgó es para la compra de llantas para su vehículo y mantenimiento del mismo, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gustavo provides taxi services in an urban area.  He owns a car with which he works and this is how he makes income to support and help his family, especially his mom and dad who are elderly.  His parents rent out dinner services for events and, when there are contracts, Gustavo works as a waiter together with his father.  Gustavo is single and a great help to his parents as he is always looking out for them.  

Gustavo will use this loan to buy tires for his vehicle and to have some maintenance work done on it.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support he has been offered.

loans.use: To maintain and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 47 años, vive en su casa  que es propia, junto a su esposo y también con sus 2 hijos que aún estudian en el colegio.Se dedica a  la venta de pantalones, camisas, blusas y zapatillas, de marcas conocidas, pues  su hijo trabaja en tiendas comerciales de prestigio y se las brindan a módicos precios. Estas prendas son muy costosas en el mercado, pero ella las comercializa  a precios bajos y al alcance de sus clientes,  que constantemente le realizan cantidad de  pedidos. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que  las  ventas son rápidas, por ello en cuanto tiene las prendas no duda en ofrecer a determinados clientes, de acuerdo a la moda y época. Desde hace años se dedica a  este negocio, y ofrece sus prendas de casa en casa, lo cual le resulta muy rentable, pues no gasta en movilidad, lo único es que debe caminar bastante. Para el futuro tiene planeado construir su casa en el terreno que le cedieron  sus suegros, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.Es el 11avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le crédito que necesita será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo se desempeña en su grupo comunal como una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cuál es muy respetada.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa casual como pantalones jeans, zapatos y zapatillas de esta manera espera abastecer los pedidos pendientes y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children who are still studying at high school.

María's business is selling well-known brands of pants, shirts, blouses and sneakers since her son works in prestigious stores and receives these products at reasonable prices.  These items of clothes are very expensive but María sells them at low prices which are affordable to her customers who make frequent orders for her products.  What she most likes about her business is that she makes quick sales.  As soon as she has garments to sell she doesn't hesitate in offering them to certain customers, according to the fashion and season.

María has been in this business for years and she offers her clothes from house to house which is very profitable as she doesn't have to pay any transportation costs.  The only thing she has to do is walk quite a lot.

In the future, María plans to build her own home on the plot of land that her in-laws gave her.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

This is María's 11th loan with MFP and she knows that the loan she needs will be very useful in making progress in her business.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank, for this reason she is very well respected by her fellow group members.  María plans to invest her money in buying a larger quantity of casual clothes such as pants, jeans, shoes and sneakers.  In this way she hopes to fill her pending orders and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy clothes and sneakers to stock her business

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Greetings from Speciose, who runs a beauty salon business in Kigali, Rwanda. Speciose is 54 years old and is married with six children and four adopted children.
Speciose has ten years' experience in the salon business. Her salon in Kigali attracts many working-class clients. She employs three people in the salon. One of the challenges in her business is not having enough equipment, especially for women clients. Therefore, Speciose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase additional equipment for cutting hair.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for cutting hair

loans.name: Guido Ismael

texts.es: El Joven Guido es soltero  se dedica a la confección,  y heredo el negocio de la confección de la abuela  y la mamá, el tiene buen manejo de costura realiza confección de edredones, almohadas y cojines vive en la casa de sus padres, su taller es pequeño, durante el día trabaja en una empresa de textiles como asistente administrativo, espera a un futura poder consolidad una empresa amplia y propia ya que conoce el manejo de este tipo de actividad. Esta muy contento por contar con el préstamo que lo utilizara en la compra de tela e hilos para la confección de edredones que le pidieron y anticipa que mas adelante solicitará para una maquina de cocer mas moderna, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Young Guido is single and his business is sewing.  He inherited his sewing business from his grandmother and his mom.  He sews well and makes comforters, pillows and cushions.  He lives in his parents' home.

Guido's workshop is small.  During the day he works in a textile company as an administrative assistant.  He hopes in the future that he will be able to set up a big company of his own since he knows how to run this kind of business.  He is very happy to be receiving this loan which he will use to buy fabric and threads for making comforters that people have asked him for.  He anticipates requesting a new loan in the future to buy a more modern sewing machine.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy material, fabric and threads

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Magret makes a living selling charcoal and is applying for this loan to open a place where she can sell her goods. She is 25 years old, married to a salesman and has two children, both of whom are in school. In the future, she hopes to build and open a restaurant.

loans.use: To open a shop where she can sell charcoal

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, provincia de Quispicanchis, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Oswaldo; El socio tiene 32 años de edad, el socio es conviviente; el socio tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja administrando su tienda de abarrotes, el socio requiere el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería, el socio comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y todo al por mayor, el también comprara leche y otros productos básicos, El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos básicos para implementar su tienda.
El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Oswaldo belongs to the Virgen Asunta de Oropesa Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the Oropesa district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.  

Oswaldo is 32 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  He works managing his grocery store.  He needs the loan to be able to buy merchandise.  He will buy rice, sugar, noodles, and oil.  He will buy these items wholesale.  He will also buy milk and other basic products.  Oswaldo is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to stock his grocery store.  He is also requesting the loan to buy basic products to supply his store.

He is happy with the loan that was granted, and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy basic products for his store

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en: Annonciatha is 39 years old, married and has one child who is 10 years old. She has made a living as a tailor for the last five years and makes clothing for both women and men who live in her area. She also makes school uniforms for young children. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day, and also trains young men and women to become tailors so that they can have a marketable skill. She has applied for this loan to buy more sewing materials for his workshop.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a tailor shop

loans.name: Genaro Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Genaro es cliente antiguo de la  institución trabaja con nosotros desde el año 2005 el Sr. Genaro es un cliente responsable y puntual, el trabaja realizando la confección de buzos y deportivos los cuales los reparte la su esposa la señora Carmen en las ciudades de Oruro y Potosí, el día miércoles viaja a Oruro donde reparte sus deportivos en la feria al día siguiente se traslada a Potosí, Doña Carmen viaja casi toda la semana y Don Genaro se dedica a la educación de sus hijos, tienen tres hijos el mayor de ellos esta en la academia de policías se encuentra en el segundo año sus otras dos hijas estudian en la universidad, el sr.  Genaro trabaja además con su minibús con el cual sale a trabajar desde muy temprano el tiene su propia casita y trabaja mucho por sacar adelante a sus hijos, el crédito que están solicitando es para la compra de telas para la realización de deportivos ya que tienen pedidos por fin de año.
texts.en:
Genaro, a longtime client of the institution, has worked with us since 2005.  He is a responsible and punctual client.  He works making sweatshirts and sports clothing.  His wife, Carmen, delivers the clothing in the cities of Oruro and Potosí.  On Wednesdays she travels to Oruro, where she delivers the sportswear at the fair.  The next day she goes to Potosí.  Carmen travels almost all week.

Genero devotes himself to their children’s education.  The oldest child is in his second year at the police academy.  His other two daughters attend the university.  Genaro also works with his minibus, and he leaves to work very early.  He has his own little house, and he works a lot to get his children ahead.

He is requesting the loan to buy fabric to make sweatshirts because he has orders for the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make sweatshirts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo, y sus dos hijos, que  aún estudian.Rosa, se dedica a la preparación y venta de papas rellenas (de carne molida)  en la puerta de un colegio muy popular de su distrito, y  esta situado a siete  cuadras de su casa. Ella sancocha las papas, luego las aplasta uniformemente, y después las enrolla con el aderezo de carne dentro y por ultimo las  fríe en aceite caliente. Después, carga todas las papas en su fuente grande y se ubica en la puerta del colegio, donde los alumnos del colegio le compran sus papas rellenas. De esta manera Rosa realiza sola  su negocio y le va muy bien, pues con su buen trato, todos los alumnos la estiman. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es conversar con las madres de los alumnos, de modo que les alerta del comportamiento de sus hijos, y  se siente muy feliz con su labor. Desde hace más de 15 años cocina sus papas, y se siente más que satisfecha por lo rentable que es el negocio. Para más adelante, piensa instalar una bodega en su casa y de ese modo ampliar su negocio.Es el 11avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a posteriores créditos para continuar progresando.Rosa tiene planeado invertir  el dinero del préstamo , en la compra de juguetes y sandalias para vender ambulatoriamente, mientras los alumnos del colegio donde comercializa  están de vacaciones, y así quiere continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 44, is a very hard-working mother.  She lives with her husband and their two children in their own house.  The children are still in school.
