She makes stuffed potatoes (with ground meat), and she sells them at the door of a very popular school in her district.  Her business is seven blocks from her house.  She parboils the potatoes and then uniformly flattens them.  After that, she rolls it up with seasoning and the meat inside.  Her last step is to fry them in hot oil.

She then loads the potatoes on her large platter and sets herself up at the door of the school.  That is where the students buy her stuffed potatoes from her.  This is the way that Rosa works alone in her business, and it is going very well for her.  With her good service, all of the students value her.  What she likes the best about her work is talking with the students’ mothers.  She watches out for their children, and she is very happy with her work.

She has been cooking her potatoes for over 15 years.  She is more than satisfied with the profitability of the business.  Later, she plans to set up a grocery store in her house in order to expand her business.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments punctually.  She wants to access future loans in order to continue progressing.  Rosa plans to use the loan to buy toys and sandals to sell in an itinerant manner.  She will do this when the students of the school where she sells are on vacation.   She wants to continue getting ahead that way.

loans.use: To buy toys and sandals to sell

loans.name: Louise

texts.en: Louise is 26 years old, married and has two children who are one and five years old. She is also raising two orphans who she has adopted. For the last seven years, Louise has made a living as a tailor, making clothing for both men and women who live in her area and school uniforms for children. She has three sewing machines, employs two people and works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily. She also trains young girls and boys who have been unable to attend school so they will have a marketable skill when they grow up. Louise has applied for this loan to buy more sewing materials for her workshop.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials for her workshop.

loans.name: Holga Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, provincia de Quispicanchis, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Holga; La socia tiene 43 años de edad, la socia  es conviviente; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia trabaja  administrando su panadería, la socia tiene una panadería y desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de levaduras y en la compra de otros insumos relacionados a la panadería, la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar levaduras y otros insumos para su panadería.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa" community bank. This bank is located in the Oropesa district, in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Holga. She is 43, lives with her partner, and has 2 children. She works in her own bakery; she wants this loan to invest in the purchase of yeast and other ingredients for baking. She is happy with this loan and promises to pay the quotas as established.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan to purchase yeast and other ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en: Donatille is 35 years old, married and has five children who range in age from four to 15 years old. Her husband is nurse, and they both work hard to meet their family's basic needs. Donatille owns a small store where she sells various products, but is hampered by a lack of capital. She finds this frustrating because she works very hard -- from 7 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. -- and is very skilled at what she does. She is applying for this loan to buy more products to sell, to attract more customers and to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nadiezda

texts.es: Nadiezda, de  25 años, esta  separada de su esposo, pero vive con sus  2 hijos, en la casa de sus padres.Ella tiene su puesto de comidas, en el ovalo de una avenida muy concurrida. Es ahí, donde prepara y vende la variedad de platos criollos que son  muy deliciosos. Todos los días, se trasporta muy temprano, durante una hora en bus hasta su puesto, y antes de llegar al negocio se asegura de realizar todas sus compras, de esta manera  en cuanto llega al puesto solo se ocupa  en preparar el menú del día (sopa ó entrada, segundos, postres y refrescos). Es por esta razón que sus clientes, los transportistas, están muy satisfechos por la buena atención que brinda.  Ya  lleva 6 años en este negocio, por lo que se siente contenta por la aceptación que tiene y lo rentable que es la venta de comidas, pues le ha permitido sacar a su familia adelante.  Tiene planeado  ampliar su negocio,  y también quiere instalar otro negocio de venta de prendas de vestir, pues desea salir adelante.Es el 11avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere defraudar a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes confiaron en ella para invitarle a conformar el grupo.Nadiezda tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  mercadería de alimentos  perecibles como sacos de arroz, bidones de aceite y un saco de azúcar, que necesita pues desea facilitar la preparación cotidiana de menús, y también quiere mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Nadiezda, age 25, is separated from her spouse, but lives with her two children in her parents' home. She has a food stall in the oval of a very busy street. There she prepares and sells a variety of traditional dishes which are very delicious. Every day, she gets up very early and takes the one-hour bus ride to her stall. Before arriving, she makes sure she has done all her shopping; this way, by the time she gets to her stall all she has to do is prepare the day's menu (soup or entre, second course, deserts and drinks). This is why her customers, who are transportation workers, are very satisfied with her good customer service. She has had this business for six years, and she is happy with the business' success and profitability. It has allowed her to get her family ahead. She plans to expand her business, and she also wants to open another business selling articles of clothing. She wants to succeed. This is her eleventh loan with MFP, and she promises to pay all of the quotas punctually, as she does not want to disappoint the members of her community bank, who trusted her enough to invite her into the group. Nadiezda plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of merchandise in perishable food items such as bags of rice,  barrels of oil and a bag of sugar, which she needs for making her daily menus. She also wants to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase perishable food items to continue with her business

loans.name: Señor De La Agonia-Taray Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor D. la Agonía” ya tiene 4 años D. funcionamiento y está conformado por mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días y la mayoría D. las socias viven en la comunidad D. Taray que está ubicada a 30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.   

Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. artesanía, venta y compra D. ganado, venta D. chicha, crianza D. cuyes, venta D. artículos D. ferretería,  venta D. verduras, y venta D. abarrotes. 

Fernanda, tiene 43 años y tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal D. Fernanda es la venta D. comida. Ya son varios años que abrió un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donD. sirve almuerzo. Utilizo sus ahorros para implementar el restaurante, donD. aproximadamente atienD. a más 20 D. clientes todos los días. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Fernanda que espera recibir D. S/. 1,500 nuevos soles. Por el momento, su restaurante esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas pero le gustaría emplear el dinero  D. este préstamo para comprar más gaseosas, arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más.   

La socia margarita no está en la fotografía por que tiene permiso D. la junta directiva del banco comunal y no esta presente en el desembolso.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Senor D. la Agonia" has already had 4 years together and it is maD. up of hard working, enterprising women who are on a constant lookout for opportunities to get ahead. And with daily effort they look to proviD. a better future for their kids. The community bank meetings take place every thirty days. The majority of the members live in the community of Taray, located about 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.

The business activities of some of the members are, for example: craft sales, buying and selling livestock, the sale of chicha drink, raising and selling guinea pigs, hardware store, produce sales, and general store. 

Fernanda is 43 years old and she has three children. Fernanda has a restaurant. It has been many years since she first opened the small restaurant from where she sells breakfasts. She used her own savings to set up the restaurant. She serves approximately 20 clients every day. 

Fernanda requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 nuevos soles. Her restaurant is only modestly equipped with only the most basic inventory and she would like to use the loan to purchase more soft drinks, rice, sugar, and various other types of inventory.

Margarita is a member who is not shown in the photograph and the community bank is in unanimous agreement to exempt her from participating in this loan.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, rice, sugar, and other inventory.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: La Sra. Dora, se dedica a la venta de papa por mayor y menor,  lleva  a vender su producto a la ciudad de Santa Cruz,   tiene  dos hijos quedo  viuda  muy joven y salió adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos, es una persona muy conocida en su zona, es padre y madre para sus hijos,  viaja cada fin de semana a entregar sus productos y los demás días vende en el mercado cerca a la zona donde ella vive, el préstamo invertirá para comprar cargas de papa por mayor y así poder incrementar su  capital de trabajo, es una persona  muy trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dora sells potatoes both wholesale and retail.  She takes her products to sell in the city of Santa Cruz.  Dora has two children.  She was left a widow at a very early age but got ahead for the well-being of her children.  She is a very well-known person in her area.  She is both mother and father to her children.  She travels every weekend to deliver her products and the rest of the week she sells her products in the market in a nearby area.

Dora will invest her loan in buying loads of potatoes wholesale and thereby increase her working capital.  She is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy loads of potatoes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VIRGEN ASUNTA  DE OROPEZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 50 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas.shampus,colonias,perfumes entre otros .la socia es consultora de bellesa de las siguientes marcas avon,esika,unique y dupre ,ella se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas productos para su negocio y así poder seguir adelante con lo que le gusta hacer y de esa manera saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the "VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPEZA" community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Gladys is 50 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products such as creams, shampoos, colognes, perfumes, etc.  She is a beauty consultant for the following brands: Avon, Esika, Unique and Dupre.  Gladys feels happy since, through her business, she gets her family ahead in life.

Gladys is requesting this loan to buy more products for her business so that she can continue to get herself and her family ahead in life doing what she enjoys doing.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business and thereby be able to get herself and her family ahead in life doing what she enjoys doing.

loans.name: Lucia Erlinda

texts.es: Lucia Erlinda tiene 54 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general desde hace más de 33 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta mucho de tener este medio de vida que con el pudo mantener a sus 4 hijos, les brindo lo necesario como alimento, vestimenta y estudios. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como ropa en general, calzado, cosmético entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Lucia Erlinda is 54 years old.  Her business activity is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 33 years.  She is a very enterprising woman and she enjoys this way of life which has enabled her to support her 4 children, providing them with what they need such as food, clothes and an education.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as general clothes, footwear, cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fente Allabo Group

texts.fr:
FENTE ALLABO est un groupe de l’association FOTEMOGOBAN de TENE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 9  enfants, elles mènent différentes activités : vente de diverses marchandises et jus de fruits. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TENE dans la préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
ASSA D., qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TENE, excelle dans la préparation et vente de jus de fruits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de bisap, 2 sacs de sucre, 50 kg de gingembre   et 5000FCFA pour les accessoires.  Elle s’approvisionne à SAN tous les Lundis  et vend son jus à TENE et dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires à travers des employées.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 32000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. Les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice de 30000FCFA par mois  somme qui leur permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The FENTE ALLABO group is part of TENE’s FOTEMOGOBAN association. It consists of four women who know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. On average, they are 48 years old, married, with at least nine children. They lead different activities, including the sale of various goods and fruit juices. They live in large traditional families in TENE, in the prefecture of SAN (region of Ségou, Republic of Mali).

They have been engaged in small business activities for several years and are in high demand. 
In order to meet their customers’ increasing needs, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution five years ago. They are currently on their ninth loan cycle.

ASSA D., president of the group and well known in TENE, excels in the preparation and sale of fruit juices. She intends to use her loan to buy three bags of bissap, two bags of sugar and 50 kg of ginger, and spend 5,000 FCFA on accessories. She gets her stocks in SAN every Monday, and sells her juices in TENE and at the various weekly fairs through employees.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 32,000 FCFA, which would allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business. The other group members are expecting a profit of 30,000 FCFA per month, which they will use to repay the loan and provide for their families.

loans.use: To buy smoked and fried fish

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 36 years old, married and has four children who range in age from four to 13 years old. For the last nine years, she has made a living selling clothes from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. daily. She has applied for this loan to buy more styles of clothing, such as shirts, and more attractive types of children's clothes. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can expand her business and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VIRGEN ASUNTA  DE OROPEZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia; ella tiene 56 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de plásticos en su casa ella vende platos, vasos, tazas, manteles por metro platos descartables, cubiertos descartables entre otros mas, a la vez la socia también vende útiles de escritorio como lapiceros, borradores, engrampadoras entre otros más, la socia es una persona muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia.



La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the "VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPEZA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Delia is 56 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling plastic products from a store which is located in her home.  She sells plates, cups, tablecloths by the meter, disposable plates, disposable cutlery, etc.  She also sells writing supplies such as pens, erasers, staplers, etc.  She is a very enthusiastic person who has a great wish to get her family ahead in life.

Delia is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business and thereby get her family ahead in life

loans.name: Crotilde

texts.en: Crotilde is 40 years old, married and has five children who range in age from four to 19 years old. She owns a small business selling various products such as juice, soap, cooking oil, bread and other items. She has been in this business for four years and is doing quite well. Her shop is open from 6.30 a.m. until 9 p.m. daily and she employs two people. She has applied for this loan from Kiva through the Vision Finance Company to expand her business.  Once her shop is enlarged, Crotilde hopes to earn enough money to provide a better life to her family.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 43 years old, married and has 12 children who range in age from five and 22 years old. Seven of his children are currently in school. For the last 25 years, Jean has made a living as a carpenter. His wife adds to the family's income by selling sorghum. Jean has applied for this loan to buy more lumber to use to make his goods. With the profits made possible by this loan, he plans to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy more lumber to use in his carpentry business.

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en: Zuwena is 21 years old, married and has one child. For the last three years, she has made a living selling spare parts for bicycles while her husband repairs them. She has applied for this loan to buy more spare parts to sell to her customers. With the new profits made possible by this loan, Zuwena plans to buy a plot of land and renovate a house for her family to live in. In the future, she would like to own and operate her own shop.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chris

texts.es: Chris, de 30 años, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de su pareja  y su hijo pequeño; cada día se esfuerzan juntos  para salir adelante.Desde muy joven esta emprendedora mujer, se dedica a la confección y elaboración de toda clase de bisutería (aretes, collares, rosarios y llaveros). Cuando tiene pedidos al por mayor, de los comerciantes del mercado que abastece, se trasnocha con su esposo Jhon; para cumplir con los pedidos; y de esta manera no le fallan a sus clientes. De esta forma trabaja hace  más de 11 años, y durante todo este tiempo han lidiado con la dura competencia, pero en la actualidad su trabajo le es muy rentable, es por ello su esposo vende en la puerta de las instituciones educativas y ella ofrece a sus amistades, así mismo comercializa  sus productos de belleza.  Lo que más le gusta de su labor; es que trata con mucha gente, y realiza sus labores en sus horas libres. Para mas adelante anhela ampliar su negocio y también desea comercializar prendas de vestir  casuales.Es el 11avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y reitera su compromiso de pagar puntualmente  sus cuotas, pues quiere continuar adelante.Chris tiene planeado invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de  alambres de alpaca y perlas, pues desea  continuar fabricando  todas las bisuterías y cumplir así con los pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Chris is 30 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her partner and her young child.  Every day they work hard together to get ahead in life.

Since she was very young, this enterprising woman has worked making all kinds of jewelry (earrings, necklaces, rosaries and keychains).  When she has wholesale orders to fill, from the salespeople in the market that she supplies, she works through the night with her husband Jhon to fill them so that she doesn't let down her customers.  She has been in this business for more than 11 years and during all that time she has battled with stiff competition.  However, her work is currently very profitable.  Her husband sells outside educational institutions and she offers her goods for sale to her friends.  She also sells beauty products.

What Chris most likes about her work is that she deals with a lot of people and she does her work in her spare time.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and she would also like to sell casual clothes.

This is Chris' 11th loan from MFP and she repeats her pledge to make her loan repayments on time as she would like to continue with further loans.  Chris is planning to invest her money in buying alpaca wire and pearls as she would like to continue making jewelry and fill her pending orders.

loans.use: To buy the materials she needs for her business

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie is a 52-year-old widow who has seven children. Three of her children are currently in school, and she makes a living selling local juice, rice, sugar, salt and cooking oil. She has been in this line of work for 29 years. Stephanie has applied for this loan to buy more products to sell to her customers. She will use the extra revenue made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. José  vive en la zona del Plan 3000 ya hace como 4 años, él se dedica al rubro de la carpintería, cuenta con su propio taller y dispone con maquinaria y obreros que trabajan para él,  actualmente realiza puertas y marcos tanto como para ventanas y puertas. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de edredones, sábanas y perfumes, para ayudar con los gastos de la casa y así poder pagar ella sus propias cuentas ya que ella trabaja con créditos en grupos, mientras que él esta con cuentas individuales. Ellos tienen una hija de unos 5 meses, son una pareja responsable que les gusta trabajar y compartir en familia. Actualmente como es fin de año es cuando más demanda tienen por este motivo solicito el crédito para la compra de madera por lo que necesitan incrementar su capital para poder abastecer a las personas a las que dejan las puertas y marcos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José has lived in Plan 3000 neighborhood for 4 years.  He is a carpenter and has his own workshop, machinery and employees who work for him.  He currently makes doors, window frames and door frames.  His wife sells comforters, sheets and perfumes to help with their household expenses and so that she can take care of her own accounts since she takes out group loans while José takes individual loans.

The couple have a 5 month-old daughter.  They are a responsible couple who like to work and share as a family.  As it is currently the end of the year, which is when he has most demand, José requested a loan to buy wood to increase his capital so that he can supply people with their doors and frames.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 53 years old, married and has two children who 10 and 14 years old. She makes a living selling livestock and also leads a loan group called Twisungane in the Kinyarwanda language, which means "Let Us Join Together."  The group members run different types of businesses but all of them are determined to expand their small companies and pay back this loan. 

Epiphanie has sold livestock for the last three years and is applying for this loan to buy more livestock to sell. She hopes to use the additional profits made possible by this loan to renovate her house and improve her family's life.

loans.use: To expand a group of small businesses.

loans.name: Agnatoallama Group

texts.fr:
Agnatoallama est un regroupe de 5 femmes  de l’association Fotemogoban de TENE, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 8 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités : restauration et  achat ventes de diverses marchandises. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TENE dans la préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe Agnatoallama à décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe. 
ALIMA D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs riz,  2 sacs de sel, 4 paquets de maggi et d’autres ingrédients pour la préparation des repas. Elle s’approvisionne à San et Koutiala et vend ses repas à TENE tous les jours.  
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel  de 28000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. Les autres membres compte sur un bénéfice de 26000FCFA par mois  somme qui leur permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Agnatoallama is a group of 5 women who are involved with the Fotemogoban de Tene organization. On average they are 43 years old and they have at least 8 children each. They carry out various business activities: restoration, and buying and selling of various types of merchandise. The live in large traditional families in Tene, in the San quarter (Region of Segou located in the Republic of Mali). 

With the goal of satisfying the growing demand of their clientele, the Agnatoallama group first came together to request a loan from Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) five years ago. They are on their group loan.

Alima D. will use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of salt, 4 boxes of bullion, and other ingredients needed for the preparation of food. They purchase their inventory in San and Koutiala and they sell the prepared foods in Tene every day. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 28000 FCFA. This income will permit her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business. The other members of the group expect to earn a 26000FCFA monthly. It will allow them to pay back the loan and to meet their family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the restaurant.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en: Cayetana belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru. She is 59 years old and married with two children. She wants the loan to invest in her bread-making business. The city of Oropesa, is famous for making bread. Cayetana will use the loan to buy flour, yeast, wood, and other ingredients to make her bread which she sells in the nearby city of Huancarane. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To Invest in her bakery

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 49 years old and married with four children between 8 and 25. She is well known in the business of selling different styles of clothes. This is her second successful year in this business, which she operates from 8 am until 8 pm every day.

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding to her inventory of men's and women's clothing.  With additional styles for sale, she hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to continue taking care of her family and keep reinvesting in her business and make better progress.

loans.use: To add a variety of styles such in men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est constitué de 6 femmes  toutes mariées, ayant en moyenne 43 ans, 6 enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TENE dans la préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali).Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage.
Elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente de poisson fumés et fris.  Et cela depuis plusieurs années  Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya  sont  très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin  de leur clientèle, le groupe Djiguiya à décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 4 ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe. 
MAMA K. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 gros cartons de poissons fumés et 9 paniers de poisson fris à SAN, tous les Lundis à SAN puisse que les femmes des pêcheurs viennent vendre en gros à la foire de SAN.  Elle revend à TENE et dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires. Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel  de 26000 FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group named Djiguiya is made up of 6 women members who are all married and averaging 43 years of age. They each have 6 children and they live in large traditional families in Tene, a quarter in the city of San (Region of Segou in the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through family and as neighbors. 

They each carry out different businesses, such as the sale of smoked and fried fish. For many years the businesses of these women have been well solicited. With the goal of meeting client demand, the Djiguiya group decided four years ago to come together and request a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their ninth group loan. 

Mama K. will use her loan to purchase 5 large cartons of smoked fish and 9 baskets of fried fish in San. Every Monday in San the wives of the fishermen come to sell the fish in wholesale at San. She resells the products in Tene and in various fairs held weekly. She expects to earn a monthly income of 26000 FCFA and it will allow her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase smoked and fried fish.

loans.name: Juana Nilda

texts.en: Juana Nilda belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru. She is 42 years old, a widow with two children. She buys and sells construction materials to municipalities and is requesting the loan to purchase more construction materials to sell.  She is also an elementary school teacher. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her construction materials business

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.en: Maximiliana belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru. She is 48 years old and single with one child. She is requesting the loan to invest in her bread-making business. The city of Oropesa is famous for making bread. Maximiliana is interested in using the loan to buy flour, yeast, wood, and other ingredients to make bread. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her bakery

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru. She is 39 years old and has a common law husband and four children. Lucila has a convenience store in Poro near Oropesa, Peru selling products such as flour, bread, rice, sugar, soft drinks, fruits, and shampoo etc. She is requesting the loan to purchase more products to sell in her convenience store. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her convenience store

loans.name: Los Amigos Responsables Group

texts.es:
Hace ocho meses se formó el grupo “Los Amigos Responsables”, unidos como lo dice su nombre por su sentido de responsabilidad ante los compromisos adoptados, está formado por 8 integrantes residentes de la zona de La Libertad ubicado en el distrito de Comas.
Claudia Mimí, fue elegida por sus compañeros como la Presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica hace tres años a la venta de comida, en un ambiente ubicado en su domicilio, inició este negocio por la propuesta de un grupo de amigos quienes conocían del buen gusto y la buena preparación de sus comidas.
Una de sus metas es poder participar de la Feria Gastronómica “Mixtura”, evento que se lleva a cabo una vez al año en Lima – Perú, en donde se reúnen los mejores chefs del país.
Con el préstamo solicitado invertirá en la compra de insumos y utensilios para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de potajes a sus clientes, aprovechando la mayor concurrencia que se verá por las celebraciones de fin de año.
En la fotografía podremos apreciar a los ocho integrantes del grupo acompañados de un amigo en común.
texts.en:
The group “Los Amigos Responsables” (The Responsible Friends) started 8 months ago. The members are united, as indicated by their group name, by a mutual feeling of responsibility to meet their loan commitments. The 8 members of this group live in La Libertad, a zone in Comas district.
 
Claudia Mimí was chosen by her group as their president. She has been selling food from her home for 3 years. She started the business at the suggestion of some of her friends, who knew how delicious her prepared food was. 

One of Claudia Mimí's goals is to be able to participate in the gastronomic festival "Mixtura", an event that takes place once a year in Lima, Perú and attracts the best chefs in the country.

With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients and utensils. She will be able to offer a better variety of stews to her customers and take advantage of the increase in business from the holidays.

In the photograph is pictured the 8 members and a friend of the group.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for selling prepared food.

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
KANOU est un groupe de l’association SINDJIYA de TENE qui regroupe 10 femmes  toutes mariées ayant en moyenne  41 ans, 7  enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles dans la préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali).
Elles  mènent différentes activités  telles la vente de beignet et de gâteau. Elles sont dans le créneau depuis plusieurs années. Les femmes du groupe sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle en nette croissance, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Il est  à son premier prêt de groupe. 
Oumou C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de farine, 2 bidons d’huile alimentaires de 20 litres chacun et les accessoires qui sont le sel la levure et le sucre.  Elle s’approvisionne à SAN  et vend à TENE au bord du goudron tous les jours de 07 h du matin à  22 h le soir. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. 
NB/  SOTHE D. est absente de la photo pour des raisons de maternité
texts.en:
Kanou is a group within the Sindjiya de Tene group and it is made up of 10 women members who are all married and have an average age of 41 years. They each have 7 children and they live in large traditional families in the city of San (Region of Segou in the Republic of Mali). 

They all have different businesses, including the sale of donuts and cakes. Their group has been together for many years. The women of the group have businesses that are highly solicited. They all know each other through family and as neighbors. With the goal of satisfying the demands of their growing clientele, they formed a group and approached Soro Yiriwaso for a loan. This is their first group loan. 

Oumou C. will use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of flour, two 20-litre tubs of cooking oil, and other ingredients such as salt, yeast, and sugar. She purchases her ingredients in San and she sells her products in Tene along the Goudron every day from 7 in the morning until 10 at night. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 15000 FCFA. With her income she will be able to repay her loan and to reinvest back into her business.

Note: Sothe D. is absent from this photo because she recently had a baby.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to bake cakes.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Marleni is 42 years old and married with three children. She belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Marleni is requesting the loan to invest in her bakery. The city of Oropesa is famous for bread making and Marleni will use her loan to buy firewood for her oven, which is very expensive this time of year. Marleni is very happy with her loan and is committed to making full and on-time payments.

loans.use: to buy firewood for bakery oven

loans.name: Benoite

texts.en:
Benoite is 48 years old and is married with 5 children aged between five and 26. Her husband is a driver, while Benoite owns a general store. She has been in this business for 10 years and her store is open daily from 6 in the morning until 9 at night.

Benoite has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via the Vision Finance Company to purchase more products for her shop. This loan will help her to increase profits and Benoite hopes to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
LAIDOU est un regroupement de 5 femmes qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 5  enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente d’arachide. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TENE dans la préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU  sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités et   se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe  a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts de groupe. 
BADJI M. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 tonnes d’arachide   dans les petits villages de TENE auprès des producteurs surtout en cette période de récolte aux prix abordables. Elle revend à TENE et dans beaucoup de foires environnantes en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée de consommateurs.  
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel  de 21000 FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Laidou is a group of 5 women members who are 38 years old on average. They are married and they have at least 5 children each. They carry out various business activities, such as the sale of peanuts. The live in large traditional families in Tene, in the quarter of San (Region of Segou, in the Republic of Mali). 

The business of the women of the Laidou group is highly solicited. They are known through family and as neighbors. 

With the goal of meeting the demands of their growing clientele, they came together 2 years ago as a group to request a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their third loan cycle as a group.

Badjui M. plans on investing her loan in the purchase of 3 tons of peanuts in the small villages in Tene from the producers, especially at this time when it is the harvest season and the prices are affordable.  She resells in Tene and in several country fairs, completing her sales in credit and cash. Her client base is the general consumer.

She expects to earn a monthly income of 21000 FCFA and it will allow her to repay the loan and to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase peanuts.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and married with three children. She is a member of the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Ana’s business is raising chickens, guinea pigs, and rabbits. She plans on investing her loan in the purchase of more animals and food. Ana is very happy with her loan and is committed to making full and on-time payments.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Sylvie is 30 years old and married with two children who are 4 and 7 years old. She also takes care of two relatives who are 11 and 14 years old.  Sylvie is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Those goods include water and juice. Her shop is open from 6am to 6pm every day and she has had this business for three years.

Sylvie has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her shop by purchasing a large quantity of water and juice.  With this large quantity, she will also start wholesaling. In doing so, she hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to renovate her house, continue to pay school fees for her two relatives and build a secure future for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase a large stock of water and juice

loans.name: Roger Ramiro

texts.es: El Sr Roger es transportista, se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo, junto a su esposa son dueños de casa,  recién acaban de terminar de cancelar con mucho esfuerzo el pago de su casita, tienen 2 hijos varones a los que  quieren mucho además son dueños de un camión tipo volvo con el cual trabaja de tipo alquiler transportando mercadería a las empresas de un departamento a otro, también  cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposa que trabaja de contadora. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo ya que esta yendo por primera vez fuera del país y le falta para sus costos y demás gastos que implica un viaje de esta naturaleza, Ya que el solo contaba con dinero para viajes cortos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Roger is a truck driver.  He has been in this business for a long time.  He and his wife own their own home.  With a lot of effort, they have just finished paying for their small house.  They have two sons who they love very much.

Roger and his wife own their own Volvo truck with which Roger works, transporting merchandise for companies from one department to another.  He also has the financial support of his wife who works as an accountant.

Roger is requesting this loan as working capital since he is, for the first time, making a trip out of the country and he needs money for the costs and other expenses that a trip of this nature involves.  Since he only had enough money for short journeys, he is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To cover the expenses of making a trip out of the country

loans.name: Kolaban  (Let's Be Decisive) Group

texts.fr:
Kolaban est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Dar Salam  de la ville de  Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le  bois de chauffe, les habillements,  les parures, les céréales et les produits cosmétiques. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent  a été bien remboursé. Korotoumou K. est un des membres du groupe Kolaban qui vend le bois de chauffe et des parures (colliers, boucle d’oreille, bracelets et autres).  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe auprès des producteurs. Elle se procure  du bois dans les différents coins de brousse Sirakele, Kle  et Karaba. Son stock de bois est important. Quant aux colliers, ils sont achetés au marché avec les grossistes.  Elle vend le bois en détail et au comptant à la maison à une clientèle composée exclusivement de femmes. Les parures sont vendues en détail à la maison et partout où elle passe. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Kolaban comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Korotoumou K.  compte réaliser 120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Kolaban is the name of a group of women who live in the quarter of Dar Salam, in the city of Koutiala. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. They are 37 years old on average, they are married, and they have at least 5 children each. 

This group of women is involved in the sale of various items, such as firewood, clothing, and jewelry, cereal grains, and cosmetics. 

In order to increase their business the members of the group came together last year to request a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan, following the successful repayment of their first loan.  

Korotoumou Keita is one of the members of the Kolaban group and she sells firewood and jewelry (necklaces, earrings, bracelets etc.) She plans on using her loan to purchase loads of firewood from local producers. She purchases firewood from the various brush locales in Sirakele, Kle, and Karaba. Her inventory of wood is important. She purchases her products in the market from the wholesalers. She sells firewood in cash and credit from her home, to a clientele exclusively made up of women. She sells her jewelry on credit from her home and wherever she goes. 

The members of the Kolaban group expect to make an average monthly income of 110 000 FCFA through the span of this loan cycle. Korotoumou Keita expects to earn 1200 000 FCFA. 

Aside from repayment of their loan, they will use a part of their income to meet their family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and jewelry.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Her name is Anabel and she is 33 years old.  Anabel has a common-law husband and three children.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her restaurant in Oropesa.  She is planning on purchasing more meat, rice, sugar, vegetables, and potatoes to create typical Peruvian dishes to sell in her restaurant.

She is very happy with the loan granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her restaurant

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Her name is Eufemia and she is 49 years old.  Eufemia is married and has two children. She is requesting the loan to invest in her bakery.  The city of Oropesa, Peru is famous for making bread and she is planning on using the loan to buy flour, yeast, wood, and other ingredients to make bread.

She is very happy with the loan granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her bakery

loans.name: Allahkanben Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association ALLAHKABEN du village de Kassene. Il regroupe 9 femmes  qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 5  enfants, elles mènent différentes activités : vente de diverses marchandises et condiments. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Kassene, dans la préfecture de TOMINIAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers depuis plusieurs années. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année.  Il est à son premier prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM SOLO T. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de petit mil, dans les villages environnants et effectue ses ventes au marché de TOMINIAN. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 19500FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group with an association with Allahkaben of the village of Kassene. The group is made up of 9 women members who are known through family and as neighbors. On average they are 48 years old. They are married and they each have at least 5 children. They carry out different business activities: sale of various merchandise and condiments. They live in large traditional families in Kassene, in the quarter of Tominian (Region of Segou in the Republic of Mali). 

They have been merchants of various articles for many years. With the hope of meeting the demands of their growing clientele they have come together as a group this year to request a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first loan together. 

Mariam Solo T. plans on investing her loan to purchase 1 ton of millet from the neighboring villages. She sells her products in the market in Tominian. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 19500 FCFA. It will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase millet.

loans.name: Joaquin Rodolfo

texts.es: El señor Joaquín se dedica a la fabricación y arreglo de  flotas ya hace bastante tiempo, vive en alquiler con su esposa y su hijo, trabaja con una empresa ya ocho años quienes le contratan  para soldar, armar el esqueleto de la flota ya que es muy conocido por los  sus clientes por el buen trabajo que realiza, el dueño de dicha empresa tiene mucha confianza en el porque hace muy buen trabajo. Don Joaquín  solicito el crédito para el incremento de la compra de una movilidad ya que vive en un lugar alejado de donde el trabaja y con la movilidad  le será mas fácil y cómodo llegar a su trabajo, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Joaquín works making and fixing vehicles.  He has been in this business for quite a long time.  He lives in a rental house with his wife and child and, for the past eight years, he has been working for a company who hire him to weld and assemble the chassis of the vehicles.  He is very well known by his customers for the good work that he does.  The owner of the company has a lot of faith in him because he does a very good job.

Joaquín requested this loan to help him buy a car since he lives a long way from where he works and, with a vehicle, it would be easier and more comfortable to drive to work.  Joaquín is a responsible and hard-working person.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered.

loans.use: To help buy a car

loans.name: Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Isidora de 42 años de edad, tiene un hijo menor de edad y dos ya adultos. Ella forma parte del grupo “Ampliación Villa el Polvorín”, integrado por 7 personas residentes de la zona de Ampliación ubicado en el distrito de Carbayllo. Sus compañeros la eligieron como Secretaria de la Junta Directiva del grupo.
Hace aproximadamente dos años se dedica a la confección y venta de polos para caballeros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de la Victoria, una de las zonas más comerciales de Lima. Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido adquirir sus máquinas de coser industriales.
Con sus ingresos puede cubrir los gastos diarios de alimentación, apoyar en los gastos de la casa como los servicios.
Su mayor sueño es ser una gran empresaria, y con mucho trabajo está segura de no estar muy lejos de serlo.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para confeccionar polos de verano para caballeros para tener un mayor stock para la temporada de calor que se nos avecina.
texts.en:
Isidora, 42, has one minor son and two adult children.  She is part of the “Ampliación Villa el Polvorín” group which has 7 members who all live in the Ampliación zone located in Carbayllo district.  Her fellow members elected her Secretary on the group’s Board of Directors.

For about the last two years she has been manufacturing and selling men’s polo shirts.  Her business is located in La Victoria district, one of Lima’s most commercial zones.  Thanks to her work she has managed to acquire industrial sewing machines.

She is able to cover daily food expenses and other household expenses, like utilities, with her income.

Her main dream is to become a great businesswoman and she is sure that through much work she’s not too far from becoming one.

She has asked for the loan to buy materials to make summer polo shirts for men in order to have increased stock available for the warm weather season that is approaching.

loans.use: To buy men's polo shirt making materials.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 51 años, vive en casa de su padre, al lado de  su pareja  y sus 2 hijos;  juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante.El trabajo de esta laboriosa mujer, es el tejido de tapetes a crochet y también se dedica al  bordado de polos y chompas, que los realiza en su casa luego de terminar con sus labores domésticas, y ya tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad que tanto le apasiona. Asimismo, vende productos de belleza desde hace unos años, y le va muy bien, ya que gracias a las campañas  y las ofertas por navidad  pudo capitalizar mejores ganancias, por lo que se siente muy satisfecha. Pero lo que más le gusta realizar, son sus tejidos y bordados, ya que no le resulta nada trabajoso, además lo realiza  en la comodidad de su casa. Para mas adelante, tiene el anhelo de instalar un bazar en un ambiente de su casa, de ese modo desea mostrar los tejidos y bordados que realiza.Es el  7mo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete una vez mas de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues  le han permitido crecer y captar mayores utilidades.Carmen tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  diversidad de hilos y una vitrina, en donde acomodara  todos sus trabajos, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Carmen, aged 51, lives in her father's house, along with her husband and her 2 children. Together they struggle daily to get ahead. The efforts of this hard-working woman involve embroidering tablecloths and crocheting, and she also embroiders polo shirts and sweaters in her home, after completing her domestic chores. For 20 years she has done this work which she passionately loves.

At the same time, for several years, Carmen has sold  beauty products and it's going very well. Thanks to the campaigns and offers of the Christmas season, she was able to capture better earnings for which she feels very content. But what she most likes to do is her sewing and embroidery which are not so labor-intensive and can be done at home.

In the future, Carmen hopes to install a store in her home, enabling her to display her creations and embroidery.

This is Carmen's 7th loan with MFP, and she promises once again to make her payments punctually, since past loans have permitted her business to grow and capture greater profits.  Carmen plans to invest the money in the purchase of diverse threads and a glass showcase that can hold all her work.  In this manner, she hopes to continue progressing.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS AND A DISPLAY CASE FOR HER EMBROIDERY BUSINESS

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO est un regroupement de 10 femmes de l’association BENKADI du village de KANSSENE dans la préfecture de TOMINIAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 53 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 11 enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités : vente d’oignons, de patate, de haricot et  de condiments. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser mieux leurs activités et satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe DJEKAFO a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année.  Elles sont à leur premier prêt. 
MAFINI  D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 12 sacs de haricot  dans les petits villages en l’ambulant. Elle revend au marché de TOMONIAN aux grossistes qui viennent pour la foire.  
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 21000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
DJEKAFO is a group of 10 women from the BENKADI association in the village of Kanssene, in the Tominian prefecture (in the Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They have an average age of 53, are all married and mothers to at least 11 children. They work in different businesses: selling onions, potatoes, beans and condiments. They live in large traditional families and know each other through family and neibourhood ties.
In order to make their businesses more profitable and to satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the DJEKAFO group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program this year. This is their first loan.
Mafini D. plans to use her loan to source 12 bags of beans from small villages. She resells to wholesalers at the market in Tominian who come for the fair.
She is hoping to make 21000 XOF in profits that will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of beans

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
DJIGUISEME  est un regroupement de 7 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 8 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités qui sont entre autres la vente de diverses marchandises et  des condiments alimentaires. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Kassene, dans la préfecture de TOMINIAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe  a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  cette année et  est à son premier prêt. 
NANA T. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 cartons de maggi 50kg d’oignons frais, 25kg de l’ail, 3 petits sacs de sel, 1carton de  concentrée de tomate. Elle   s’approvisionne à TOMINIAN et à SAN. Elle très connues à Kassene dans cette activité.  
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 17000 FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. Les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice de 15000  FCFA par mois  somme qui leurs permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
DJIGUISEME is a group of 7 women who know one another through parental and neighborhood ties.  They are, on average, 41 years old.  Married and the mothers of at least 8 children, they run various businesses which include the sale of different merchandise and condiments.  They live in large traditional families in Kassene, in the Tominian prefecture (region of Ségou, Republic of Mali).  In the interest of meeting the growing needs of their customer base, the group joined the Soro Yirwaso loan program this year and is on their first loan.  

Nana T. expects to use her loan to buy 2 cartons of broth cubes, 50 kg of fresh onions, 25 kg of garlic, 2 small bags of salt, and 1 can of tomato concentrate.  She stocks up in Tominian and in San.  She is very well-known in Kassene for her business.  She expects to make a profit of 17,000 FCFA, a sum which will allow her to repay the loan and to re-invest in her business.  The other members expect a profit of 15,000 FCFA per month which will allow them to repay the loan and to support their families' needs.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments.

loans.name: Lesbia Danubia

texts.es: Lesbia Danubia M. H. tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijos, reside en la Colonia Porvenir Norte  la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Lesbia tiene una venta de abarroteria que opera desde hace 4 años bajo el nombre de Pulperia Hernandez, iniciò su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo ya que èl tenia un dinero ahorrado y decidiò que era la mejor forma de invertirlo. Su esposo le ayuda a atender la pulperia mientras ella realiza los quehaceres del hogar, su horario de atencion es desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. Su mejor ventajas es que en toda la colonia su pulperia es la mas surtida y eso hace que la afluencia de clientes sea mucha. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para surtir de mas y variados productos de la canasta basica familiar. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podra mantener la misma afluencia de clientes que visitan su pulperia porque tendra lo que ellos necesitan comprar para su hogar. Su desafio es poder alcanzar una estabilidad economica que le permita ahorrar para asi poder comprar su vivienda, ya que por los momentos tiene que alquilar. Su sueño es poder convertirse en madre asi que adoptara a dos pequeños niños y seguir trabajando cada dia para poder sostenerlos y darles una buena condicion de vida. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por dos ciclos y ha demostrado ser puntual y responsable en la cancelacion de los prestamos obtenidos y espera seguirlo siendo.
texts.en:
Lesbia Danubia M. H., 43, is married and has no children. She lives in the Porvenir Norte neighborhood in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho.  Lesbia has had a grocery store for the last four years called “Pulpería Hernández.”  Her husband helped her start the business with some money he had saved up and he decided this was the best way to invest it.  Her husband helps her tend to the store while she takes care of household chores.  She is open for business from 6am until 9pm.  Her greatest advantage is that her grocery store is the best stocked in the entire neighborhood and this leads to her having a large customer base.

She needs the loan she requested to better stock the store with a larger variety of items that form a family’s basic grocery cart.  Support from the loan will make it possible for her to retain her customers that visit her store because she’ll have everything they need to buy for their homes.

Her challenge is reaching a point of economic stability that will permit her to start saving in order to buy a house because she is currently renting.  

Her dream is to become a mother so she plans to adopt two small children and continue to work every day to support them and give them good living conditions.

She has been a FEMA client for two cycles and has shown punctuality and responsibility in her repayments and expects to continue to do so.

loans.use: To buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
SABALY est un regroupement de 8 femmes au sein de l’association de DJIGUITOUGOU du quartier  HAMDALLAYE de SAN. Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités telles l’achat vente d’articles divers. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à SAN dans la préfecture de SAN  (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser mieux leurs activités et satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe SABALY a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année.  Elles sont à leur premier prêt. 
FATOUMATA S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter , 5 sacs de pomme de terre de 50kg chacun, 5 cartons de banane Plantain, 2 cartons de macaroni, un bidon d’huile alimentaire de 20 litres et d’autres petits ingrédients. Elle fait sa restauration au bord du goudron tous les soirs de 18h à 1h du matin.  
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 22000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. Les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice de 19000  FCFA par mois. 
Les femmes ambitionnent continuer le partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Sabaly is a group of 8 women within the Djiguitougou Association of the Hamdallaye neighborhood of San.  The women know one another through parental and neighborhood ties.  They are, on average, 29 years old.  Married and the mother of at least 5 children, they run different businesses, such as the buying and selling of various articles.  They live in large traditional families in San, in the San prefecture (region of  Ségou, Republic of Mali).  
In the interest of better profiting from their businesses and meeting the growing need of their customer base, the Sabaly group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program this year.  They are on their first loan.  Fatoumata S. expects to use her loan to buy 5 fifty kilogram bags of potatoes, 5 boxes of plantains, 2 boxes of macaroni, a 20 litre drum of cooking oil and other small ingredients.  She runs her restaurant business at the end of a tarmac each evening from 6 p.m. and 1 a.m.  She hopes to make a profit of 22,000 FCFA, a sum which will allow her to repay her loan and re-invest in her business.  The other members of the group expect a profit of 19,000 FCFA per month.  The women aspire to continue their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Purchase of restaurant ingredients

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un regroupement de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant  en  moyenne 39 ans, 7 enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANSSENE dans la préfecture de TOMINIAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali).Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles mènent différentes activités : vente de diverses marchandises et arachide. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année  et  sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
YARA C. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50 sacs d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne dans les différentes foires environnantes pour revendre à SAN en gros aux sœurs catholiques qui font la pâte d’arachide. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 14500FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en: Sabougnouma is a group of 6 women, all married, who are 39 years old on average, have 7 children and live in large traditional families in Kanssense in the prefecture of Tominian (region of Ségou, Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through parental and neighborhood ties.  They run different businesses, such as the sale of different merchandise and peanuts.  In the interest of meeting the growing need of their customer base, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their first group loan.  Yara Cissa expects to use her loan to buy 50 bags of peanuts.  She stocks up in different fairs in the surrounding areas to re-sell wholesale in San to the Catholic sisters who make peanut butter.  She hopes to make a profit of 14,500 FCFA, a sum which will allow her to repay the loan and to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela, de  44 años, vive en su casa que es propia junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, de los que solo se hace cargo de  los tres menores que aún estudian.Desde hace 3 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir  casuales. Ofrece su ropa  de casa en casa, tocando todas las puertas de sus vecinos y de otros barrios, y a diario tiene  que lidiar con el arenal de la zona. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que conoce a mucha gente, con quienes tiene una linda amistad.  A sus clientes antiguos  no duda en  ofrecerles las nuevas compras, que realiza a diario, sobre todo de las nuevas tendencias de la moda, es por ello que su negocio, le ha resultado muy rentable, y además le es de gran entretenimiento. Lo que no le gusta y se siente algo fastidiada es cuando algunos de sus clientes se demoran en pagar,  y ese dinero le hace falta para renovar el capital para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería.  En el futuro tiene planeado instalar una  bodega y empezar con la venta de golosinas; pues éstas no requieren de mayor inversión.Es el  sétimo  préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que este dinero le será de  mucha utilidad para el desarrollo de su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas sin ningún retraso.Estela tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de prendas de vestir casuales, para la temporada de verano, y de ese modo espera continuar con el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Estela, 44, lives in her own house with her husband and four children; only the youngest three, who are still in school, are still her responsibility.  For the last three years this enterprising woman has been selling casual clothing door to door.  She knocks on all her neighbors’ doors and also on doors in other neighborhoods.  Every day she has to put up with the sandy dust in the area.

What she enjoys the most about her business is getting to know a lot of people with whom she has established nice friendships.  She doesn’t hesitate to offer her latest purchases, which she makes daily, to her longstanding customers, especially the latest fashions.  This is why her business has been so profitable; besides, it keeps her entertained.  What she doesn’t like so much and annoys her is when some customers delay their payments and she then needs that money to renew her capital to buy larger amounts of merchandise.  In the future she plans to set up a store and start off selling snacks because these don’t require a very large investment.

This is her 7th loan with MFP and she knows that the money will be very useful for the development of her business so she commits to repay without delay.

Estela plans to use the requested funds to buy casual clothes for the summer season thus expecting continued progress in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing items to stock her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 36 años, es madre soltera y tiene un joven hijo con el que vive  en la casa de su hermana.Desde hace un año esta laboriosa mujer se ha integrado al exitoso negocio de bisutería que tiene su hermana. Se dedica a la fabricación y elaboración de collares, cadenas, aretes y otros adornos de la casa,  y le va muy bien;  ya que su hermana Honorata tiene muchos años de experiencia en el negocio. Es por esta razón que para  Ana no  ha resultado ser nada complicado y le agrada mucho tejer y armar las cadenas, ya que cuando produce en mayor cantidad abastece a más tiendas, y de acuerdo a ello también aumenta sus utilidades. Sin embargo, esta pensando para el futuro  independizarse en este negocio, y de ese modo espera captar mayores utilidades para brindarle educación superior a su hijo.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que este dinero le será de mucha utilidad. En su grupo comunal, es nueva ya que ingreso por recomendación de su hermana, y no  piensa defraudarlos, pues le han brindado su confianza.Ana tiene planeado invertir  el crédito en la compra de materiales como alambres de alpaca, perlas entre otros dijes, y de ese modo espera  trabajar con su capital de a pocos.
texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old.  She is a single mother and has a young son with whom she lives in her sister's house.  For one year, this hard-working woman has been working in her sister's successful jewelry business.  She makes necklaces, chains, earrings and other decorative items and business is going very well since her sister Honorata has many years of experience.  For this reason, it hasn't been at all complicated for Ana and she very much enjoys weaving and putting together the chains since the more she produces, the more stores she supplies and the more she increases her profits.  In the future she is thinking of working in this business independently.  In this way, she hopes to make more profits so that she can fund her son's higher education.

This is Ana's first loan with MFP and she knows that the money will be very useful to her.  She is a new member of her community bank.  She joined on her sister's recommendation and she does not want to let down the other members as they have placed their trust in her.  Ana plans to invest her loan money in buying materials such as alpaca wire and pearls amongst others.  In this way she hopes to work gradually with her capital.

loans.use: To buy materials to stock her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, D. 34 años, vive en su casa que es  propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos,  cada día se esfuerza por salir adelante para mejorar su condición D. vida.DesD. hace 3 años, esta emprendedora madre D. familia se dedica a la venta D. diversas comidas en un paradero D. su zona. Cada día después D. cocinar en su casa envuelve sus ollas y la saca en su carreta, D. esta manera empieza con la venta D. sus platillos (chanfainita, tallarines rojos y demás guisos D. pollo). El tiempo le ha permitido captar muchos clientes que gustan D. su sazón, sobre todo los chóferes D. los paraderos D. los motocarros. Lo que mas le gusta D. su trabajo, es que le es muy rentable y por ello ha contratado  a una señorita quien le ayuda en la atención, pero también le preocupa el incremento D. mayor cantidad D.  vendedores ambulantes D. comida que se instalan aledaños a su negocio. Por ello para más adelante piensa alquilar un local y apostar por un restaurante, para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.Es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser responsable en el pago D. sus cuotas, ya que los créditos anteriores le han sido D. mucha utilidad en el progreso D. su negocio.Maribel planea invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra D. sillas y  mesas, asimismo piensa mandar realizar almanaques a pedido D. sus clientes, D. esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Maribel is 34 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and their three children.

Every day Maribel works hard to get ahead and improve her living conditions.  For three years, this enterprising mother has been selling a variety of meals in her area.  Every day, after cooking in her home, she wraps up her pots, takes them out on her cart and starts selling her meals: 'chanfainita' (a traditional Peruvian dish), 'tallarines rojos' (another traditional Peruvian dish - literally 'red noodles'), and chicken stews.  Over time, she has been able to attract a lot of customers who enjoy her delicious meals, above all the drivers at the 'mototaxi' (auto rickshaw) stands.

What Maribel most likes about her work is that it is very profitable and, for that reason, she has been able to hire a young lady to help her.  However, she is also worried about the increase in the number of itinerant street vendors who also sell meals and who have set up near her business.  For this reason, in the future she is thinking of renting premises and setting up a restaurant so that she can proviD. her customers with a better service.

This is Maribel's 13th loan with MFP and she has pledged, once again, to be responsible in making her loan repayments.  Her previous loans have been very helpful to her in making progress in her business.  Maribel plans to invest her loan money in buying tables and chairs.  She is also thinking of making calendars to order.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

loans.use: To buy furniture to improve her business

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis Fernando C. N., Tiene 24 años, vive cin su hermano mayor el empeso a trabajar de cobrador en el negocio de su hermano, y asi fue como el conocio a sus clientes, e inicio su propio negocio hace 3 años llamandolo comercial Fernanda, empeso vendiendo, licuadoras,sabanas,ponchos,cortinas, toda clase de mercaderiapequeña con el tiempo el a podido vender productos mas grandes como ventiladores,refris,ropero,entre otros esto solo le vende por pedidos el prestamo que solicita es para comprar productos de usos domesticos y asi seguir surtiendo su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias,su sueño es poder contratar a personas que le ayuden a vender en su comercial ya que el vende por las mañanas y por las tardes cobra. el esta muy contento porque Dios le a ayudado y con la ayuda que Fape le pueda dar con el credito pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando C. N. is 24 years old.  He lives with his older brother.  Through work as a collector in his brother's business he was able to establish his own clientele and start his business, three years ago, called "Comercial Fernanda."  Initially, Luis focused on selling blenders, sheets, ponchos, curtains and all kinds of small merchandise.  Over time, he has been able to offer larger products such as fans, refrigerators, and wardrobes, among other goods, which he orders only upon customer request.  

Luis is requesting a loan to purchase domestic-use products in order to continue supplying his business with products and obtain greater earnings.  He hopes to be able to hire people to work in his store since he sells in the mornings and collects accounts in the afternoons. 

Luis feels very happy and blessed by God and that with the help of the loan through FAPE he will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase domestic-use products

loans.name: Arcangel Misael Group

texts.es:
