El grupo “Arcángel Misael” se ubica en la localidad de Santiago Jamiltepec Oaxaca, a 40 minutos aproximadamente de Pinotepa nacional, se le dio este nombre primero porque los integrantes del grupo creen en la existencia de los Ángeles, y en especial ellos dicen que su ángel protector del grupo es el arcángel Misael, el nombre del líder del grupo es Manuel O. Hernández, un señor de poco mas de 65 años, el punto de reunión del grupo esta ubicado a unos pasos del conocido lugar llamado el pozo de de san jacinto, este es un lugar publico donde la gente acude a lavar ropa y es de uso para toda la población de Jamiltepec. Esta agrupación esta conformada por 11 personas, quienes son originarios y vecinos de esta localidad, todos ellos e conocen entre si y comparten las mismas tradiciones y costumbres, algunos son indígenas y otros no, pero eso no es motivo por el cual no puedan estar unidos.
En esta narración hablaremos de la señora María A. O., de 28 años de edad, ella es artesana de toda la vida, nos comenta que la elaboración de huipiles lo practica desde hace mas de 10 años, cuando su cuñada la enseño a elaborar tan bonitas prendas antes de fallecer, ella nos cometa que es la mejor herencia que pudo haber recibido, ya que por medio de esta actividad puede obtener recursos para apoyar a sus dos pequeños hijos que son, Flor de 12 años y Jesús de 11 años de edad, ellos están estudiando actualmente, flor cursa la educación secundaria y Jesús el sexto año de la primaria, el esposo de María es campesino de nombre Javier quien tiene 43 años de edad. 
El bordado de huipiles es una actividad muy conocida y practicada  en la región de la costa chica de Oaxaca principalmente donde existen poblaciones de indígenas mixtecos, las prendas como los huipiles, las naguas, los telares, y otros han distinguido siempre a las comunidades de indígenas, cada región tiene sus propias características y colores apropiados en estas prendas, ya que cada una de ellas representa el grupo, la clase y la distinción del pueblo de la persona quien porta esta preciada vestimenta, María  elabora bordados y acabados de huipiles, hilados a mano, para esto se utilizan materiales propios de la región, que se distinguen desde su origen hasta el detallado de las prendas.
El motivo por el cual María solicito un crédito fue para la compra de materiales que utiliza en la elaboración y bordados de huipiles, ella con este dinero pudo comprar listones en colores amarillo, azul rey, rojo, naranja y café, estos listones en diferentes presentaciones y tamaños, también compro hilo de algodón para bordado, hilo de seda, madeja de algodón para bordar en diferentes colores, telar de cintura hilado a mano, telar teñido con caracol púrpura, aro para bordar y algunas agujas.  
Lo que le gusta a María es la combinación de colores, es por eso que ella disfruta la creación de sus trabajos, al principio dice que cuando vivía su cuñada ella era que le combinaba los colores, pero  después ella tuvo que hacerlo, nos comparte que en algunas ocasiones no le pagan lo justo por su trabajo, pero eso no la desanima, ella le echa mas ganas y sigue adelante, para elaborar un huipil María se tarda aproximadamente una semana dedicándole todo un día completo. Su oficio le ha permitido a poyar a su esposo con el gasto escolar de sus hijos, ha podido darle continuidad a su actividad y no le ha faltado lo necesario para seguir trabajando.
Ser artesana no es cosa fácil primero porque tienen que entender que es lo que hacen, de donde viene, y que simboliza para la persona quien esta creando este arte.
María desea mejorar su calidad de vida y  la de sus hijos, no pretende ganar mucho dinero solamente lo necesario para llevar una vida digna y perdurable, ella quisiera que estas prendas no se pierdan nunca y prevalezcan durante todo el tiempo, sin perder su significado y sin sufrir modificación alguna.
La esperanza de María es ver a sus hijos crecer en un ambiento propio de si mismos, sin carencias ni limitaciones, ella desea ver a sus niños terminar bien una preparación escolar, para que el día de mañana ellos puedan aspirar a algo mejor de lo que ella y su esposo no tuvieron, ya que el ser campesino es como estar destinado a vivir en la pobreza y en la carencia de una vida cómoda, ella quiere que sus ventas no decaigan, que su producción crezca y que su hija aprenda también este oficio como una herramienta mas de supervivencia.
 A nombre de sus compañeros y compañeras que integran este grupo María le da las gracias a los que hacen posible este apoyo humano, de no ser por los que participan en esta labor los que están en la misma situación de María no tendrían respaldo alguno, a todo este gran equipo ella les manda un abrazo y no hay mejor agradecimiento que una sonrisa de parte de ella.
“Arcángel Misael”. Esta integrado por un numero de personas, responsables y trabajadoras de gran compromiso con cada uno de sus integrantes. A continuación aquí se dan los nombres de las personas que integran al grupo así como su actividad personal.

María A. O.. – Elaboración y venta de artesanías
Ceycie Azucena V. C..- Venta de gelatinas
María Florali O. Hernández.- Venta de Ropa
Felipa Pérez Jiménez.- Cocina Económica
Manuel O. Peláez.- Venta de Ropa
Manuel Adolfo O. L..- Venta de comida económica
Antonio M. García.- Venta de Ropa
Magaly M. O..- Venta de comida económica
Celia Rufina Vásquez M..- Venta de comida económica
Beatriz V. T..- Elaboración y venta de artesanías
Tayde Marizol García S..- Elaboración y venta de artesanías
texts.en:
The “Arcángel Misael” (Archangel Misael) group is located in Santiago Jamiltepec, Oaxaca, about 40 minutes from “Pinotepa Nacional.”  They named the group this way because its members believe in the existence of archangels and they say that the Archangel Misael is their protector.  65 year old, Manuel O. Hernández is the group’s leader and their meeting place is only a few steps from the place known as the Well of San Jacinto.  This is a public place, available for the entire population of Jamiltepec, where the people gather to wash clothes.  This group is made up of 11 people, originally from this area.  They are all neighbors and all know one another and share the same traditions and customs.  Some are aboriginal and others not, but that is not a reason for them not to be united. 

Here we will talk about 28 year old María A. O..  She’s been an artist her entire life and tells us that she’s been making “huipiles” (Mayan style dresses) for more than 10 years.  Her mother in law taught her to make these beautiful clothing items, before she passed away, and [María] believes that this was the greatest inheritance that she could have received, because it allows her to generate the income she needs to support her two young children; 12 year old Flor and 11 year old Jesús.  Both are in school.  Flor is in junior high school and Jesús is in sixth grade.  Her husband, 43 year old Javier, is a field worker. 

Huipil embroidering is well known and practiced in the La Costa Chica region of Oaxaca, particularly in areas inhabited by aboriginal people.  Clothing items such as huipiles, naguas, telares, and other types of traditional clothing, have always distinguished the aboriginal communities from one another, and each region has its own style and colors of clothing, representative of each group.  María embroiders and finishes huipiles by hand, using materials from the region that distinguish the details in the clothing.

María requested this loan to buy supplies that she uses for making and embroidering huipiles, such as yellow, royal blue, red, orange, and brown ribbons of different types and size.  She also bought different types of cotton and silk thread in different colors, handmade belts, purple dyed fabric, crochet hoops and some needles.

María likes to combine colors.  This is why she enjoys her work.  When her mother in law was living, she used to combine colors for her, but then [María] had to learn to do it herself.  She tells us that there are times when she is not paid fairly for her labor, but that does not discourage her.  She puts forth more effort and forges ahead.  It takes her about a week, working all day, every day, to make each huipil.  Her craft allows her to help her husband pay for their children’s schooling and she has not been short of what she needs to continue her work.  This is not an easy task because one must understand where they come from, where they live, and what the craft means to its artist.

María wants to improve her children’s quality of life.  She does not pretend to make much money; just enough to afford a dignified and lasting life.  She hopes that these clothing styles are never lost and that they continue without modifications. 

María’s hopes are to see her children grow up in their own environment, without limits or cares.  She also wants to see them get a good education so that they can aspire for something better than what she and her husband had, because being a field hand destines one to live a life of poverty with a desire for a comfortable life.  She wants her sales not to decrease and to increase her production.  She also wants her daughter to learn this art as a tool for greater achievement.

María is thankful, and in the name of her fellow members, appreciates those whom make this human support possible.  If it was not for those who participate in this effort, those who are in the same situation as María would have no one to lean on.  She sends a hug to the whole team and there is no better way to say thank you than a smile from her.

“Arcángel Misael” is made up of a number of responsable, hard working people with great dedication to their fellow members.  Following are the names of the members and their activities.

María A. O.. – Craft creation and sales
Ceycie Azucena V. C.. – Gelatin sales
María Florali O. Hernández. – Clothing sales
Felipa Pérez Jiménez. – Food sales
Manuel O. Peláez. – Clothing sales
Manuel Adolfo O. L.. – Food sales
Antonio M. García. – Clothing sales
Magaly M. O.. – Food sales
Celia Rufina Vásquez M.. – Food sales
Beatriz V. T.. – Craft creation and sales
Tayde Marizol García S.. – Craft creation and sales

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Fidela Belgica

texts.es:
Fidela de 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora que ha trabajado desde que la abandono su esposo con sus dos hijos. Decidió vender confites  para poder solventar los gastos de la casa pero al pasar del tiempo tuvo una buena acogida por eso que comenzó a vender víveres.

Viviendo en una zona periurbana ha trabajado en una pequeña tienda que ella ha puesto en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad trabaja en su pequeña tienda desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm. Una de las complicaciones que tiene con el negocio es la época de lluvia y esto hace que se les dificulte a sus clientes comprar la mercadería que ella vende. Vende arroz, azúcar, enlatados, bebidas en su pequeña tienda. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sacos de arroz, bebidas, enlatados para su tienda. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos se desempeñen profesionalmente y poder incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Fidela is 59 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has workedever since her husband abandoned her and their two children.  She decided to sell confectionery in order to cover her household expenses but over time her business became popular and so she started selling food products.

Fidela lives in a peri-urban area.  She works in a small store that she set up in the front part of her home.  She currently works in her small store from 6.00am to 9.00pm.  One of the problems that she has with her business is that it is the rainy season which makes it difficult for her customers to come and buy the merchandise that she sells.  Fidela sells rice, sugar, canned goods and drinks in her small store.  She would like to use her loan to buy sacks of rice, drinks and canned goods for her store.  In the future, she would like her children to become professionals and to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es: Marta Julia M.: es Soltera Tiene 57 años 4 hijos todos mayores de edad,su negocio lo inicio hace 38 años vendiendo dulces y chicles, en la puerta de su casa asi vendio un tiempo despues con el tiempo empeso a vender frutas, refacciones, en le mismo lugar despues puso su tienda la cual yamo tienda Tita, en ella vende productos comestibles,como arroz,frijol,entre otros en sus tiempos libres lo ocupa confeccionando prendas ya que la han catalogado como una de las mejores confeccionistas en el area donde vive, el prestamo que ella solicita es para compra de productos comestibles,su sueño es que su hija se gradue de la Univercidad y en un futuro invertir en productos para libreria.
texts.en:
Marta Julia M. is single.  She is 57 years old and has four grown-up children.  She started her business 38 years ago, selling candy and gum from the door of her home.  This is how she made her sales for some time.

Over time, Marta started to sell fruit and snacks.  She later set up a store in her home which she called "Tienda Tita".  There she sells food products such as rice, beans, etc.  In her spare time she makes clothes as she is rated as one of the best dressmakers in her area.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy food products.  Her dream is for her daughter to graduate from university and, in the future, to invest in products for a bookstore.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Alborada Group

texts.es: ESTA FOTO FUE TOMADA EN EL NEGOCIO DE LA SEÑORA  NARCIZA G. A. UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO ALBORADA QUE ESTÁ UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MÉXICO.  ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS DE MAIZ QUE INICIÓ DESDE HACE 12 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAIZ Y GAS. SUS CLIENTES OPINAN  QUE LAS TORTILLAS DE DOÑA NARCIZA SON LAS MEJORES DEL PUEBLO YA QUE SIEMPRE ESTAN CALIENTITAS Y ADEMÁS DE QUE LAS REALIZA CON MUCHA HIGIENE. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE MUY CONTENTA  Y AGRADECIDA. DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS LOGREN TERMINAR SUS ESTUDIOS. TIENE 40 AÑOS, ESTUDIÓ SÓLO PRIMARIA, ES CASADA Y TIENE EN TOTAL 3 HIJOS: 2 VARONES Y 1 MUJER. QUIERE ESTE CREDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACIÓN DE TORTILLAS. TAMBIEN ESPERA QUE CON EL PRESTAMO PUEDA MEJORAR SU LOCAL DONDE SE ENCUENTRA SU NEGOCIO. EL GRUPO ESTÁ CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Narciza G.A.'s business.  Narciza is a member of the 'Alborada' group that is located in the State of Puebla, Mexico.

Narciza's business is selling corn tortillas.  She started the business 12 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn and gas.  Her customers are of the opinion that Narciza's tortillas are the best in town since they are always nice and warm and she pays a lot of attention to hygiene.

As she requests this loan, Narciza feels very happy and grateful.  She would like her children to finish their studies.  Narciza herself only studied at elementary school level.  She is 40 years old, married, and has three children: two boys and one girl.  She would like this loan to buy supplies for making tortillas.  She also hopes to use this loan to improve her business premises.  This group has 9 members.

loans.use: To buy corn and gas

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes G., es soltera tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 asisten a la escuela  en nivel primario y 2 al Instituto a nivel Secundario, tiene  un negocio de venta de productos comestibles llamada TIENDA CLARITA la cual inicio hace 3 años cuando perdió su vivienda debido a un huracán que le afecto mucho, sus hijos le ayudan a vender cuando ella realiza la elaboración de productos de belleza  y limpieza  para el hogar, ella recibió clases para la elaboración de los mismos y ha empezado a venderlos dos veces por semana y tiene que salir a lugares lejanos a su casa, ella le da gracias a Dios por que su negocio cada dia crece mas y es por ello que ella solicita a FAPE y Kiva le puedan apoyar con un crédito para comprar productos comestibles y asi seguir trabajando en sus negocios, el sueño mas grande de G. es que sus hijos sean unas personas de bien.
texts.en:
Mercedes G. is single and has 4 children.  Two of her children are in elementary school and two are in high school.

G. has a business selling food products which is called "Tienda Clarita".  She set up her store 3 years ago when she lost her home in a hurricane which affected her greatly.

G.'s children help her to serve in the store when she is busy making beauty products and household cleaning products.  She received classes on making these products and has started selling them twice a week.  To do this she needs to travel to places which are far from her home.

G. thanks God that her business grows every day and and, for this reason, she is asking FAPE and Kiva to support her with a loan so that she can buy food products and thereby continue working in her businesses.  Her biggest dream is for her children to become good people.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Las Coapeñitas Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio D. L. señora Claudia N.M. L. cual es tesorera del grupo “Las Coapeñitas” que está ubicado en PuebL., Mexico. En L. foto se ve parte D. L. antojitos mexicanos que venD., lleva 10 años con su negocio, sus clientes dicen comprar antojitos con L. Sra. Claudia porque están hechas con materia prima natural y además D. que siempre está dispuesta a complacerL. con lo que quieren comer. ElL. tiene 40 años sólo estudio L. primaria, pero eso no le impidio salir adelante, es madre D. 2 niños; una mujer y un varon, con el crédito piensa seguir invirtiendo es su negocio e incrementar sus clientes, además D. que pretenD. comenzar a vender comida corrida como son las sopas y L. guisados, con ello pretenD. darle una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos y apoyarL. en sus estudios para que terminen una carrera y tengan una mejor oportunidad en L. vida.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Claudia N. M.'s business.  Claudia is the treasurer of the "Las Coapeñitas" community bank which is located in PuebL., Mexico.  In the photo you can see some of the 'antojitos' (Mexican snacks) that she sells.  She has been in her business for 10 years and her customers say that they buy their snacks from Claudia because they are maD. with natural ingredients and she is always ready to please them with whatever they would like to eat.

Claudia is 40 years old and studied at elementary school level.  However, this didn't stop her getting ahead.  She has two children: one girl and one boy.  She plans to use her loan to continue investing in her business and increasing her customers.  She also plans to start selling fast food such as soups and stews.  In this way, she plans to proviD. her children with a better quality of life and support them in their studies so that they finish university and have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making her snacks

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria Concepcion G. tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, y junto a su familia reside en el barrio La Soledad en la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Desde hace 10 años Maria se dedica a la elaboracion de tortillas de maiz de forma artesanal, ella comenzò a hacerlo porque su esposo quedò sin trabajo y solamente èl aportaba dinero para el hogar, asi que se vieron en una dificil situacion economica. Maria pensò en muchas formas de como ayudarlo pero finalmente recordò que su abuela le habia enseñado hacer tortillas de maiz, y asi fue como ella instalò al frente de su casa una venta de tortillas que atiende desde las 6:00 am hasta las 12:00 del mediodia. Maria solicita el prestamo para comprar varios sacos de maseca y un tanque de gas domestico. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra seguir teniendo una entrada de dinero que le permitira ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar. Gracias a Dios Maria por los momentos no atraviesa dificultades ni problemas. Su meta es tener una tortilleria industrial y contar con varios empleados para asi seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con puntualidad el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion G. is 34 years old, married and has two children.  She lives with her family in La Soledad neighborhood, in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho.

For the past ten years, Maria has been making corn tortillas by hand.  She started in this business because her husband lost his job.  He had been the only one who supported their household so they found themselves in a difficult financial situation.  Maria thought of many ways in which to help but she finally remembered that her grandmother had taught her how to make corn tortillas and so set up a tortilla stand outside the front of home and she serves there from 6.00am to 12.00pm.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy several sacks of Maseca corn flour and a canister of gas.  The support of this loan will enable her to continue making money which will allow her to help her husband to support their household.  Thanks to God, Maria currently has no difficulties of problems.  Her goal is to own an industrial tortilla bakery with several employees so that she can continue supporting her children in their studies.  This is her first loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to be punctual in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy Maseca corn flour and a canister of gas

loans.name: Georgina Antonila

texts.en:
Georgina Antonila is 60 years old and married. She has children but they have moved out already. She lives in Primavera de Duran (the urban perimeter was originally irregular with various hills, creeks, and lakes that are still there even though they appear as the remains of an ecology in dissolution). Georgina Antonila has a business selling office supplies (paper, notebooks, binders, etc.). Thanks to her loans from D-MIRO she was able to start and build this business.

She buys the notebooks for $.90 each and sells them for $1.25. The binders she buys for $.60 and sells for $.90. There is some competition in the area, but she is able to maintain her clients. With this $1,000 loan, she plans to buy a showcase and more merchandise. Her goal for the future is to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy a showcase and merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.en:
Rosa Marlene is a 50-year-old entrepreneur. She lives in Playas Canton, one of the tourist destinations of Ecuador, which is known for its large variety of seafood. Her children are grown and moved out already but they help her with her expenses.

Rosa Marlene started selling clothes and make-up 20 years ago. Many years later she started selling sausage stew at her house. Little by little she built her businesses, and now she sells the sausage stew during the weekends at her own restaurant and continues selling clothes and make-up. During the week her clients come to her house to buy the products, and sometimes she goes out and visits clients as well.

She does not face any difficulties in her business at the moment, although she is dealing with some health problems lately. With her $1,000 loan she plans to buy more clothes and make-up to sell. In the future she hopes to improve her business by increasing her sales. She also hopes to improve her restaurant and expand her house.

loans.use: To buy clothes and make-up to sell.

loans.name: Josias

texts.es: Josias, de 72 años,  esta separado de su  esposa hace 10 años y vive en su casa que es propia en el distrito de Quimbiri junto a su joven hijo Josias.Desde hace 20 años, se dedica al alquiler de cuartos que brinda en su vivienda y tiene varios inquilinos y esta muy satisfecho pues obtiene regulares ganancias de sus rentas. Gracias a su esfuerzo construyó su casa de tres  pisos en su distrito, donde ofrece veinte cuartos, que constantemente alquila y cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo. Le gusta administrar su vivienda y que sus usuarios se sientan cómodos, es por esta razón que constantemente las refacciona y los fines de semana no son de su agrado porque los ocupantes de los distintos cuartos organizan reuniones  y  la mayor parte de la noche pasa desvelado. Para el futuro tiene muchos planes de salir adelante y espera emprender nuevos negocios.Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete seguir trabajando con el mismo compromiso y aportar sus cuotas  puntualmente, ya que para él es muy importante contar con los  créditos posteriores, para lograr el progreso.Josias tiene planeado invertir los  1,000 soles en refraccionar la fachada de su vivienda y de esta manera espera  brindar una buena hospitalidad a sus usuarios.
texts.en:
Josias is 72 years old.  He separated from his wife 10 years ago and lives in his own home in Quimbiri district with his young son Josias.  For 20 years, Josias has been renting out rooms in his home.  He has several tenants and is very satisfied since he earns regular profits from his rentals.

Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to build a three-storey building in his district where he offers twenty rooms which are constantly rented out.  He has the support of his son.  Josias likes running his building and for his tenants to feel comfortable.  For this reason, he is constantly refurbishing his rooms.  He does not, however, enjoy weekends because the occupants of his rooms organize meetings and he spends most of the night awake.  He has many plans for the future and he hopes to start new businesses.

This is Josias' ninth loan with MFP and he pledges to continue working with the same pledge and to make his loan repayments on time since it is very important for him to have access to further loans so that he can make progress.  Josias plans to invest his 1,000 Peruvian soles in doing work on the front of his building and, in this way, he hopes to provide good hospitality to his tenants.

loans.use: To buy materials to refurbish his building

loans.name: Amada Brudulbudura

texts.en: Amada R. R. is 58 years old and single. She lives in a house made of cement in an urban area in Guayaquil called Primavera de Duran.  Amada was very young when she started her manicure and pedicure business. With her $1,000 loan, she plans to buy merchandise for her business, such as earrings and bracelets. In the future she hopes to expand her merchandise selection so she can provide more beauty services. Her main problem is her health as she suffers from stomach aches due to gastritis.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for beauty services

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es: Patrocinia, de 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa que es propia junto a su conviviente German (55) y sus 2 jóvenes  hijas, quienes son el impulso de todos sus esfuerzos.Ella decidió instalar un restaurante en su distrito, y sus familiares le ayudaron a organizar el negocio. En la actualidad cuenta con un ayudante  que realiza los mandados y  también le ayuda en la atención a los clientes. Por la buena sazón y precios módicos de sus platillos ha logrado captar pensionistas fijos; y en el negocio ya  lleva cinco años. Según sus palabras su restaurante es el sueño cumplido del negocio propio; porque  depende de ella misma que su puesto surga y tenga  buena concurrencia, pero las ganancias que obtiene la motivan bastante, a pesar del duro trabajo. Es por esta razón que siempre dice que todo sacrificio tiene una buena remuneración, además con  el tiempo desea instalar  su propio local y así ofrecer lo mejor a sus comensales.Es el 14avo crédito que tiene  con MFP, y  se siente muy agradecida con la institución porque recibe todas las facilidades, además  es muy puntual con el  pago de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, pues  es muy solidaria.Patrocinia tiene planeado invertir  los dos mil soles solicitados en la compra de mayor cantidad de  víveres que necesita para brindar una mejor alimentación  a sus consumidores, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Patrocinia is 41 years old.  She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home with her partner, 55 year-old German, and her two young daughters who are the motivation behind all her hard work.

Patrocinia decided to set up a restaurant in her district and her family members helped her to organize the business.  She currently has one helper who does the shopping and also helps to serve the customers.  Owing to the good taste of her meals and their reasonable prices, Patrocinia has managed to attract regular customers.  She has been in her business for five years.

Patrocinia tells us that her restaurant is her dream of owning her own business fulfilled.  It depends on Patrocinia whether her business does well and whether she has a lot of customers.  The profits she makes in her business motivate her a lot, in spite of the hard work.  For this reason, she always says that every sacrifice has its reward.  Over time, Patrocinia would like to set up her own premises and thereby be able to provide her customers with the best.

This is Patrocinia's 14th loan with MFP and she feels very grateful to the institution for having received all her loans.  She is very punctual in making her loan repayments.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank because she is very supportive.  Patrocinia plans to invest her 2,000 Peruvian soles in buying a larger quantity of foodstuffs that she needs to provide better meals to her customers.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy concentrate (animal feed) for her chickens

loans.name: Angela Isabel

texts.es:
Angela Isabel I. tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Camino Viejo en el municipio de Lejamani, Comayagua. Angela tiene una venta de abarroteria, ella inicìo con este negocio luego de que su esposo se cayera de un arbol de mangos y quedara invalido. Como el esposo de Angela no podia seguir trabajando en su condicion la empresa para la cual èl estaba laborando le cancelo sus prestaciones laborales y con ese dinero Angela empezò a comprar los productos que pondria a la venta en su domicilio. Angela tambien trabaja en los cultivos de pepino porque no tiene otra entrada de dinero y eso le ayuda a llevar el pan de cada dia a su familia.

Ella solicita el prestamo para surtir su pulperia con productos como arroz, manteca, pastas, carnes, lacteos, frijoles, refrescos, dulces, galletas, pan, jugos en caja y enlatados, maseca, etc. Con el apoyo del prestamo su pequeño negocio tendra mas y variados productos, y como su esposo le ayuda a atenderlo èl se sentira muy bien de asistirla. 

Su meta es seguir trabajando cada dia para darle educacion a sus hijos ya que uno de ellos esta en cuarto grado y el otro en primer grado en la escuela, y asi hacerlos personas de bien. Tambien espera que su negocio se mantenga estable y que le genere las suficientes ganancias para sostener a su esposo e hijos. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera ser puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en: dfadasf

loans.use: Comprar productos de abarroteria en general

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: El sr. Freddy de 25  años de edad soltero, vive en la zona de Huayllani , vive en la casa de sus padres , es joven independiente, tiene su taxi esta afiliado a un radio móvil,  trabaja de lunes a sábado de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 22:00, el ayuda a su padres en los gastos del hogar, es un joven muy responsable ,  el préstamo lo destinara para la refacción y mantenimiento de  su movilidad  es muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
Freddy is 25 years old, single, and lives in Huayllani, in his parents' home.  He is an independent young man.  He owns a taxi and is affiliated with a radio taxi company.  He works from Monday to Saturday, from 6.00am to 10.00pm, and helps his parents with their household expenses.  He is a very responsible young man.

Freddy will use his loan to have his car refurbished and to have some maintenance work done on it.  He is a very hard-working man who is dedicated to his family.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To have his car refurbished and to have some maintenance work done on it

loans.name: Sagitario Group

texts.es: Teresa H. pertenece a la alcancía comunal Sagitario ubicada en el distrito de Lurigancho Chosica, esta alcancía está conformada por 7 integrantes las cuales son mujeres con muchas ganas por salir adelante y tener éxitos en sus negocios, una de ella es Teresa H. de 46 años de edad y madre soltera de 2 hijas, una de ella la mayor estudia cosmetología y la ultima está terminando colegio y le gustaría estudiar nutrición en la universidad. Teresa se dedica a la crianza de porcinos hace más de 7 años, teniendo alrededor de 40 porcinos en su haber. La crianza de  estos animales es muy difícil pero para Teresa es el trabajo de cada día y ya está acostumbrada a ello, ella comenzó con esta crianza a raíz que le regalaron dos cerditos pequeños y de ahí emprendió con este negocio, que le ha dado muchas satisfacciones como el poder costear los estudios de su hija mayor. En el futuro le gustaría tener un restaurant. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Teresa H. is a member of the Sagitario communal bank located in Lurigancho district, Chosica.  It has nine members who are women that very much want to get ahead and be successful in their businesses.

One of them is Teresa H., 46.  She is a single mother of two daughters.  The eldest is studying Cosmetology and the youngest is finishing high school and would like to study Nutrition at the university.

Teresa has raised pigs for over 7 years having about 40 pigs.  Raising pigs is very difficult but for Teresa this is her daily work and she is used to it. She started in this occupation because someone gave her two piglets once and that’s when she started the business.  It has given her a lot of satisfaction like being able to pay for her oldest daughter’s studies.

In the future she’d like to have a restaurant.  She will use the recent loan to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Rosario De Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosario Z. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su gente es muy cordial y amable quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su centro histórico es conocido por la belleza arquitectónica.

La Señora. Rosario tiene 34 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 14, 9 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y es mas para sus gastos, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su última hija en una escuela de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Rosario es comerciante, vende ambulantemente repuestos de ollas de presión y más artículos, labora en esta actividad hace 7 años desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, después de laborar en esta actividad trabaja en un hotel desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche  de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra 6 años en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio en la compra de mas repuestos. Su meta es engrandecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario Z. is a member of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras" (Triumphant Women) community bank and lives in Cuenca city center.  This city has a cold climate but its people are very kind and friendly and they maintain their culture and traditions.  The historic city center is known for its architectural beauty.

Rosario is 34 years old, divorced, and has 3 children aged 18, 14 and 9.  Her eldest child works.  Her middle child is studying in high school and her youngest daughter is at an elementary school in the city.  She does not own her own home but rents instead.

Rosario is a saleswoman.  She sells spare parts for pressure cookers and other items as an itinerant street vendor.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She works from 9.00am to 3.00pm.  After she finishes this work, she works in a hotel from 4.00pm to 7.00pm every day of the week.  She has been a member of her community bank for six years and she likes it because she has good friends there.  She will invest her loan money in her business, in buying more spare parts.  Her goal is to further expand her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for pressure cookers

loans.name: Rocio Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Roció C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su gente es muy cordial y amable quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su centro histórico es conocido por la belleza arquitectónica.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años, es separada hace 3 años y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 11 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo  trabaja y estudia en la universidad, sus dos últimos hijos  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Roció labora en una panadería que es de su propiedad, aprendió este oficio trabajando en el y también ha seguido algunos cursos, lleva  trabajando en esta actividad hace 18 años, trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche  de domingo a domingo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y con el dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina, manteca etc., y más materia prima. Su meta es engrandecer mucho más su panadería.
texts.en:
Rocio C. is a member of the community bank Mujeres Triunfadoras ("Successful Women"). She lives in Cuenca, a city of cold weather and very friendly and kind people who keep their culture and traditions. Cuenca's old town is renowned for its architectural beauty.

Rocio is 39 years old and she separated from her partner 3 years ago. She has three children aged 18, 11 and 7 years old. Her eldest son works and goes to university. The two younger ones go to school in the city. Thanks to her hard work she has managed to build her own house.

Rocio works in a bakery she owns herself. She learned the craft by working and she has also taken some courses. She has been in this line of business for 18 years. She works 8am to 10pm from Sunday to Sunday. 

She has been a community bank member for three years. She is going to invest the loan money in the purchase of flour, butter and other ingredients. Her goal is to expand the bakery.

loans.use: Buy flour, butter, eggs, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana, de  50 años, vive con su esposo  Felipe y  tienen 9 hijos, pero solo vive con los dos menores. En armonía  habitan  su casa que es  propia, y esta ubicada en una comunidad en la selva central peruana.Su sonrisa muestra la apacible vida de Susana, ya que junto a Felipe, su eterno compañero comparte el cuidado de sus sembríos, desde hace 26 años. Sus siembras de café y plátanos, son las mejores frutas  de su zona, pues su secreto según dice es  “cuidarlos con mucho amor y dedicación”. En todo este tiempo logró obtener 6 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, pues gracias a su buen juicio en las ventas, puede comercializar su café a buen precio; de la misma manera su cosecha de plátano de la variedad seda, le otorga buenos dividendos, pues esa variedad escasea. Entre los  planes de Susana, se encuentran alquilar más terrenos agrícolas para incursionar en la siembra de otros  productos como maíz y yuca.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmas”, y es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde es muy solidaria y responsable.Susana tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá en su próximo cultivo, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Susana, 50, lives with her husband Felipe with whom she has 9 children, although only the two youngest ones live with them. They all live in harmony in their own house, located in a community in the central rainforest area in Peru. Susana's smile reflects her peaceful life. She has been tending the crops alongside Felipe, her eternal companion, for 26 years. Their banana and coffee crops bear the best fruits in the area, and she says that the secret is "to look after them with love and dedication". In all this time she has managed to extend her farms to 6 hectares of land thanks to her good sense in selling and being able to sell her coffee at a good price. Her banana crops also provide them with good dividends because they are of the scarce "silk" variety.

Susana's plans include leasing more farming land to venture into new products such as corn and yuca. She is a member of the communal bank "Las Palmas" ("The Palm Groves") and this is her third loan with MFP. She is very supportive and responsable. Susana plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of several bags of fertiliser, which she will use for her next crop, to help her continue to progress.

loans.use: Buy fertiliser to improve her crops.

loans.name: Rosa Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa T. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su gente es muy cordial y amable quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su centro histórico es conocido por la belleza arquitectónica.

La Señora Rosa tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Rosa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, actividad que desempeña hace 2 años y labora solo los fines de semana desde las 9 a de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, los demás días de la semana se dedica a la atención de su papelería, este local lo tiene hace 15 años, labora en el desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y de domingo a domingo, en este trabajo recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, ya que también trabaja de domingo a domingo en el cuidado de dos ancianitos.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de de mas productos para su papelería, es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes en cada reunión salen de sus rutinas diarias. Su meta es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa T. is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Triunfadoras."  She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and its people are very friendly.  The people of this city maintain their culture and traditions.  The historic center of this city is known for its beautiful architecture.

Rosa is 38 years old, married and has 2 children aged 15 and 6 years.  Her oldest daughter is in high school, and her youngest son goes to a school in the city.  Her husband works as a private employee.  They don't have their own home so they live in a rented dwelling.

Rosa is a trader who sells all types of clothing.  She has been doing this work for 2 years, and works only on the weekends from 9am until 5pm.  The other days of the week she works in her stationery goods store, which she has had for 15 years.  There she works from 8am until 7 at night.  Her store is open every day, and her children help her run the store, since she also cares for two elderly people on a daily basis.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of more products for her stationery store.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 6 years, and she likes it because she has very good friends in the group, and she is able to leave her daily routines to attend the meetings.  Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, paper and other stationery products

loans.name: Las Lideres De America Group

texts.es: Nelly Q.,  es integrante de la alcancía comunal Las Líderes De América la cual está conformada por 7 integrantes que en su totalidad son todas mujeres con gran motivación y empeño por salir adelante en sus negocios propios. Una de ella es Nelly Q. de 50 años de edad y madre de 5 hijos de los cuales el ultimo a un es menor de edad, ella se dedica todos los días a la venta de anticuchos (una comida típica de la zona), y lleva con este negocio hace más de un año y comenzó en el por iniciativa de su hija ya que ella también se dedica a la misma actividad económica. Gracias a estos ingresos económicos a podido lograr comprar muebles para su casa y poder costear los gastos diario del hogar, en el futuro le gustaría incrementar su puesto de trabajo  darle mejorías y una mejor infraestructura. Con el reciente préstamo lo piensa invertir en la compra de bebidas gaseosas para este verano.
texts.en:
Nelly Q. is a member of the "Las Líderes De América" (Leaders of America) community bank which has 7 female members who have great motivation and determination to get ahead in their businesses.

One of the group's members is 50 year-old Nelly Q..  She has 5 children, one of whom is still dependent.  Nelly works every day selling kebabs (a traditional food in the area).  She has been in this business for more than one year and she started her business on the suggestion of her daughter since she is in the same business.  Thanks to this income, Nelly has been able to buy furniture for her home and cover her daily household expenses.  In the future, she would like to expand her business, improve it and give it better infrastructure.  She plans to invest her loan in buying soda for this summer.

loans.use: To buy soda

loans.name: Nati

texts.es: La señora Nati es una cliente muy antigua en la institución esta desde la gestión 2002, en el proceso de su historia crediticia demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad, la señora es una persona muy trabajadora, trabaja todos los días, ella tiene dos actividades una de ellas es la venta de tenis nuevos en la feria 16 de julio, esta feria se apertura los días jueves y domingo, esta feria es muy popular por la gran cantidad de productos que presenta y por los precios bajos,  los demás días vende ropa de lana nueva en la ceja parte central de el alto, la compra de los productos como ser tenis los compra por mayor esta compra es sacrificada ya que realiza la compra en la madrugada, prácticamente ella no descansa ningún día, ella  es separada tiene una hija, ella a cuido a su hija desde pequeña y le hizo estudiar, el objetivo de la señora Nati es que su hija en un futuro sea una persona de bien y una buena profesional, con el dinero del crédito comprara ropa por mayor para las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Nati is a very long-standing member of the institution.  She has been a member since 2002.  Throughout her loan history, she has shown responsibility and punctuality in making her repayments.  Nati is a very hard-working person who works every day.  She has two business activities.  One is selling new sneakers in the '16 de julio' market.  This market is open every Thursday and Sunday and is very popular because of the large quantity of products which are sold there and their low prices.  On other days, she sells new woollen clothes in La Ceja, the central part of El Alto.  She buys her products, such as the sneakers, wholesale.  It is hard work making her purchases since she makes them very early in the morning.  She virtually doesn't rest at all.

Nati is separated and has one daughter.  She has had responsibility for her daughter since she was young and has educated her.  Nati's goal is for her daughter to become a good person in the future.  She will use her loan money to buy clothes wholesale for the end-of-year festive season.

loans.use: To buy clothes wholesale for the end-of-year season

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 48 años, y  enviudo hace 12 años; pero a pesar de esto cuido muy bien de sus cinco  hijos, y los ha sacado adelante. Habita su casa propia que esta ubicada en una comunidad de la selva central peruana.Su lucha fue constante, pues después de la muerte de su esposo tenía que obtener mayores ingresos, es por esta razón que hace 10 años instaló un negocio de venta de dulces y helados en su casa. A pesar del poco tiempo que dispone, trabaja arduamente, ya que en verano tiene gran acogida, paralelamente a esta actividad  siembra plátano y café en sus dos hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Para sacar adelante a sus hijos desea instalar  más tiendas de comestibles en las zonas aledañas a su comunidad, pues son zonas alejadas y calcula que  no tendría mucha competencia, además sus ganancias aumentaran bastante.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmas”, y este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, además  asegura podrá adquirir buenas experiencias para el logro de sus objetivos.Para obtener un buen grano de café, María piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en la renovación de sus plantaciones, y  también quiere  surtir su tienda de comestibles, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old.  She has been a widow for 12 years but, in spite of this, she has cared very well for her five children and has managed to get them ahead in life.  She lives in her own home which is located in a community in the central Peruvian jungle.  María's struggle has been constant since, following the death of her husband, she had to make more income.  For this reason, 10 years ago, she set up a business selling sweet treats and iced treats in her home.

In spite of the little time that she has available María works hard since her business is very popular in the summer.  In parallel with this business, she also grows bananas and coffee on her two hectares of farmland.  To get her children ahead in life, she would like to set up more food stores in the areas neighboring her community since they are remote areas and she figures that she will not have much competition.  In addition, this will increase her profits.

María belongs to the "Las Palmas" community bank and this is the first loan that she has had with MFP.  She assures us that she will be able to gain good experience in achieving her goals.  In order to achieve a good coffee bean, María is planning to invest her loan money in renovating her plantations.  She would also like to stock her food store.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy plantations and to buy foodstuffs for her grocery store

loans.name: Rosa Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa G. es socia del banco comunal El Crédito y vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, también es muy rica en su cultura, tradiciones y gastronomía, Cuenca es cuna de grandes poetas y deportistas.
 
La Señora Rosa tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos  de 22, 15, 14 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo y tercer hijo estudian en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuela de la ciudad. su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en un taxi que es de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal, actividad que desempeña hace 10 años, vende sus productos en el tiempo libre que tiene ya que también trabaja como secretaria de un radio taxi y tiene horarios rotativos, trabaja de domingo a domingo hace 5 años.

Es el octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que cuenta con un grupo muy unido de mujeres. El nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos Yanbal. Su meta es  crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa G. is a member of the "El Crédito" (The Loan) community bank and lives in El Cebollar sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the architectural beauty of its historic center.  It is also very rich in its culture, traditions and gastronomy.  Cuenca is the birthplace of great poets and sportsmen.

Rosa is 38 years old, married, and has four children aged 22, 15, 14 and 8.  Her eldest son is married and lives independently.  Her second and third children are studying in high school and her youngest daughter is studying at an elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a driver and works in his own taxi.  They do not own their own home but live in a family member's home.

Rosa's business is selling Yanbal products.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  She sells her products in her spare time since she also works as a secretary for a taxi company where she works shifts.  She works all week and has done this for 5 years.

This is Rosa's eighth loan through her community bank and she likes her community bank because it is a very united group of women.  She will invest her new loan in buying more Yanbal products.  Her goal is to grow her business even more.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, de 36 años, esta  casado con Elizabeth (35),y  juntos habitan su casa alquilada en compañía de  sus 2 hijos y esta  ubicada en una comunidad  de la selva central peruana.Él  se declara como un  “mil oficios” (trabaja en diversas actividades). Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la agricultura y es  su principal actividad económica durante todos los fines de semana. Se la pasa cuidando de sus cultivos de plátano y café, y aunque siente su cuerpo cansado después de una semana de trabajo arduo igual abona, cosecha y limpia sus cultivos. Su esposa  comercializa los productos en los depósitos de frutas que existen en la ciudad, además trabaja de lunes a viernes como albañil, y  le pagan un promedio de 40 soles diarios. “Trabajando podemos salir adelante”, afirma, es por esta razón que  esta pensando comprar más terrenos agrícolas para sembrar en mayores cantidades para mejorar sus ganancias.Él pertenece al banco comunal “La Palmas”, y es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ha demostrado ser una persona honesta, trabajadora y solidaría.Sus cultivos necesitan de constante abono para poder crecer sin dificultades y tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la  compra de ocho sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old.  He is married to Elizabeth (35) and they live in a rented house with their 2 children in a community in the central Peruvian jungle.  Samuel describes himself as 'a man of a thousand trades' (he carries out several business activities).

Samuel has been farming for 15 years and this is his main business activity every weekend.  He looks after his banana and coffee crops and, although his body is tired after a week of hard work he applies manure to his crops, harvests them and weeds them.  His wife sells products in the fruit warehouses in the city.   Samuel also works as a construction worker from Monday to Friday.  They pay him, on average, 40 Peruvian soles a day.  "We can get ahead working together" he says.  For this reason, Samuel is thinking of buying more farmland to grow in larger quantities so that he can improve his profits.

Samuel belongs to the "Las Palmas" community bank and this is his third loan with MFP.  He has shown himself to be an honest, hard-working and supportive person.  His crops need constant applications of manure so that they can grow without problems and he is planning to spend his money on buying eight sacks of manure.

loans.use: To buy manure to improve his crops

loans.name: German

texts.es: El Sr. German cliente que se encuentra en el primer ciclo dentro de la institución  vino por recomendación de otros clientes,  el  señor German vive en la zona de Rosas Pampa, es viudo , tiene casa propia vive con sus dos hijas menores de edad se dedica  como actividad principal al negocio de la compra y venta de herramientas, equipos de sonido , radios , Dvds , televisores  y otros (por ocasión)  en la feria 16 de julio el alto siendo ambulante, los días jueves y domingos. Los demás días se dedica al trabajo de la plomería y a la crianza de animales domésticos  los cuales representan una entrada económica , el destino del crédito es para incrementar su capital de trabajo invertirá en la compra de herramientas y aparatos de sonido, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: German is requesting his first loan with this partner, and is recommended by other clients. German, a widower, lives in his own house in the Rosas Pampa neighborhood with his two daughters who are minors. His main activity is running a business buying and selling tools, sound equipment, radios, DVDs, televisions, and occasionally other items at the 16 de Julio / El Alto Market from a street kiosk on Thursdays and Sundays. The other days he works as a plumber and raises domestic animals, which provides a source of income. The purpose of the loan is to increase his working capital by purchasing tools and sound equipment. He is very grateful to the partner for their support.

loans.use: Purchase of sound equipment and tools.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Teresa es socia del banco comunal El Crédito y vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, también es muy rica en su cultura, tradiciones y gastronomía, Cuenca es cuna de grandes poetas y deportistas.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 64 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad y 3 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su  hijo soltero vive en su casa, trabaja y ayuda  en la economía del hogar. Su esposo es comerciante ambulante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Teresa se dedica a la venta de confitería  actividad que la realiza hace 17 años, tiene un puesto propio y trabaja de 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde  de lunes a viernes.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 12 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más confitería para su negocio. Su meta es  crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is a member of the communal  bank El Crédito and lives in the center of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the archeological beauty of its historical center.  It is also rich in culture, traditions and gastronomy.  Cuenca is the birthplace of great poets and sportsmen.

Our member is 64 years old, married and has 4 children.  All are adults and 3 are married and live on their own.  Her single son lives at home, works and helps with household expenses.  Her husband is a street vendor.  They don’t own their own home so they rent.

Mrs. Teresa works selling sweets which she has done for 17 years.  She has her own stall and works from 6 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon from Monday to Friday.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years.  She will invest her new loan in the purchase of more sweets for her business.  Her goal is to further grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase sweets such as chocolates, candy, gum, lollipops, etc.

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Fiorela; La socia tiene 30 años D. edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, patos y pollos, la socia lleva  un par D. años en este negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra maíz, verduras como lechuga, tomate entre otros, la socia es una persona bien emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como semillas para que pueda sembrar en su chacra, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. semillas y alimentos para sus animales como pasto,maíz entre otros. 

Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura,crianza D. animales menores como cuyes,conejos y gallinas entre otros ,también tienen su tienda D. abarrotes siendo la actividad principal la agricultura. 

la socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion communal bank in Urubamba province, Cusco department.

She is Fiorela, 30, in a common-law marriage and she has 2 children.  She raises small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks and hens.  Fiorela has been in this business for the last two years and she also grows corn and vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, etc.  She is a hard-working woman with great hopes to get her family ahead.

Fiorela is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as seeds to plant on her farm.  She will use the loan to buy seeds and animal food such as grass, corn, and more.

The other members also raise small animals such as guinea pigs, rabbits, roosters, etc and they have grocery stores since these are the main product of agriculture.

The member values the loan and promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as seeds

loans.name: Bokk Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK LIG. est crée le 14 mai 2010. il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de GABAR

Madame NDEYE D. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter des moutons qu'elle revendra au bout de 05 à 06 mois

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale
texts.en:
The Bokk LiG. cooperative group was created on May 14, 2010.  It is made up of twelve women from the same village who came together through proximity and affinity.  The group is a part of the Gabar Banc Villageois.

Mrs. Ndeye D., standing at the right of the photo, is the group leader.  She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of seven dependent children.  She fattens sheep, and her new loan will allow her to buy sheep which she will resell after five or six months.  Her goal is to strengthen her savings and support her husband in the care of their family.

loans.use: Purchase of sheep to fatten for market

loans.name: Ananias

texts.es: Ananias, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de  su hijo Samuel (15), y habitan en una ciudad ubicada en la selva central peruana. Desde hace 20 años, se dedica a la siembra de café y plátanos, en sus terrenos propios los que después de mucho cuidado comercializa a buenos precios. Según afirma en su última cosecha, sembró maíz y obtuvo buenas ganancias de las ventas. Lo que le disgusta, son las constantes bajas de precio de sus productos en el mercado; pero a pesar de los inconvenientes, desea sembrar en mayores cantidades. Para el futuro tiene planeado dedicarse a la compra y venta de café, al por mayor, pues según dice ya tiene compradores en la ciudad de Pichanaki, y espera continuar progresando.Él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmas”, y este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como socio nuevo, espera trabajar con ahínco para el logro de los objetivos comunes del grupo.La limpieza de la maleza de los terrenos agrícolas es muy importante, por ello con el dinero del préstamo piensa invertir en la compra de herramientas,  además de varios sacos de abono, así espera mejorar su producción y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ananias is 49 years old.  He lives in his own home with his son Samuel (15).  They live in a town in the central Peruvian jungle.

Ananias has been growing coffee and bananas on his own land for 20 years.  He has cared for his land for a long time and, as a result, his crops now sell for a good price.  He says that his last harvest was corn and he made good profits from his sales.   What upsets Ananias is the constant lowering of prices for his products in the market.    However, in spite of these difficulties, he would like to grow his crops in larger quantities.  In the future, he plans to commit himself to buying and selling coffee wholesale as he says that he already has buyers in the city of Pichanaki and he hopes to continue making progress.

Ananias belongs to the "Las Palmas" community bank and this is his first loan with MFP.  As a new member, he hopes to work hard to achieve the common goals of the group.  Clearing the weeds from his farmland is very important to Ananias and, for this reason, he plans to use his loan money to invest in buying tools, as well as several sacks of manure.  In this way he hopes to improve his production and his profits.

loans.use: To buy tools and manure for his plantations

loans.name: Afiafi

texts.en:
Afiafi L. is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Asau.  She is engaged and has 8 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Afiafi plants and harvests vegetables for sale.  Afiafi has been engaged in this business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month.

In 2008, Afiafi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting her first loan from SPBD, for 1000 WST to purchase fertilizer such as manure.   Afiafi plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Luzbeida Florixa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a  la señora Luzbeida, ella tiene 38 años de edad, está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace tiempo tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Estudio en la universidad y obtuvo el título de  Licda. En Párvulo, trabaja de maestra por contrato en una escuela de la localidad.
 
Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas).  También vende útiles y materiales de oficina, todos sus productos los vende  a través de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación. Trabaja 4 días a la semana por las tardes ya que en las mañanas trabaja de maestra. Su mercadería la recibe en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y útiles de oficina. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la tesorera del Banco. Sus sueños son tener un nombramiento como maestra y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en: The 1 De Agosto ["August 1st"] Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts, known on national and international levels. It is the home of the famous straw hats. In this area, we meet Mrs Luzbeida. She is 38 and single, but she has two children from an old relationship. They are 15 and 8, and are in high school and elementary school. She went to university and obtained a bachelor's degree in teaching kindergarten. She works as a teacher on contract at an elementary school in her area. She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories) through catalogues. She also sells tools and office supplies. She sells all of her products through orders that her customers make in advance. She works four days a week in the afternoons, and works in the mornings as a teacher. She receives her merchandise in Portoviejo. This loan is for purchasing perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and office supplies. She has been part of this Community Bank from the beginning; she is the treasurer. Her dreams are to have an appointment as a teacher and for her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and office supplies.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka S. is a 28-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai.  She is married with no children. To make a living, Eka operates a family member's fishing business — primarily harvesting and selling wild-caught fish. Eka has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 310 WST a month.

In 2008, Eka joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD and is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST to rent a fishing boat. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eka from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to rent a fishing boat

loans.name: Yeggo Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité YEGGO est créé le 14 mai 2010. Il est composé de 08 femmes issues du même village. Elles se sont constituées en groupe par des liens de voisinage et d'affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de GABAR.

Madame AWA B. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle mariée et mère de 08 enfants. 

Elle fait du maraîchage. Elle cultive des carottes, des choux, de la  tomate et du persil, Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 15 ans

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des semences et des intrants agricoles

Elle participe financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son épargne
texts.en: The YEGGO solidarity group was created on May 14, 2010. It is composed of 8 women from the same village. Their group was formed by community and kinship ties. The group is affiliated with the GABAR Banc Villageois.  Mrs. B., standing at the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of eight children.  She is a truck farmer, growing carrots, cabbage, tomato and parsley.  She has been in  this business for over 15 years.  With her new loan she will buy seeds and agricultural supplies.  She contributes financially to the support of her family while increasing her savings.

loans.use: To develop her truck farming business

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Anastacia Lidia de 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y forma parte del grupo “Fortaleza”, formado por 10 integrantes, todos ellos residentes de la zona de Raúl Porras Barrenechea en el distrito de Carabayllo.

Hace siete años la Sra. Lidia se dedica a la administración y atención de su bodega la cual esta ubicada en su domicilio en un pequeño espacio ambientado para éste negocio., Empezó vendiendo sólo gaseosas, luego pudo invertir un poco de su capital en cervezas y poco a poco fue agregando golosinas, abarrotes y  aumentando muchísimo más el stock de bebidas.
Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido hacerse cargo del pago de estudios de su hija.
Una de sus metas es poner un Taller de costura.
El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de bebidas para surtir su bodega.
texts.en: Mrs. Anastacia Lidia, age 36, has two children and is part of the Fortaleza ["Strength"] group. The group has 10 members, all residents of the Raúl Porras Barrenechea zone in the Carabayllo district. For seven years Mrs Lidia has worked in her store, which is located in a small space in her home outfitted for the store. When she began, she sold only pop, and later she was able to invest a bit of her capital in beer. Bit by bit she has been accumulating candy and groceries, and increasing her stock of drinks greatly. Thanks to her work, she has been able to take over paying for her daughter's studies. One of her goals is to open a sewing workshop.  She will use the requested loan to invest in the purchase of drinks to stock her store.

loans.use: to be invested in the purchase of drinks to increase stock

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau T. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is engaged and has a small child. To make a living, Sau has a fishing business, primarily harvesting and selling wild-caught fish. She has been in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 270 WST a month.

In 2008, Sau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1800 WST from SPBD which was used to purchase additional fish to raise. She is now requesting a new loan of 2250 WST to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Sau from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Matile

texts.en:
Matile T. is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Lalomalava. She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Matile operates a family member's clothing business providing general clothing/dressmaking services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 450 WST a month.

In 2008, Matile joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 2250 WST which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  The will be the fifth loan taken out by Matile from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Carmen Dalila

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 59 años D. edad y vive junto a su esposo y un sobrino en el sector Portada D. la Sierra del distrito D. Pacasmayo, una zona comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra situada aproximadamente a una hora y media D. distancia D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta D. animales. Carmen cría animales menores como aves D. corral y ovejas en diversos corrales situados en la parte posterior D. su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. la zona y al público en general. 

Carmen desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza D. sus animales, así como para realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales. Con esta inversión ella espera que sus animales se desarrollen D. mejor modo y pueda obtener mejores ingresos D. sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Carmen is 59 and lives with her husband and a cousin in the Portada D. la Sierra sector of the Pacasmayo district, a commercial zone located in the La Libertad region. This zone is located approximately an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She raises and sells animals for a living. Carmen raises small animals such as barnyard birds and sheep in various corrals in the back part of her home. When these animals have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the local businesses and to the general public. Carmen wants to acquire balanced food to better raise her animals. She also wants to make some improvements to the corrals. With this investment, she hopes that her animals will develop better, and that she will be able to make a better income from her sales. In order to achieve her goals she has found it necessary to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to acquire balanced food to better raise her animals.

loans.name: Alexandra Esther

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Alexandra es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 10, 6 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad. Nuestra socia hace algún tiempo estudio belleza en una Academia en Montecristi.

Es así como saco provecho de lo aprendido. Tiene un salón de belleza en el cual  realiza tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas y otros trabajos. Trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios.  También vende productos de Esika, Lebel, Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas).  el cual lo hace al mismo  tiempo cuando realiza sus otros trabajos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, shampoo, permanentes y productos de Avon, Yanbal entre otras. Sus sueños son llegar a tener un SPA.
texts.en: The 1 De Agosto ["August 1st"] Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts, which are known on a national and international level. This location is home of the famous straw hats. Mrs. Alexandra is a founding member of this Community Bank, and she likes it because of the additional benefits that the institution offers and for the ease of getting a loan. She is 33 and married. She and her husband have three children ages 10, 6 and 3. The two oldest are in school. Her husband is a security guard. Alexandra has gone to beauty school at an academy in Montecristi for some time now. This is how she takes advantage of what she is learning: she has a beauty salon where she dyes and cuts hair, paints nails and provides other services. She works from 8 am to 9 pm, and sometimes later if her customers need her. She also sells Esika, Lebel, Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She does this at the same time as she does her other work. She will use this loan to purchase dyes, shampoo, perm materials and Avon and Yanbal products, among other items. Her dream is to have a spa.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, shampoo, perm materials, and Yanbal and Avon products.

loans.name: Taulupe

texts.en:
Taulupe T. is a 40 year old woman living in the town of Lalomalava.  She is married and has six adult children.  To make a living, Taulupe owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Taulupe has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 370 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Taulupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan from SPBD of 2000 WST, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.  This will be her third loan from SPBD.  Taulupe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Yefferson Stalin

texts.es:
Yefferson de 33 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

El heredo una vulcanizadora (un taller pequeño que le dejo su papa para arreglar autos) ya que desde pequeño le enseño esta actividad para que se defienda en la vida.
